loans.name: Arati

texts.en:
41-year-old Arati is a woman of courage and strength. She hails from Falakata. She is married to Dilip, who is a mason by occupation. They are blessed with two sons who are engaged with furniture works. Due to poverty, Arati could not provide much education to her sons. She lives with her family in a small village of Falakata in Alipurduar district.

Her husband’s income is irregular and hardly sufficient for the family. So to help her husband financially, Arati runs her own cattle rearing business. She rears cows and sells cow milk to her neighbors. She also sells cow dung for additional income, which is used as fertilizers by the farmers. By running her own business, she is able to support her family and saves money for a secure future.

However, this ambitious and energetic lady does not want to stop here; she wants to expand her business by selling more milk. Thus Arati seeks to take a loan from BJS (a Kiva partner) to buy a new dairy cow. With the expansion of her business, she is expecting an increase in her monthly income. With the increased income and savings, Arati will be able to expand her existing business further.

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase a cow for her milk supply business.

loans.name: Maa Laxmi Shg 1-C Group

texts.en:
Malte is a 45-year-old married woman from Odisha, India. Her husband is away working abroad. Malte raised their two children on her own. Now the children have grown up, and she has more time to dedicate to other things. She is the one standing to the right.

She has decided to increase the family budget and mix business with pleasure. Malte has opened her own business. Cooking always gave Malte pleasure. She owns a food stall and serves her customers with tasty pizzas, burgers, french fries, and beverages. She earns a good income from her food stall.

Malte, along with her fellow group member, is requesting a loan amount of 36,000 India rupees (INR). She will use her portion of the loan amount to buy more raw materials for her business as well as renovate the roof top of her food stall, which is in a precarious condition.

She is praying right now for your kind hearts to help her. She is aspiring that you won't hesitate to help her. She is assuring you that she will not waste your trust and will preserve this kind of generosity that you will give to her.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials for her business, as well as renovate the roof top of her food stall, which is in a precarious condition.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.pt: A senhora Cecilia é casada, vive com o esposo, tem cinco filhos e uma neta. É comerciante, com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar mercadorias tais como frangos, carnes para revender e produtos de salão de beleza. Tem sonho ampliar o negocio de salão e pretende abrir mais um estabelecimento comercial e adquirir uma viatura mini-bus para negócio.Tem como maior desafio trabalhar cada vez mais e ter mais financiamentos na Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Cecilia is married and lives with her husband. She has five children and one granddaughter. Cecilia has a number of business ventures and with this loan she will buy merchandise like chicken and meat for resale, and also products for her beauty salon.

Cecilia's plans for the future are to expand her beauty salon business, to open a second store, and to buy a small bus to help with her businesses. She wants to challenge herself to work even more and to take out future loans with Hluvuku [Kiva Field Partner].

loans.use: to buy chickens and meat for resale, and to buy products for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.pt: A senhora Cecilia é casada, vive com o esposo, três filhos. É comerciante, com o presente  empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção, cimento, areia, pedra e ferros. Tem sonho de se tornar avicultora de renome e poder empregar outras pessoas.Tem como maior desafio  ter mais financiamentos na Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Cecilia is married and lives with her husband and her three children. She has her own business and she will use this loan to buy construction materials like cement, sand, stone, and iron.

Her dream for the future is to become a well-regarded poultry farmer and to be able to hire other people for this business. In the future she would also like to take out more loans with Hluvuku [Kiva Field Partner].

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, stone, and iron.

loans.name: May Lourdes

texts.en:
May Lourdes is a 30 year old entrepreneur from Talibon, Bohol. She is married and has three children. Her eldest is nine and the youngest is eight months. May Lourdes sells ready to wear clothes or bargain clothes to the people in her area. This type of clothes is also called Ukay-ukay by locals which is like a flea market. In her store she sell bags, clothes, shoes and wallets. She has been in the business for more than 6 years now, earning PHP4000 per month. In addition to this, she also operates a P.O. business (Purchase Order) wherein customers can buy goods using a card in the mall and her being the guarantor.

May Lourdes is requesting a loan to buy more stocks of shorts, shirts, bags and shoes. She will also use the loan as an additional bond for her P.O. business. In the future, May Lourdes dreams of making her business bigger and for it to generate more income.

loans.use: to buy stocks of shorts, shirts, bags and shoes and as an additional bond for her P.O.(Purchase Order)  business.

loans.name: Claudia Fidelia

texts.es:
Claudia, vive junto a su familia y comenta que no tiene familiares en el extranjero, su fuente de ingresos es la elaboración y venta de tortillas, oficio que ha heredado de su familia, lo desempeña de siete de la mañana a cinco de la tarde.
Con el crédito tiene planificado comprar maíz al mayoreo para ahorrar en la inversión y tener materia suficiente para continuar produciendo tortillas para atender las demandas que hacen sus clientes.
Claudia aspira a reparar su vivienda para compartir con su familia un lugar seguro y digno.
texts.en:
Claudia lives with her family and remarks that she does not have any relatives abroad. Her source of income is making and selling tortillas, a trade she inherited from her family. She does this work from seven in the morning until five in the evening.

With this loan she plans to purchase corn at wholesale to conserve her capital and have enough raw material to continue producing tortillas and meet her customers' demands.

Claudia hopes to make repairs to her home and share a safe and dignified dwelling with her family.

loans.use: to purchase corn at wholesale and have enough material to continue making tortillas

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia is a single woman. She describes herself to be God fearing. She operates a chemist's shop. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals.

She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of medicines. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of medicines.

loans.name: Larisa

texts.en:
Larisa is 59 years old. She lives with her son, daughter-in-law and 3 grandchildren in Akhaltsikhe district. Larisa purchased a commercial space and opened a market there and purchased some snacks but has no more money for other products. She has been working as a sales lady at local supermarket and is very experienced in this field.

She needs money to purchase products to resell. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan. With the received credit she will purchase a stock of products and will resell in her newly opened market. Larisa is very hardworking woman and will do her best to make her business profitable. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of products for her newly opened market

loans.name: Nkwa Na Ehia Group

texts.en:
Atta is 45 years old. He is from Assin Fosu in the Assin North District of the Central Region of Ghana. He is the leader of Nkwa Na Ehia group. Atta is married with 6 children. They are all in school.

Atta has his own agro chemicals shop that he has operated for the past 20 years. Aside the chemicals, he also sells spraying machines and cutlasses. Atta is a hard working man who always want to diversity his sources of business income. He has been able to cultivate a cocoa plantation from his business profit and now earns additional income during the major and minor cocoa seasons. Atta started his business with a very small capital and through microfinance support from the field Partners since 2011, he has been able to improve the business. His vision is to expand the business to be able to serve many farmers within his locality.

He needs additional micro loan support to buy more agro chemicals , spraying machines, wellington boots and cutlasses to help meet the demand from his farming customers during the season. Atta has decided to use 60% of the profit to cater for the children education and plow-back the remaining 40%. Atta thanks all his micro lenders for their kind support.

loans.use: To buy agro chemicals, spraying machines, wellington boots and cutlasses for resale

loans.name: Delfina

texts.pt: A senhora Delfina é casada, vive com o esposo,  três filhos. É Docente, com o presente  empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção, cimento, arreia, pedra, barrotes, loiça de casa de banho e ferros. Tem sonho de atingir uma independencia económica estável.Tem como maior desafio  investir construindo a sua própria escola.
texts.en:
Delfina is married and lives with her husband and three children. She works as a teacher and with the money from this loan she will buy construction materials like cement, sand, stone, wooden beams, bathroom tiles, and iron.

Delfina's goals for the future are to achieve financial independence and stability and eventually to invest in the construction of her own school.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, stone, wooden beams, bathroom tile, and iron.

loans.name: Yvette

texts.en:
Yvette is a first-year student at Kepler. Because of her impressive test scores, academic record, and strong character, she was accepted from over 6,000 applicants this year. The first in her family to attend college, Yvette chose Kepler because it because of its reputation for helping its students find job opportunities and build networking skills.
 
Yvette plans to major in Communications with a Concentration in Business, and will graduate Kepler with a BA from an accredited US university. At Kepler, she hopes to gain the professional and business skills to succeed in her career. She would love to work in the arts, particularly film.

loans.use: To pay for a laptop required for a US college degree

loans.name: Yakubu

texts.en: Yakubu is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Kaza Village. Yakubu joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. In the past, Yakubu suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to pay for his children's school fees. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Yakubu will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Yakubu now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields.

loans.name: Ivan

texts.en: Ivan is married and he works as a mason.  Ivan also is a farmer and he needs a loan to buy a milking cow because he wants to work with his wife, who is an experienced woman selling milk and making cheese.  Ivan and his family are living at his parents house.  Ivan would like to be the owner of his own house in the future and to have a big farm.  In the picture Ivan is at his parent's house.

loans.use: to buy a milking cow

loans.name: Bijeshwori

texts.en:
Bijeshwori is 36 years old and is married with one child, aged 7. She started a small mobile repairing center as a business. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid 6 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy mobile accessories and spare parts of mobiles for her business.

In the future, Bijeshwori plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. In the Kathmandu Valley, the small store, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy. Since nowadays everyone uses mobile, there is a great scope for a mobile repair and selling shop. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.

loans.use: to buy some mobile phone accessories

loans.name: Idris

texts.en: Idris is a Babban Gona farmer from Kusa Village. he joined Babban Gona so that he could realise better yields on his farm. Since joining Babban Gona, Idris no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to repair my house or move into a bigger home. Through Babban Gona’s input loan he will have access to top of the range farm inputs such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the national average in Nigeria.  This will see increase him increase his income considerably.  This season Idris has ambitious plans to harvest 50 bags of maize. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Idris now has the opportunity to provide employment to members of my community through my farm.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields.

loans.name: Abiyemeje  A Group

texts.en:
ABIYEMEJE a group led by Valentine who is 33 years old. The group name means “COMMITMENT” in English. She is married with 3 children aged 4-9. She sells vegetables and has been doing in a business for the past 11 years. The group members sell different items and they have same idea for changing their life.

With the loan, Valentine would like to buy more tomatoes, cabbages and carrots for sell. The profits from the business will be used to improve her standards of living and make savings in her business.

loans.use: to buy more tomatoes, cabbages and carrots for selling

loans.name: Maa Laxmi Shg 1-D Group

texts.en:
Nilima is a 27-year-old young lady from Odisha, India. She is the one standing to the right hand side in the photograph. She is an energetic, hardworking and ambitious lady. She is a divorcee and has one daughter in her care. She currently lives in her maternal house with her parents.

Nilima has been engaged in a sewing business for the past three years. She has a good reputation in her community due to her loving nature and kind behavior.

Nilima, along with her group member, is requesting a loan amount of 36,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount in order to purchase a second-hand, fully automated sewing machine in order to process her customers' orders faster and provide them their orders within due course of time.

Nilima dreams of building her new house and opening a new boutique in it.

loans.use: to purchase a second-hand, fully automated sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more stock for both her poultry and second hand clothes businesses.

loans.name: Fran Fernando

texts.es:
Fernando es un hombre soltero con 36 años de edad, que debido a una dura situación económica la cual vivió luego de quedarse sin empleo durante tres meses, encontró un medio por el cual podía salir a delante, se dedicó a la cría de ganado, una actividad que aprendió gracias a las enseñanzas de su madre.
De allí genera muy buenos ingresos con los cuales logra cubrir la mayoría de sus necesidades.
Trabaja todos los días durante 6 horas diarias.

Actualmente se encuentra solicitando un préstamo el cual lo invertirá en la compra de cerdas de cría y alimento para las mismas.

Fernando quiere seguir trabajando hasta cumplir el sueño de comprar una vivienda propia, tener una buena estabilidad económica y gozar de una buena salud.

Con su aporte este hombre podrá cumplir sus sueños, anímese, haga un préstamo.
texts.en:
Fernando, age 36, is single. Due to a difficult economic situation that he experienced after being without employment for three months, he found a way through which he was able to get ahead. He raises livestock. He learned this business activity thanks to his mother's teachings. From here he generates very good income with which he manages to cover most of his necessities. He works every day for six hours a day.

He is currently requesting a loan to buy pigs to raise and to buy feed for them. Fernando wants to continue working to fulfill his dream of buying his own house. He wants to have good financial stability and to enjoy good health. With your support this man will be able to fulfill his dreams. Go for it; make a loan.

loans.use: to buy pigs to raise and to buy feed for them.

loans.name: Komarapalayam Jlg 001 Group

texts.en:
25-year-old Gayathri is the leader of a group of 5 women. She lives with her husband in Namakkal district in Tamil Nadu. Gayathri works as a daily wage labourer to sustain her family. Her work does not pay her enough to keep up with the expenses. Therefore, she underwent training to start her own business.

She plans to make cushions using coir and sell them so she can earn a better income. She expects her income to double with the start of her new business. She needs a loan to purchase raw materials to start this business. Gayathri and group needs a loan of Rs. 100,000. The loan will help these women start their own businesses and contribute to the family financially. They are grateful to their lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to start her cushions making business.

loans.name: Ben

texts.en:
Ben is a married man. He has 1 child. He operates a retail hardware business where he sells bulbs, phone chargers, padlocks and other items. He has been involved in this business for 2 years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital.

He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of chargers, bulbs, padlocks. His business goal is to open other business outlets within 5 years. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully. he will use the anticipated profits to expand business.

loans.use: buy more stock of chargers, bulbs, pad locks

loans.name: Bazargul'

texts.ru: 59 летняя женщина Базаргуль, из района Пяндж. Она имеет троих детей. Базаргуль разведена с мужем и детей вырастила одна. Дети уже взрослые и самостоятельные парни. Базаргуль как и многие жители  республики занимается сельскохозяйственной деятельностью. Этим видом деятельности она занята уже 20 лет. В работе на земле помогает ее дети. Ее деятельность является семейной. Базаргуль имеет не большую часть земли, где она выращивает растение. Она готовиться к посеву нового урожая и по этой причине она обратилась за кредитом. Сейчас главная ее  цель обработать землю минеральными удобрениями и закончить посев. Но для купли достаточного количества минеральных удобрений ей не хватает сумма денег, и по той причине Базаргуль обратилась за кредитом. Она верить в Вас и на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Fifty-nine-year-old Bazargul' is from the Pyandj district of Tajikistan.  She has had three children.  She is divorced from her husband and she has raised her children alone.  Her children are now adult and independent.  Like many Tajiks, Bazargul' makes a living from agriculture.  She has been involved in this activity for the past 20 years and receives help from her children.  Agriculture is a family business.

Bazargul' owns a small plot of land on which she grows crops.  At the moment, she is getting ready for the next planting season, and for this reason she has requested a loan.  Her main goal is to prepare her soil with mineral fertilizers and finish planting.  However, she doesn't have enough money to buy enough mineral fertilizers, which is the reason why she is taking this loan.  She relies on you and on your support.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Joan is 37 years old and has four children who are in school.

Joan has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Joan requested a PHP 16000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional variety of fish to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Joan has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Joan would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional variety of fish to sell

loans.name: Nazeeran

texts.en:
Nazeeran is 46 years old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of four daughters and two sons. She has been running silver crockery store for many years and she is only responsible to feed the entire family.

Nazeeran is applying for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan because she has to purchase different types of silver crockery i.e; jugs, glasses, plates, dinner sets etc. This loan will help her to purchase these items for reselling purpose. So that she can earn maximum profit and increase her daily sales. She can also use the profit amount as savings to fulfill her future needs.
Nazeeran is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to expand her silver crockery (utensils) sale business.

loans.name: Upendo Wa Akina Mama Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand is Susan; she is forty eight years old, married with six children. She is a member of Upendo wa Kinamama group which joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in 2014 and has successfully undergone training on enterprise and financial management. She does cattle and goat keeping alongside crop farming.

She is borrowing from Kiva to buy more goats. She believes to earn more income which will enable her pay school fees for her children.
She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promise to repay on time.

loans.use: to buy more dairy goats for better returns and enable her pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Marvelous

texts.en:
Marvelous has built a very successful grocery store in the Wedza District, Zimbabwe. She used her loan to expand her inventory in order to attract more customers. Her recent purchases included hardware, agricultural supplies, seeds, fertilizers, bicycle parts and farming materials.The profits from her business have provided for her children, her siblings, and two orphans in the community who were in need of support.

Marvelous is also a mentor to other young girls who always encourages them to do good for others and work hard toward accomplishing goals. With her profits, Marvelous was able to buy the family a car – something she thought would never be possible. She also started work on a five-room home for her parents.

She hopes to get another Kiva loan to help her expand her grocery shop and to purchase clothes, sausages and fish. Marvelous would also like to purchase her own shop to reduce her monthly rental expenses. Thanks to the support she received from Kiva on her first loan and the mentoring and training's she received from Camfed, Marvelous has become a leader in her community and her district.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries, clothes , fish and sausages.

loans.name: Purnima

texts.en:
Purnima is 51 years old. She is married and a housewife. She is blessed with three grown-up children (two sons and one daughter). Her elder son is engaged in agricultural work, her younger son is an electrician and her only daughter is married. They live in a remote village, Harinathpur of Falakata, Alipurduar district, in their own mud and straw made house.

Purnima's husband, Kanan, is a farmer by profession. He mainly grows vegetables like potatoes, gourds, ladies fingers, beans, etc. He grows quality products and his prices are also cheaper, so the number of his customers is increasing gradually. Now he wants to cultivate eggplant.
Thus, Purnima is requesting a loan to buy eggplant seeds, pesticide, fertilizer, etc., to grow eggplant to get a good harvest and revenue, as well. With the profit from this business Purnima hopes she can secure some money for her family’s well being.

Purnima dreams to purchase more farmland to cultivate more and expand their business with the profit.

She is thankful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs for eggplant cultivation.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Evangeline works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Evangeline is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, vegetables, spices, etc. for her food vending business.

Evangeline has been sustaining her business activities through her past 1 loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, vegetables, spices, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Jose Balbino

texts.es:
José, requiere de un nuevo crédito para tener todo listo e iniciar la próxima temporada de siembra, comprara abono, insecticidas y cubrirá los gastos de preparación del atierra para cultivar maíz, esperando tener un buen resultado.
Los financiamientos le son de apoyo a José para obtener cosechas sanas y abundantes, además le es de mucho beneficio por la facilidad de pago que le brinda la institución y su estilo de vida está mejorando.
texts.en:
Jose needs a new loan to have everything ready and to begin the next planting season. He will buy fertilizer and insecticides, and will cover the costs of preparing the ground to grow corn. He is hoping to have a good result.

This funding will support Jose in obtaining healthy and abundant harvests. In addition, it is beneficial due to the ease of payment that the institution offers. His way of life is improving.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticides, and to cover the costs of preparing the ground to grow corn.

loans.name: Jean Claude

texts.en:
Jean Claude is a first-year student at Kepler. He grew up with his seven siblings on a farm in southern Rwanda. After a rigorous application process based on grades, test scores, and personal interviews, he was accepted from over 6,000 applicants this year. Jean Claude chose Kepler because of its academic rigor and focus on business skills. 

Jean Claude plans to major in Communications with a Concentration in Business, and will graduate from Kepler with a BA from an accredited US university. After graduating, he hopes to open his own business. At Kepler, he believes his biggest strength will be his ability to work effectively with teams.

loans.use: to pay for a laptop required for a US college degree.

loans.name: Enthia

texts.en:
Enthia is 36 years old and lives in the Wedza District of Zimbabwe with her husband and three children. Enthia is passionate about helping the elderly and working with schools in her community to improve children’s well-being. She rents a table at a local flea market where she sells jeans, shirts, dresses, shoes, and jackets for a living. She started the business in 2005 after her husband lost his job. She really loves her shop and would like to increase her sales volume in order to expand the business. Her proceeds are used to improve her living standards and to create employment in her community. Enthia’s business is doing very well.

When she received the Kiva loan she used it to purchase more stock for her stall at the local flea market. This boosted both her sales and profits. She used the profits to pay school fees for her two children, extend her house, and venture into another lucrative business so as to supplement her income. She is very grateful for the loan and hopes to get another larger loan so that she can purchase more clothes for resale and offer variety of clothes form baby clothes to adult clothes.

loans.use: to purchase more jeans, shirts, dresses, shoes, and jackets.

loans.name: Mwihangiri Self Help Group

texts.en:
Susan, holding the passbook is 43 years old, married and blessed with two children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from the trainings especially enterprise development and financial management.

She practices dairy and poultry farming. She also operates kindergarten to supplement her income. She is borrowing to buy dairy feeds and poultry feeds to boost production. This will enable her increase income and use the profits to buy chairs and build temporary classes for the kindergarten children.

She is grateful to Kiva lenders and promises to repay it promptly.

loans.use: to buy dairy and poultry feeds hence boost production for increased income and use the profit to buy chairs and build temporary classes for the kindergarten.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy nachos, tortillas, tomatoes, chilies, onions, meat, cheese, and other materials that she needs to make her sales.

loans.name: Brenda Beatriz

texts.es:
Brenda, con el financiamiento anterior mantiene su negocio de venta de tortillas y cosméticos en el mercado, sus nuevos recursos económicos le dan oportunidad de costear gastos familiares y personales sin mucha dificultad.
Hace una nueva solicitud de crédito para comprar lociones, cosméticos, desodorantes, etc., para seguir teniendo un inventario del gusto de sus clientes, tiene la ilusión de lograr resultados positivos con la nueva inversión.
texts.en:
With her previous loan Brenda maintains her business of selling tortillas and cosmetics at the market. Her new financial resources give her the opportunity to pay for the family and personal expenses without much difficulty.

She is making a new request for a loan in order to buy lotions, cosmetics, and deodorants, etc. in order to continue having inventory according to her customers' preferences. She is looking forward to achieving positive results with the new investment.

loans.use: to buy lotions, cosmetics, and deodorants, etc. in order to continue to have inventory according to her customers' preferences.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda works hard to support her family. Erlinda is married and has a candle making business in the Philippines.

Erlinda requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to purchase more materials like wax, wick, etc. for her business.

Erlinda has been in this business for 6 years now.

In the future, Erlinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more materials like wax, wick, etc. for her candle making business.

loans.name: Vellur Jlg -006 Group

texts.en: Radha is the leader of a group of 5 women- Vellur JLG-006. She is married and a mother of 3 children. She lives with her family in the Tiruchirappalli district in Tamil Nadu. She works as a daily wage labourer. Her income from her current job is not only insufficient but also seasonal in nature. She wants a more steady source of income and hence underwent training in making sweets made out of peanuts. She now wants to start a business of her own. She hopes that the increased income would help her secure her children’s future. Radha, along with the other members of the group, seeks a group of Rs. 100,000. The loan would be used to purchase raw materials to start their respective businesses. These women are grateful to you for your loan.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to start her sweets making business

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 38-year-old widow with five children. She lives in the Wedza District of Zimbabwe, and operates a fruit and vegetable stall at the local business centre. She sells apples, bananas, oranges, cabbages, and tomatoes. Grace is a Camfed Learner Guide. She is also very encouraging of other young women in the community who wish to start their own businesses.

When Grace received her loan, she expanded her vegetable vending business. She increased her stocks and now sells a variety of vegetables. Grace used the first Kiva loan she received to buy apples, bananas, oranges, cabbages, and tomatoes for the current stall and would like to open another stall, as well. Grace is managing to send her child to a better school and pays her rental bills on time. She desires to extend her business so that she can have another table of goods at the other side of the market in Wedza centre.

She hopes to get a second Kiva loan so that she expands her business.

loans.use: To buy more apples, bananas, oranges, cabbages, and tomatoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to change the tires on her vehicle.  She feels that she will travel safer and more promptly to where her customers need her massage and physical therapy services.

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en: Solomon is a married man. He has 4 children. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a retail business where he sells utensils. He has been involved in this business for 8 years. His business is located in a market and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be fragile goods which break easily. He will use the Kes 70,000 loan to buy more stock of utensils. His business goal is to own a supermarket within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will improve his living standards. He will use the anticipated profits to open new shop.

loans.use: buy more stock of utensils

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is a married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself to be intelligent. She operates a retail business where she sells bananas, coconuts,onions,tomatoes and other items. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are locals. She will use the Kes 100,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables. Her business goal is to increase sales within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a good educated family. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Ainagul

texts.ru: Айнагул, 57 лет, замужем, 3 сыновей. У нее средне-специальное образование, она целеустремленна, трудолюбивая, ответственная. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она на протяжении 25 лет занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду Айнагул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 6 коров, 65 овец, лошадь. На 3,0 Га земли она выращивает картофель, ячмень. Для содержания скота имеются все условия, также есть трактор с телегой и ковшом для оказания услуг населению. Ежемесячный доход составляет 16,000 сомов (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Айнагул обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 35,000 сом (KGS) на покупку жеребят для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Айнагул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и ремонт сараев.
texts.en:
Ainagul is 57, married, and she has three sons.  She has a specialized secondary education and is hardworking, responsible, and very focused on her goals.  For the past 25 years she has been involved in animal husbandry and agriculture, two activities which constitute her family's main source of income.  Thanks to her very hard work, she now has six cows, 65 sheep and one horse on her farm.  She also grows potatoes and barley on three hectares of land.  Ainagul has everything that she needs to take care of her livestock.  She also has a tractor with a trailer and excavator which she uses to render services to the local residents.

Ainagul makes a monthly income of 16,000 som (KGS).  Eager to further grow her farming business, she has turned to Bai Tushum and requested a loan of 35,000 som (KGS) to buy a few foals and increase her headcount of farm animals.  She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further increase the size of her herd and to renovate her barns.

loans.use: to buy a few foals in order to increase her headcount of farm animals.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience offers guidance and support to secondary school children as a Camfed Learner Guide volunteer. Patience is 28 years old. She also runs her own business. Over the last year, she has grown her poultry business to its current capacity – producing about 100 broiler birds every six weeks and selling them to the local residents. Patience started the business when her family started facing financial difficulties last year, and Patience knew that poultry production is a thriving business in her community. The loan has also made a great impact in her personal life as her standard of living has improved significantly. She is the primary bread-winner in her family, which makes her responsible for both her children, siblings and her extended family. She can now afford to pay for her children’s school fees, as well as those of her siblings. She also used the profits from her business to build her own house, and purchase feeding troughs and chemicals for her poultry business.

Using the profits from her first loan she have diversified her business and she also buys and sell floor polish to schools in her nearest community. She hopes to get a second loan so that she expand her floor polish business. She is now a leader in her community and is so happy with the support she received from Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase more floor polish for schools for her to supply in bulk.

loans.name: Rozina

texts.en:
Rozina is active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She lives with her two children and husband in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is the guardian of her family. He has been running a mobile shop for past few years.

Rozina's husband wants to purchase different types of mobile accessories for his business purpose, but due to insufficient financial means he is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore, Rozina has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan her husband would be able to purchase relevant items for his business purpose so that he can earn more profitable income to manage his business and house hold.
Rozina is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to expand supplies in her husband's mobile shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy steel of different sizes, the goal is to have the basic materials to fill his client's requests in less time.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is a married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself to be determined.

Dorcas operates a cereals business where she sells maize. Her business is located in a market and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenges to be transportation and storage.

She will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy more stock of maize. Her business goal is to have more stock for selling within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of maize.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Jane. She is 49 years old, married with five children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in 2013 and has undergone training on enterprise and financial management. She does dairy farming.

She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy animal feeds and repair cattle shed. She anticipates increased milk production which will earn her more income and enable her pay fees for her children and provide better diet.
She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promise to pay well.

loans.use: to buy animal feeds and repair a cow shed. This will assist her to improve milk production and more income to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Mumbua

texts.en:
Mumbua is 62 years old. She is married and has seven children. Her business is growing maize, cow peas, beans and mangoes. She has been in this business for 12 years.

She earns a monthly income of twenty-five thousand shillings. This is her third loan with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.

She will use the profits from the expanded business to expand her business and service the loan, as well as increasing her savings to borrow bigger loans in future. Her hopes and dreams are to improve her business to be better.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals.

She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to own a supermarket within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her living standards and create employment. This is her fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a 29-year-old wife and mother of two living in Wedza District. She is a Cama community health trainer working with schools in her community. In 2011, Florence started a market garden and poultry business when her family started facing financial difficulties. She is currently producing about 200 broiler chickens every six weeks and selling them to the local residents. Poultry production is a thriving business in her community. Florence would very much like to increase her sales and become a supplier to major international supermarkets such as TM and Spar. Florence’s business has been doing considerably well.

When she received the first Kiva loan she managed to purchase a hosepipe for irrigation, seed, and herbicides for her market gardening business. She used the profits to further increase production by a hector and is now varying her products. She is very grateful for the loan she received from Kiva and hopes to receive another larger loan so that she can further expand her farming business.

loans.use: to purchase more seedlings and fertilizers.

loans.name: Shaarban

texts.ru: Шаарбан, 45 лет, замужем, воспитывают 4 детей. У нее средне-специальное образование, работает заведующей складом в больнице. В 2003 году начала сельскохозяйственный бизнес. Сумев развить свой бизнес, в хозяйстве Шаарбан на сегодняшний день имеется 2 коровы, 30 овец, на арендованном участке мерою 0,60 Га земли и собственном - 0,30 Га она выращивает картофель и кукурузу. Шаарбан обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 101,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение поголовья скота за счет покупки телят. Доходы от кредита Шаарбан планирует вложить в развитие бизнеса и улучшение жилищных условий.
texts.en:
Shaarban is 45 years old and married. She and her husband are raising 4 children. Shaarban has a specialist secondary education, and she works as a warehouse manager at a hospital. In 2003, she began an agricultural business. Now that she has been able to develop her business, Shaarban has 2 cows and 30 sheep on her farm. She grows potatoes and corn on a rented plot of land measuring 0.60 hectares, and on 0.30 hectares of her own land.

Shaarban has approached Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 101,000 som (KGS) to increase her headcount of livestock by buying calves. Shaarban plans to use the proceeds from her loan to develop her business and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy some calves so she can increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Orestes Alexander

texts.es:
Orestes, se dedica a vender ropa, vive con su grupo familiar, trabaja de lunes a domingo, su mayor ventaja es que cuenta con un puesto en el mercado y su desventaja es la competencia que existe en dicho lugar.
El capital lo utilizara para comprar pantalones, blusas, faldas, chores y otras prendas de vestir con estilos renovados, pretende atender mejor a sus clientes para generar mayores ingresos.
Su proyecto es tener un almacén de ropa y otros artículos para tener una fuente de ingresos con la que pueda salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Orestes sells clothing. He lives with his family. He works from Monday to Sunday. The pros and cons of his job are that he has a locale in the market but there is a lot of competition in said market.

He'll invest in pants, blouses, skirts, shorts and other stylish articles of clothing so he can better serve his clients and earn more income.

His project is to have his own shop where he can sell clothing and other items in order to have a source of income to move forward with his family.

loans.use: buy pants, blouses, skirts, shorts and other stylish articles of clothing so he can better serve his clients and earn more income.

loans.name: Maa Laxmi Shg 1-E Group

texts.en:
Urmila, 28, is a hardworking lady from a small village of Odisha, India. She is the one standing to the left in the photo. She is a single mother and has one daughter and a son in her care. She is the only breadwinner in her family and works 13 hours a day in order to secure her income. She currently has a poultry farming business and earns her livelihood from that source only.

Urmila, along with her fellow group member, is requesting a loan amount of 36,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to purchase more baby chicks and feeds for them, and renovate her farm to increase her income.

Being a visionary woman, she intends to accumulate more profits and increase her poultry market to other markets, and this will increase her income and improve her living conditions. The extra income she will get will be used in fully repaying the loan and permanently changing her living conditions and securing the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: to purchase more baby chicks and feeds for them, and renovate her farm.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman. She has 6 children. She operates a tailoring business where she makes clothes.

Jane has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital.

She will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. Her business goal is to be successful within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials.

loans.name: Ranjita

texts.en:
Ranjita lives in a small village, Subhash Palli in Falakata of Alipurduar district, West Bengal. She is a married young lady of 28 years. She has attended school up to grade 8. Ranjita has a family of four members consisting of her husband and two sons. Her sons are students of grade 8 and 1, respectively.

Her husband, Samir, is engaged with a kerosene oil dealership business. Ranjita runs a business of sewing garments and selling them in her locality to contribute to her family. As she has knowledge of stitching from her childhood, she has chosen this business. She sews garments like frocks, pants, trousers, salwar suits, etc., for her customers.

The couple, with their small income, is maintaining their family somehow because they can save not even a penny for their future emergencies. In addition, the education cost of their children creates a burden on them.

To overcome the present situation, Ranjita decided to sew more variety of garments so that her customers will be happy, and her income will increase, as well. So she wants a loan from Kiva's partner BJS to purchase a better and modern sewing machine and some stitching materials because her current sewing machine has gotten too old and sometimes does not work properly.

She hopes, with the expansion of her business, she will attain good profit. With the profit, she hopes to give a good education to her sons and compensate for the family’s financial hurdles.

Her full thanks go to her generous lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine and other stitching materials for her business.

loans.name: Yamily Yomira

texts.es: Yamily   de 20 años de edad,  soltera y sin hijos, es un agradable estudiante de la facultad de  Contabilidad, lleva 1 año esforzándose de lo cual le falta 4 años restantes, estudia mucho para alcanzar sus metas en la vida. Con la ayuda de sus padres  ha sabido salir adelante y estudiar mucho, y así poder culminar sus estudios y ser  exitosa en la vida. Con el préstamo otorgado ella podrá realizar los pagos de su matrícula y pensión universitaria. Yamily  se encuentra muy agradecida  por la ayuda brindada y se despide con un fuerte abrazo de Kiva y Edaprospo diciéndoles que cumplirá con todas sus metas.
texts.en:
Yamily is 20 years old, single, and does not have children. She is a friendly student in the accounting department. She has spent one year working very hard and has four years remaining. She studies a lot to achieve her goals in life. With the help of her parents, she has managed to get ahead and study a lot, so she can finish her studies and be successful in life.

With this loan, she will be able to make payments on her university tuition, room, and board. Yamily is very grateful for the help provided and says goodbye with a big hug to Kiva and Edaprospo, telling them that she will meet all her goals.

loans.use: to pay university tuition, room, and board.

loans.name: Flordelis

texts.en: Flordelis and her husband fish for a living. They live in Talibon, Bohol. They work hard for their six children ages six to sixteen. She wanted them to go to school. She is asking a loan to buy a new boat engine that will work more efficiently on the fishing boat, thus increasing their catch. Flordelis is optimistic of the future. She plans to make business expansion for her children's future.

loans.use: to buy a new boat engine

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en: Ruby is 28 years old. She is married with three children ages three, four and five. For seven years, Ruby has been making chiffon cake to earn a living. She would like to expand her business and increase her production. With this plan, she is asking a loan of PHP8000 to buy an oven. This will allow her to produce more and to cater to more orders. She plans to be more sophisticated on her production to expand her business. Her income will be for her children's needs in school and healthy meals.

loans.use: to buy an oven

loans.name: Nena

texts.en: Nena is 41 years old from Getafe, Bohol. She is married with seven children. Five of them are still dependents ages 11 to 17. She rely on fishing together with her husband to provide for her family. She is asking a loan to buy a new fishing nets, plastic screen for crab traps and three piglets to start a hog raising business. She plans to improve her business so that her children can go to school and have a better chance in life.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, plastic screen for crab traps and three piglets to start a hog raising business

loans.name: Marta Herminia

texts.es:
Marta, observa que su negocio ha crecido y requiere de un mejor inventario, solicita un nuevo crédito con el que comprara una plancha para cocer las empanadas asimismo adquirirá ingredientes como: plátanos, leche, harina, azúcar, etc., para su elaboración, mantendrá la continuidad de su negocio.
La ayuda del rédito anterior la ha permitido tener a su alcance todo lo necesario para aumentar la producción de antojitos y tener mejores ingresos, su familia mantiene el mismo grupo.
texts.en:
Marta sees that her business has grown and she requires a larger inventory. She is requesting a new loan with which she will buy ingredients like plantains, milk, flour, sugar, etc. to make them, keeping her business running.

The help of the last loan allowed her to have everything she needed on hand to increase her production of snack food and obtain greater income. Her family group remains unchanged.

loans.use: to buy a griddle to cook empanadas as well as ingredients like plantains, milk, flour, sugar, etc. to make them.

loans.name: Isabel De Jesus

texts.es:
Isabel es una mujer con 29 años de edad, dedicada a la cría de aves, un negocio el cual lo inicio por necesidad economía y del cual  ha obtenido muy bueno resultados. Las diversas situaciones que la han llevado al fracaso en ocasiones anteriores, no son impedimento para intentar de nuevo y salir adelante con sus proyectos. Su meta es continuar trabajando y poder pagarle la educación a sus hijos.
Con el fin de mejorar sus ventar, aumentar sus clientes e incrementar sus ganancias, Isabel solicita un préstamo el cual lo invertirá en la compra de pollos y alimento para los mismos.

Ayuda a esta mujer con deseos de salir adelante, anímese, haga un préstamo.
texts.en:
Isabel, 29, is dedicated to raising foul. She started this business by way of economic necessity and has achieved very good results. The diverse situations that led to failures in previous occasions are no impediment to starting again and moving forward with her projects. Her goal is to continue working in order to pay for her children's educations.

With the end result of improving her sales, expanding her clientele and increasing her income, Isabel is requesting a loan that she will invest in chickens and chicken feed.

Help this woman achieve her desire to move forward. Go ahead, make a loan.

loans.use: buy chickens and chicken feed.

loans.name: Shila

texts.en:
Shila is a rural housewife of 48 years who is living in Rabindranagar village in Falakata, Alipurduar district of West Bengal, with her family. Her husband, Ranjit, is engaged in an ice-cream business, and he is the only income holder of the four-member family.

Her daughter and son are doing an M.A. (Master of Arts) and B.A. (Bachelor of Arts), respectively. Shila completed her secondary level education, and so she is determined to impart the best education to her children, which they deserve.

Her son, 19-year-old Rajat, is a B.A. (Bachelor of Arts) first-year student in Falakata College. Being a studious and hardworking student, he wants to join a private coaching center to do better in his final exams.

All the expenses of his course fee and the cost of books have come up to such a high amount that it becomes impossible for Shila to afford with her poor financial background. So Shila has taken out a loan from BJS, a Kiva partner, to pay her son’s college fees, private tuition fees and purchase all the necessary educational materials, so that her son can go ahead with his studies without any interruption.

Shila and her son (in the picture) are very much grateful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for her son's education expenses at the college level.

loans.name: Ayuba

texts.en: Ayuba is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Kunkun Village. Ayuba joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. In the past, Ayuba suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to provide healthcare for his family and children. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Ayuba will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Ayuba now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields.

loans.name: Ethel Jefflyn

texts.en:
Ethel is forty five years old. She single and has a twenty year old daughter. Ethel owns a store where she sells sachet water. She has been in this business for a period of three years and has employed someone who helps her with sales.

With this loan, Ethel will be able to buy more bags of water to sell. She believes that in five years time she will sell the water in larger quantities to meet the needs of her customers.

loans.use: to buy bottled and sachet water to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more goods for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy concrete, sand, metal sheetinng and lumber for building a veranda for her home as soon as possible

loans.name: Qurbonoy

texts.ru:
На фотографии запечатлена Курбоной. Ей 47 лет. Курбоной проживает вместе семьей на районе А.Джоми. Она замужем и мать двоих сыновей. Ее муж находится на заработках в Российской Федерации. Сыновьям 19 и 20 лет.  Они занимаются животноводством и земледелием. Курбоной шустрая и ответственная женщина. Она на районе занимается шитьем женской одежды. Курбоной любит свою работу и планирует остаться в этом бизнесе. Ей нравится встречаться с новыми людьми и шить удобную для них одежду. 
Курбоной планирует отремонтировать дом и создать хорошие жилищные условия. Из-за нехватки денежных средств она обратилась за кредитом. Курбоной за счет кредита купит стройматериалы и оплатит услуги рабочих строителей. Она верить, что Вы ей поможете, и заранее благодарит.
texts.en:
Qurbonoy is depicted in the photograph. She is 47 years old. Qurbonoy lives with her family in the A. Jomi region. She is married, and is the mother of 2 sons. Qurbonoy's husband is a migrant worker in the Russian Federation. Her sons are 19 and 20 years old, and they practice animal and crop husbandry. Qurbonoy is a bright and responsible woman. She works in the region by sewing women's clothing. Qurbonoy loves her work and plans to stay in this business. She likes meeting new people and sewing clothing that suits them.

Qurbonoy plans to repair her house and create good living conditions. Because she lacks the funds, she has applied for a loan. Qurbonoy will buy building materials and pay for builders with the money she borrows. She has faith that you will help her.

loans.use: to buy construction materials and repair her house.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is 45 years old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of one daughter and three sons. She is a house wife and looks after her family at home. Her husband provides services in shuttering work for building making. In this regard her husband needs raw material such as soldering rods, welding rods, iron rods and sheets for manufacturing iron accessories to improve his shuttering work. So that he can generate more income for financially support of his family. Yasmeen is applying for loan from kiva field partner for her husband work.
She is thankful to brac Pakistan and kiva.

loans.use: to buy raw material for her husband's shuttering work.

loans.name: Kadari

texts.en:
Kadari is a 47-year-old widow and a mother of two sons. After her husband's death she had to experience many difficulties and hurdles in life. She lives with her sons at Tilipara village of Kandi in Murshidabad district.

Both of her sons are engaged with some income generating work. Now she wants to contribute to her family income. So she has decided to start a milk-selling business, which is a very profitable business in their area.

Kadari wants to start supplying milk to the local people for earning for the family. Therefore, she now wishes to purchase a milking cow and forage to start the business. Her belief in life is changing one's livelihood for the better is an art that lies in the hands of the one who believes it can change.

Now she has requested a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner), which gives business loans to energetic and enterprising women. She will use this loan money to purchase a cow for her business. She is hopeful that her cow’s milk production will help her in generating greater income. She wants to get ahead for the betterment of the family.

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase one milking cow to start a milk-selling business.

loans.name: Gulzar

texts.ru: Гульзар, 31 год,замужем, мать 3 детей, дочь школьница, сыновья дошкольного возраста. У нее средне-специальное образование. В качестве дохода для своей семьи, с 2010 года занимается сельским хозяйством, начав этот бизнес с 10,000 сом (KGS). В хозяйстве Гульзар есть 12 овец, 2 лошади. Ежемесячная прибыль - около 22,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гульзар обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение поголовья овец с целью их откорма и реализации. Доходы от кредита Гульзар планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего бизнеса, а также в будущем хочет накопить средства на постройку сарая.
texts.en:
Gulzar is 31 years old, married, and has 3 children. Her daughter is in school, and her sons are preschool age. Gulzar has a specialist secondary education. As a source of income for her family, she has done agricultural work since 2010, when she started her business with 10,000 som (KGS). Gulzar's farm has 12 sheep and 2 horses. Her monthly income is around 22,000 som (KGS).

In order to further develop her business, Gulzar has applied to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 80,000 som (KGS) to increase her headcount of sheep, with the goal of fattening and reselling them. Gulzar plans to use the proceeds from her loan to continue expanding her business, and, in the future, wants to save money to build a barn.

loans.use: to buy additional sheep for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Libardo Antonio

texts.es:
Libardo es un hombre con 48 años de edad, padre de cuatro hijos ya mayores,  con esfuerzo y dedicación logro desde hace poco montar su propio negocio, una ebanistería la cual ubica en afuera de la casa donde reside.
Con esto ha tenido un gran progreso, como persona humilde ha logrado superar todas las adversidades que en situaciones anteriores se le han presentado.

Actualmente tiene una dificultad, cuenta con muy poco capital de trabajo, es por esto que se encuentra solicitando un préstamo el cual lo invertirá en la compra madera al por mayor.

Sus deseos de salir adelante son admirable, lo que se propone lo consigue, ahora trabaja con un propósito, el de mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, sabe que de la mano de Interactuar y lo colaboradores del portal Kiva lo Lograra.
texts.en:
Libardo, 48, is the father of 4 older children. With great effort and dedication, he was recently able to start his own business: cabinetmaking. His business is located just outside his home.

He's made great progress with this business. As a modest person, he's overcome all the adversity that has come his way in previous situations.

Currently he's experiencing one difficulty: he has very little business capital. This is why he is soliciting a loan which he will invest in wholesale wood.

HIs desires to move forward are admirable and what he proposes, he achieves. He is working with a purpose and that purpose is to improve the conditions of his home. He knows that with the helping hand of field partner Interactuar and the lenders from the Kiva portal, he'll achieve his goal.

loans.use: buy wholesale wood.

loans.name: Sandra Ana Yancy

texts.es: Sandra es una mujer muy esforzada que tiene su propia tienda de ropa. Ella solicita un préstamo de un millón de colones (₡ 1 000 000), para la compra de mercadería, esto con el propósito de ofrecer mayor variedad de prendas a sus clientes y aumentar los ingresos generados de esta actividad.
texts.en: Sandra is a very strong woman who has her own clothing store.  She is asking for a loan of one million colones in order to buy merchandise with the purpose of offering a greater variety of clothing to her customers and increasing the revenue generated from this activity.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her clothing store.

loans.name: Isabel Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina es una mujer casada con 28 años de edad, luego de quedarse sin empleo por varios meses, y pasar por difíciles situaciones, junto a su esposo se dedica a la cría de aves, de allí se generan muy buenos ingresos y fue un gran medio para la solución de sus problemas económicos.
Laboran todos los días durante 7 horas diarias.
Trabajan con un propósito en común, el de cumplir el sueño de tener una vivienda propia.

Actualmente Cristina se encuentra solicitando un préstamo el cual lo invertirá en la remodelación de sus galpones y principalmente en la compra de pollos.

Sus deseos de salir adelante son admirables, pese a las circunstancias por las que ha pasado anteriormente no se rinde ni sus esfuerzos disminuyen.
Usted puede ser parte de este sueño, anímese, haga un préstamo.
texts.en:
Cristina is 28 years old, and married. After being unemployed for several months and having difficult times, she, with her husband, began to earn a living raising chickens. Cristina earns a good income from this work and it was a great way to solve her financial problems.

They work daily for seven hours, and work with a common goal: to fulfill their dream of having their own home.

Now Cristina is asking for a loan to buy chickens and to renovate the chicken coops. Their will to get ahead is admirable. Despite the hard time they went through before, she does not give up nor do her efforts slacken. You can be a part of this dream. Get involved and make a loan!

loans.use: to buy chickens and to renovate her chicken coops

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy electronic games, cables, memory devices, 2 consoles and controls so he has inventory available for his clients to find what they want.

loans.name: Erik Del Río

texts.es: Erick es un empresario independiente que con sus conocimientos en panadería logró consolidarse en el barrio donde reside en el municipio de Barranquilla como un distribuidor de productos de panadería y repostería en tiendas del sector, actividad que empezó a ejercer en el año 2010, ofreciendo productos de alta rotación y muy importantes para la nutrición y la canasta familiar. Hoy en día ha logrado expandirse a instituciones educativas con una nueva gama de productos Buñuelos de maíz y espera continuar creciendo en clientes y variedad. Erick está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en materias primas; harinas, huevos, grasa, levadura, sal, azúcar y demás, con el propósito de ampliar el surtido y que sus clientes encuentren todos los productos que necesitan. Erick tiene 45 años de edad y está separado, es padre de cinco hijos y su meta tener un local y que su negocio sea altamente competitivo en el futuro.
texts.en:
Erick is an independent businessman who with his knowledge about baking was able to establish himself in his Barranquilla neighborhood as a distributor of baked goods in stores in the area. He began this business in 2010, offering rotating products important for nutrition and a family staple.

Today he has been able to expand to educational institutions with a new line of Buñuelos corn products and he hopes to continue gaining clients and variety of products.

Erick is seeking his first Kiva loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will use the loan to invest in ingredients such as flour, eggs, lard, yeast, salt, sugar, and other items with the goal of expanding his stock and making it so his customers find the products they need.

Erick is 45 years old, separated, the father of 5 children. His goal is to have a locale and that his business is highly competitive in the future.

loans.use: to invest in ingredients such as flour, eggs, lard, yeast, salt, sugar, and other items.

loans.name: Tchotcho

texts.fr: Veuve et âgée de 48 ans, Tchotcho est une femme résidant  à Tokoin  avec ses quatre enfants à charge.  Tchotcho frit et fume les poissons à domicile et les revendent en circulant dans les quartiers. Tchotcho s’approvisionne six fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des cartons de poissons, Tchotcho demande ce prêt pour réaliser son achat et augmenter sa marge bénéficiaire pour permettre à ses enfants un bon épanouissement.
texts.en: Tchotcho, a 48-year-old widow, lives in Tokoin with her four children in her care. She fries and smokes fish at home and sells her products door to door in her neighborhood. She gets her supplies six times per month at the market. To order boxes of fish, Tchotcho is asking for this loan to realize her purchase and to increase her profit margin, enabling her children to develop well.

loans.use: to purchase 2 boxes of fish

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Afi est une femme mariée qui vit à Tokoin avec ses deux enfants à charge. Agée de 35 ans, Afi est une femme dynamique qui travaille pour l’épanouissement de ses enfants. Pour ce fait, Afi prépare et vend du haricot accompagné de la farine de manioc à la devanture de son domicile à ses clients qui trouvent satisfaction dans ce repas. Afi s’approvisionne du nécessaire au marché et demande ce crédit pour commander des bols d’haricot et de  farine de manioc afin de réaliser son objectif et gagner son profit pour contribuer à l’avancement de son foyer.
texts.en: Afi is a married woman who lives in Tokoin with her two children in her care. She is 35 years old and an energetic woman who works, so that her children may thrive. To this end, she makes and sells beans served with cassava flour in front of her home. Her customers find satisfaction in this meal. Afi gets her necessary supplies at the market and is asking for this loan to order bowls of beans and cassava flour, so as to realize her goal and to earn a profit for helping her household to move forward.

loans.use: to purchase beans and cassava flour

loans.name: Jose Leonel

texts.es:
Leonel, de 49 años de edad, estudió hasta sexto grado, está casado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tienen tres hijos los cuales estudian.

Leonel, tiene un taller de carpintería desde hace más de 35 años, este trabajo lo aprendió viendo a su padre cuando trabajaba, porque él también era carpintero y a Leonel, le gustó este trabajo y decidió dedicarse a ello; además de dedicarse a la carpintería, también trabaja en el resguardo de recursos naturales de una empresa geotérmica, el taller lo tiene en casa y el otro empleo está a 3 kilómetros de su casa.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar un motor para adaptarlo a una sierra circular de banco, esto le ayudará a tener una mayor eficiencia y rapidez para cortar madera y para construir los muebles y tener más tiempo para la familia.

Los sueños de Leonel son, construir su propia vivienda, porque la que tiene no es lo suficientemente grande para la familia y mejorando el taller podrá hacer más trabajos y obtendrá mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Leonel, age 49, studied until the sixth grade. He is married, and his wife takes care of the household chores. They have three children who are studying.

Leonel has had a woodworking shop for more than 35 years. He learned this work by watching his father when he was working, because he also was a carpenter. Leonel liked this work, and chose to do it. In addition to carpentry, he also works in the natural resources protection department of geothermal company. His workshop is at the house and the other job is three kilometers away from his house.

He needs the loan to purchase a motor, in order to adapt it to a circular table saw. This will help him to cut wood and build furniture more efficiently and quickly, and have more time for his family.

Leonel's dreams are to build his own home, because the one that he has is not big enough for his family, and to improve the workshop so that he can do more work and earn more income.

loans.use: to purchase a motor in order to adapt it to a circular table saw.

loans.name: Jose Leonardo

texts.es: José tiene 46 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a sus dos hijos varones de 19 años y 16 años de edad, a pesar de las dificultades y tropiezos en la vida él les está dando los estudios ya que quiere verlos triunfar en la vida. El es un hombre muy trabajador que se preocupa mucho para que a ellos no les falte el sustento del hogar. José se dedica al cultivo y comercialización de hortalizas desde hace 25 años cultiva lo que es ayote, ejotes, güisquil, chile dulce, tomates y pepinos etc. José desea mejorar el cultivo de sus hortalizas ya que quiere comprar más insumos agrícolas por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: alambre de púas, pita agrícola, abono, fertilizantes, semillas de pepino, tomates y así aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
José is 46 years old. He lives in his own house along with his two sons, ages 19 and 16. In spite of the difficulties and setbacks in life, he is giving them an education, since he wants to see them succeed in life. He is a very hard-working man who is very concerned that they don't lack sustenance in the home.

José has been raising and selling vegetables such as pumpkins, green beans, chayote [squash[, sweet peppers, tomatoes, cucumbers, etc., for 25 years. 

José wants to improve his vegetable crops, and so he wants to buy more agricultural supplies. For this reason, he is applying to FUSAI for a loan to invest in barbed wire, agricultural twine, compost, fertilizers, and cucumber and tomato seeds to thus increase his sales.

loans.use: to invest in barbed wire, agricultural twine, compost, fertilizers, and seeds for cucumbers and tomatoes, to thus increase his sales.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana, manifiesta haber tenido una experiencia satisfactoria con el uso del crédito anterior, surtió su inventario con mercadería que le ha facilitado atender mejor a sus clientes en la sala de belleza, su vida está cambiando porque vive en mejores condiciones y tiene nuevos ingresos.
Solicita un nuevo crédito para tener recursos económicos con los que podrá comprar de forma inmediata productos como: tintes, maquillaje, lociones cremas corporales, etc., para fortalecer la sala de belleza, mantendrá el buen servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ana shows having a satisfactory experience with the use of her last loan. She stocked her inventory with merchandise that has made it easier to attend to her clients in the beauty salon. Her life is changing because she lives in better conditions and has new income.

She is asking for another loan in order to have the financial resources with which she will be able to immediately buy new products like hair color, makeup, lotions, body creams, etc. This will help her to strengthen the beauty salon and she will be able to maintain good service to her clients.

loans.use: to buy hair color, makeup, lotions, body creams, etc., to strengthen her beauty salon.

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr: Divorcée et  mère de deux enfants, Kossiwa est une femme âgée de 50 ans qui vit à Tokoin. Kossiwa est une couturière qui confectionne des habits dans son atelier de couture sise à son domicile et les revendent au marché. Pour s’approvisionner du nécessaire pour la confection, Kossiwa se rend deux fois par mois au marché. Kossiwa  demande ce prêt pour commander des habits en vue de gagner un gain et pouvoir subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants.
texts.en: Divorced and the mother of two, Kossiwa is a 50-year-old woman living in Tokoin. She is a dressmaker who produces clothing in her sewing workshop located in her home. Her clothing is sold at the market. To stock up on necessary items for her products, Kossiwa goes twice a month to the market. She is asking for this loan to order some clothing with the aim of earning a profit and to be able to meet the needs of her children.

loans.use: to purchase 116 pieces of clothing

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de trois enfants, Adjo est une femme mariée âgée de 41 ans vivant à Tokoin. Adjo est une revendeuse de poissons congelés et de pagnes qui s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché et le revend à domicile dans sa boutique. Adjo demande ce crédit pour commander des poissons et poulets afin de gagner plus de bénéfice et venir en aide à son mari pour bien s’occuper de leurs enfants.
texts.en: A married mother of three, Adjo is 41 years old and lives in Tokoin. She is a retailer of frozen fish and 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa), and she gets her supplies once a month at the market to resell the goods in a shop located in her home. Adjo is asking for this loan to order some fish and chicken in order to earn more profit and help out her husband in taking care of their children.

loans.use: to purchase 6 boxes of fish, 6 boxes of chickens, and 6 boxes of chicken thighs

loans.name: Shanti

texts.en:
Shanti, 51, hails from a remote village of Odisha, India. She is an enterprising and humble lady, but unfortunately, she is verbally impaired.

Her family consists of her two grown-up sons and her husband, who is a carpenter in profession. Shanti owns a ladies novelty store where she sells different cosmetic items like face powder, moisturizer, eye liner, nail paint, lipstick, lip gloss and many more items. She has a pretty large customer base due to her good and humble behavior.

Shanti is requesting a loan amount of 36,000 INR. She will use her loan amount to renovate her shop, and she wants to add more stock like face powder, moisturizer, eye liner, nail paint, lipstick, lip gloss, etc., so that she can match her supply with her customers' demand.

loans.use: to renovate her shop, and she wants to add more stock like face powder, moisturizer, eye liner, nail paint, lipstick and lip gloss.

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
María, está feliz de poder ayudar mucho más a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar, pues las ganancias obtenidas por la inversión del crédito anterior han mejorado su situación económica.
Para mantener su negocio al día con los cambios de moda en las prendas vestir solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar ropa nueva y usada, para todas las edades y ambos sexos, tendrá un negocio más competitivo.
texts.en:
María is happy to be able to help her husband more with their home expenses, as the profits obtained from the investment of the last loan have bettered their economic situation.

In order to keep their business up to date with fashion changes in items of clothing, a new loan will be used to buy used and new clothing, for all ages and both sexes, which will help to make the business more competitive.

loans.use: to buy new and used clothing, for all ages and both sexes, in order to have a more competitive business.

loans.name: Yenny Emilse

texts.es:
Emilse  es una mujer casada con 32 años de edad, ella se dedica a vender mercancía desde su casa, un medio el cual le permite estar al pendiente de sus dos hijos y por el cual vio la solución a sus problemas económicos.
Trabaja todos los días durante 8 horas diarias.
Actualmente tiene una dificultad, no cuanta con mucho capital de trabajo y tiene una gran cantidad de pedidos, es por esto que solicita un préstamo el cual lo invertirá en la compra de camisetas, jeans, pijamas y ropa interior.

Su propósito es continuar trabajando para poder pagarle la educación a sus hijos, pues son ellos el motor que la impulsan para luchar  día a día.

Ayude a esta mujer con deseos y muchas ganas de salir adelante, anímese, haga un préstamo.
texts.en:
Emilse is a 32-year-old married woman. She makes a living selling merchandise from her house, a means which allows her to keep an eye on her two children and which she also saw as a solution to her financial problems. She works every day for eight hours a day.

Currently she has a problem; she does not have much working capital and has a large quantity of orders. This is why she is asking for a loan in order to invest in the purchase of shirts, jeans, pajamas, and underwear.
