Her intention is to continue working in order to be able to pay for education for her children, since they are the engine that drives her to keep fighting day to day.

Help this woman with her wishes and desire to get ahead in life. Come on, make a loan!

loans.use: to buy shirts, jeans, pajamas, and underwear.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es: Doña Josefina, está casada, tiene 52 años de edad, es madre de 3 hijos, y vive con su esposo y una sobrina en el municipio de Puerto Cortes. Ella tiene aproximadamente 18 años de tener su propio negocio, vende  ropa, perfumes para dama y una pulpería para vender granos básicos como Arroz, maíz, frijoles y otros. Ella ha obtenido varios préstamos para sostener sus actividades de negocio, actualmente solicita un préstamo de 10,000 Lempiras para la compra de más productos como granos básicos, productos de aseo, azúcar, huevos, refrescos etc. para surtir su pulpería. Su objetivo es aumentar las ventas para cumplir con su meta de ampliar mas el negocio de pulpería  y mejorar la calidad de vida de toda su familia.
texts.en:
Doña Josefina is fifty-two years old, married, and the mother of three children. She lives with her husband and a niece in the municipality of Puerto Cortes. She has had her own business for approximately eighteen years. She sells ladies' clothing and perfume, and she has a grocery store where she sells basic grains such as rice, corn, beans, and other items.

She has taken out various loans in order to maintain her business activities, and currently, she is requesting a loan of 10, 000 Lempiras [$475]. It is for the purchase of more products, such as basic grains, cleaning products, sugar, eggs, soft drinks, etc., in order to stock her grocery store.

Her objective is to increase sales, in order to accomplish her goal of expanding the grocery store business more and improving her entire family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more products, such as basic grains, cleaning products, sugar, eggs, soft drinks, etc., in order to stock her grocery store.

loans.name: Chandana

texts.en:
Chandana is a rural woman of 24 years from Kandi. She lives with her husband Nilkanta and their two sons. She is a housewife, and her husband is a farmer by profession. She couldn't continue her study after seventh grade due to the poor financial resources of her family. Her 10-year-old and 5-year-old sons read in grade five and grade one respectively.

Her husband is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, he has a plot of agricultural land where he grows various crops.

Chandana wants to help her husband by doing something on her own. There is always a good demand for pure cow's milk, so she wants to start a milk-supply business. Her customers will be her neighbors and her villagers. So, Chandana has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to purchase one dairy cow and fodder for the cow. Once the cow is purchased, she will be able to start her business of selling milk. This will increase the family's income, and Chandana hopes to be able to improve the livelihood of her family.

She aspires to educate her children properly with the profit from her business.

She is grateful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase one cow in order to start her milk-supply business.

loans.name: Milan

texts.en:
Milan is a 50-year-old woman who lives at Bagan Bari village in Falakata, Alipurduar district. She is blessed with two sons who are both engaged with their family business. Her husband, 55-year-old Netai, is a carpenter by profession. He makes furniture such as beds, chairs, shelves, tables, wardrobes, etc. as per customers' orders. This is their sole source of income to earn their livelihood.

In order to construct furniture, her husband requires materials such as logs of wood, nails, hammer, saw, paint, and tools. He was engaged with this business for many years and attained a good number of customers. With the intention of expanding her family business, Milan seeks a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy necessary carpentry tools and logs of wood.

Milan hopes that the loan will allow her husband to cater to the customers' orders on time, which will generate better income to offer them a better quality of life and new opportunities to get ahead.

Milan is thankful to her lenders.

loans.use: to invest in her husband's small-scale carpentry business.

loans.name: Saboudou's Group

texts.fr:
Le banc villageois est créé en juin  2009, il est composé de femmes qui habitent toutes le même quartier. Il existe une bonne cohésion entre les membres du groupe la solidarité est manifeste. Elles ont comme activité principal le petit commerce et l’agriculture.

Madame Saboudou (assise à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette  du groupe. Elle est âgée de 55 ans, veuve et mère de 8 enfants dont 5 garçons et 3 filles elle a aussi à sa charge 4 personnes. Elle s’active dans la vente de fruits de saisons (mangues), elle tient  aussi une gargote près de l’école élémentaire où elle vend le petit déjeuné. Elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés hebdomadaires de sa localité en gros et demi gros pour la revende au détail. Elle jouit d’une bonne expérience dans ses activités pour l’avoir pratiquée depuis plus de 5 ans.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter 1sac de petit pois de 25 kg, 1carton de spaghetti de 24 sachets de 250 gr et divers bouillons culinaires et ingrédients.

Avec ses bénéfices elle assure la dépense quotidienne et la  prise en charge des frais médicaux et scolaire de ses enfants et petits-enfants.
texts.en:
The 'banc villageois' was created in June 2009. It is composed of women all living in the same district. There is good cohesion between the group members. The solidarity is apparent. Their main work involves small-scale commerce and farming.

Ms. Saboudou (sitting at the far right with a hand raised) is the featured borrower of the group. She is 55 years old, a widow, and the mother of eight children (five boys and three girls). She also has four persons to support. Ms. Saboudou has been active in selling seasonal fruit (mangos). She also has a stall near the elementary school, where she sells breakfasts. She gets her supplies wholesale from the weekly markets in her town and resells her products at the retail level. She enjoys good experience in her business for having done it for over five years.

With her new loan, she intends to purchase a 25-kg sack of peas, a 24-pouch box of spaghetti (250 grams per pouch), and a variety of flavorings and ingredients for cooking.

With the profits, she ensures day-to-day expenses are met and covers the medical and education costs of her children and grand-children.

loans.use: to purchase mangos, peas, spaghetti, flavorings, and other ingredients

loans.name: Sushila

texts.en:
Sushila is a married woman of 34 years who lives with her husband, one son, and one daughter in a small village of Falakata. Sushila's husband is a van puller by profession. Sushila and her husband both are illiterate, but can sign their names only.

Sushila's son is engaged in agricultural work. Due to poor financial conditions, he could not continue his study after grade 8. Sushila's husband's meager and inconsistent income is the main hindrance. Her daughter Latika reads in grade 8 at Falakata Girls’ High School (H.S.). She gets average marks, but she wants to do higher education and dreams to be a nurse in the future. Her parents plan to provide better education to Latika to enable her to lead a better life, but their household income is not sufficient to meet all her educational expenses.

So, Sushila applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) for school and coaching fees, to purchase a uniform, books, and a bicycle for her daughter. She hopes the loan amount will provide her daughter an uninterrupted education so that she can fulfill her dream.

Sushila and her daughter Latika (in the picture) give their thanks to the lenders (BJS and Kiva).

loans.use: to bear all the education-related costs of her daughter.

loans.name: Luis Alfonso

texts.es:
Luis es un hombre casado con 20 años de edad, dedicado a realizar labores de campo desde muy pequeño, una actividad que aprendió gracias a las enseñanzas de sus padres.
Con esto ha tenido un gran progreso, cuenta un gran cultivo el cual le genera muy buenos ingresos, los cuales son invertidos es sus estudios y en su familia.
Actualmente se encuentra solicitando un préstamo el cual lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes, insecticidas abonos y semillas.
Trabajo con el propósito de cumplir el sueño de mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, pues esta lleva mucho tiempo de construida y su estado actual no es el mejor.

Ayuda a este hombre con deseos de salir adelante, anímese, haga un préstamo.
texts.en:
Luis is a 20-year-old married man. He has done farm work since he was very little, work that he learned thanks to the teachings of his parents.

With this he has made great progress. He has a large area of cultivation that generates very good income for him, which is invested in his education and in his family.

Now he is applying for a loan that he will invest in the purchase of fertilizers, insecticides, compost, and seeds.

He works with the goal of accomplishing his dream of improving the conditions in his home, since it was built a long time ago and its condition now is not the best.

Help this man who wants to get ahead. Be inspired and make a loan!

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, insecticides, compost, and seeds.

loans.name: Wanmer

texts.es:
Wanmer tiene 38 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rústico junto a su esposa e hijo en el distrito de Pucará, ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte del Perú.En la comunidad donde vive los habitantes se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Wanmer se dedica al cultivo de cacao, cuenta con 10 años de experiencia en el sector y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. Además también se dedica a la crianza de animales menores. El préstamo lo utilizará para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para el mantenimiento de su cultivo de cacao así como para la contratación de mano de obra para la época de cosecha. Esta inversión le permitirá mejorar la productividad de su negocio y ofrecer cacao de mejor calidad a sus clientes, lo que le reportará mayores niveles de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Wanmer is 38 years old. He lives with his wife and son in his own house made of rustic material. He lives in the district of Pucará, located in the province of Jaén in the Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Peru. In the community where he lives, the inhabitants work principally in agriculture, livestock-raising, and commerce.

Wanmer raises cacao. He has 10 years of experience in this area and has very good personal and work references in the zone. In addition, he also raises small animals. He will use the loan for the purchase of compost and fertilizer to maintain his cacao crop and also to hire labor for the harvest season. This investment will allow him to improve the productivity of his business and offer cacao of better quality to his customers, which will return a greater level of income and in the end will improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy compost and fertilizer to maintain his cacao planting as well as to hire labor for the harvest season.

loans.name: Rocio Esmeralda

texts.es:
Roció, requiere de un crédito nuevo por ser herramientas útiles para seguir trabajando, comprara aceite, yuca, harina, chicharrón, granos básicos, etc., para elaborar la venta de pupusas y antojitos, le permitirá mantener su fuente de ingresos.
Con los créditos Roció tiene la facilidad de tener todo lo necesario para ir aumentando la productividad de su negocio, tiene estabilidad económica la que le favorece para aportar más en los gastos de su hogar y pagar sus deudas.
texts.en:
Roció needs a new loan for useful tools in order to continue working. She will buy oil, yucca, flour, shredded pork, basic grains, etc., in order to make the pupusas [stuffed tortillas] and snacks that she sells, which will allow her to maintain her source of income.

With the loans, Roció has the ease of having all that she needs in order to increase the productivity of her business. She has the financial stability that helps her to contribute more to the household expenses and to pay her debts.

loans.use: to buy oil, yucca, flour, shredded pork, basic grains, etc., in order to make the stuffed tortillas and snacks that she sells.

loans.name: Angel Daniel

texts.es:
Ángel, necesita de otro crédito para comprar insumos para la librería, para la tienda de productos domésticos y prendas de vestir, al fortalecer su negocio aumentan las posibilidades de tener un lugar en el mercado y atraer nuevos clientes.
Su negocio hoy en día ofrece otro tipo de producto como lo es la venta de ropa, lo que es uno de los resultados positivos por haber utilizado de buena manera el crédito anterior. Ya está casado, su esposa tiene 28 años de edad y el nivel económico familiar es favorable.
texts.en:
Ángel needs another loan in order to buy supplies for the book store, the household goods store, and clothing. Upon strengthening his business the possibilities will increase of having a place in the market and attracting new customers.

Today his business offers another kind of product which is clothing. This is one of the positive results of having utilized well his previous loan. He is married, his wife is 28 years old, and his economic level is favorable.

loans.use: to buy supplies for the book store, the household goods store, and clothing.

loans.name: Pratima

texts.en:
Thirty-six-year-old Pratima is a responsible housewife from a small village in Falakata. She lives there with her husband and two children (a daughter and a son). Both of her children are students.

Her husband is an artist by profession. He does different beautiful paintings on hard paper boards and then cuts them to give a complete image. He supplies his paintings as per his customers’ orders. There is a great demand for his artistic paintings in the village.

As this is the prime source of the family's income, Pratima wants to expand the business for more income. Due to the lack of capital, she is unable to invest in the business. So, Pratima seeks a loan from Kiva’s partner BJS to purchase necessary painting materials like painting brushes, colors, paper boards, etc. in bulk for more art production.

She hopes this will enable her to increase the family's income and profit as well, so that they can lead a decent life style. With the increased income, Pratima hopes to provide good education to her children.

Pratima is thankful to the lenders.

loans.use: to purchase necessary painting materials for her husband’s existing painting art business.

loans.name: Lerby Luz

texts.es:
Leibys es una señora soltera con 41 años de edad, por necesidad económica se dedicó a la cría de aves, aparte de ser una actividad que ama con todo su corazón, esta le genera muy buenos ingresos, lo que permite cubrir la mayoría de las necesidades que su hogar amerita.
Trabaja todos los días durante 8 horas diarias.

Se encuentra solicitando un préstamo el cual lo invertirá en la compra de pollos, purina, medicamentos para sus animales y en las mejoras locativas.

Su meta es continuar trabajando para cumplir el sueño de mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda pero principalmente pagarle la educación a su hijo.

Para esto cuento con la ayuda y el apoyo de Interactuar y los colaboradores del portal Kiva.
texts.en: Leibys is a single forty-one year-old woman. She raises poultry because of economic necessity, and also because she loves the work with all her heart. It generates a good income, which allows her to cover most of her household expenses. She works every day for eight hours a day. She is seeking a loan which she will use to buy chickens, feed, and medicines for her animals. Her goal is to continue working so she can realize her dream of improving the conditions of her home, and most of all to pay for her son's education. She is counting on the help and support of Kiva supporters for this.

loans.use: to purchase chickens, feed, and medicines for her animals.

loans.name: Sabas

texts.en:
Sabas is thankful that he was previously granted a loan, which definitely helped him provide smooth trips in his transport service, thus earn a continuous income to meet his family's needs.

Sabas is hoping that he can take out another loan of 19,000 Philippine pesos to replace his tricycle's tires as well as buy a spark plug and a carburetor. His tricycle requires regular maintenance to ensure safe and efficient transport.

Sabas values his tricycle, because it is his main source of income. It provides for the family's daily needs and funds his children's education.

Sabas aims to acquire an additional tricycle to improve his income and send both his children to college. He believes that a college education is a means to a better quality of life.

Sabas faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members every week to share stories of his work and also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God, which he studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather to study the word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for tires, a spark plug and a carburetor for the tricycle he uses in his transport service.

loans.name: Paktami

texts.en:
Thirty-three-year-old Paktami is a homemaker and mother of two children (a son and a daughter). She is married to Bhola, and they live at Falakata in Alipuduar district of West Bengal. Paktami’s son and daughter are studying in a local village school. Her husband is engaged in agricultural work.

Paktami's only daughter, Dipty, 14 years old, is studying in grade eight at Khirerkote High School (H.S.). She is a student of average intelligence and passed her last exam securing average marks. She has a long-cherished dream to be a nurse as her career. So, she wants to continue her study further and needs all the educational materials, which her parents are unable to afford.

So, her mother Paktami is requesting an education loan from BJS, a Kiva partner, to bear the education expenses of her daughter. She will pay the school fees and tuition fees, and purchase necessary study materials and a school uniform for her daughter. This will enable Paktami to carry on her daughter’s continuous education.

Paktami and Dipty express their gratitude towards BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase necessary study materials and pay educational fees for her younger daughter.

loans.name: Rosa Candida

texts.es:
Rosa, vive actualmente con su hijo mayor, tiene familiares en el extranjero, es viuda, tiene como negocio una panadería y tienda de productos de la canasta básica, lo tiene desde hace 10 años y ya es bastante popular en su comunidad.
En esta oportunidad el crédito que solicita lo invertirá únicamente en la panadería comprando harina, manteca, aceite, harinas, etc., aumentara su productividad para atender a nuevos clientes y tener mejores ganancias.
Los sueños de Rosa son tener un negocio más reconocido en el lugar, ser responsable con sus compromisos y disminuir las carencias de su hogar.
texts.en:
Rosa today lives with her oldest son. She has friends abroad. She is a widow, and has a bakery and basic grocery store. She has had this business for 10 years and it is quite popular in her community.

Today she seeks a loan to invest only in the bakery, to buy flour, butter, oil, etc which will increase production in order to serve new customers and have better income. Rosa dreams of having the most recognized business in the area. She is responsible with her commitments and reducing her household expenses.

loans.use: to buy flour, butter, oil, etc which will increase production in order to serve new customers.

loans.name: Progress

texts.en:
Progress is a 30-year-old mother of two. She lives in Wedza District in Zimbabwe and volunteers at the local school. She used her first Kiva loan to expand her food takeaway service where she cooks for the community. She offers a menu which includes sadza (cornmeal), rice, beef, vegetables, chicken, fish and chips.

Now she have diversified her business into welding, selling door frames, wheelbarrows, etc. The loan offers her an opportunity to relocate and improve her business. She will use the proceeds to support herself and continue her education. She then started a welding business and she is doing well. She managed to pay back her first Kiva loan and used the profits to drill a well and purchase a generator for her takeaway business. She is very grateful for the loan and hopes to get another larger loan for her to further expand her welding business.She hopes that with the second loan she will ll purchase more materials for manufacturing door frames wheelbarrows, etc

loans.use: to purchase more materials for making door frames, wheelbarrows, etc.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, bread, flour, soap, tomatoes and other items. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be high transport costs.

She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour , soap and other items. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within 5 years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour, soap and other items.

loans.name: Marta Alicia

texts.es:
Marta, desarrolla las actividades de crianza de cerdos y pollos, cuando los cerdos ya están grandes y robustos los destaza y vende la carne, hueso y otros derivados en el mercado. Es casada vive con su esposo de 32 años de edad y un hijo de tres años de edad, su pareja le colabora mucho en las actividades del negocio.
Para tener un negocio con todo lo necesario para seguir funcionando solicita un crédito para comprar pollos recién nacidos y concentrado para los mismos y para los cerdos, alimentara mejor a los animales, además sus actividades se facilitarán y le generan nuevos ingresos.
Sus sueños son tener estabilidad económica familiar y que su hijo tenga todo lo necesario para vivir mejor.
texts.en:
Marta runs a business raising pigs and chickens. When the pigs are big and strong, she butchers them and sells the meat, bones, and other byproducts in the market. She is married and lives with her husband, age 32, and one three-year-old son. Her partner helps her a great deal in the tasks of her business.

In order to have a business with all the necessities to keep functioning, she is requesting a loan to buy newly-hatched chickens and animal feed for both the chickens and the pigs. This will feed the animals better. It will also make her work easier and generate new income.

Her dreams are to have economic stability for her family, and that her son would have all he needs to live better.

loans.use: to buy newly-hatched chickens and animal feed for both the chickens and for her pigs, which will feed the animals better.

loans.name: Chung

texts.en:
Chung, 42, is married. He has worked in agriculture, raising poultry, for 10 years.

He lives in Ha Trung district, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province. The local government has recognized his household as poor, and the income from this job is unstable.

One of his most critical difficulties is not having a hygienic latrine. He is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet.

This is Chung's first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance. He hopes that this loan will help his small dream come true.

Chung hopes that his business profits will help his family be healthy and happy and help him provide for his kids and improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Nurhayati

texts.en:
Good day lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of KPP UMKM’s clients, Nurhayati. Nurhayati, 37 years old and married. She lives with her 4 children. Nurhayati is a housewife and her husband is a car conductor for 20 years. They pull together to increase their family income.

She has asked for a loan from KPP-UMKM Syariah for 7.000.000 rupiah. This loan will be used to buy and build a toilet at their home to improve access water and sanitation for their family. She want to have access to safe sanitation and water source for her family. Ha er family income is still not enough to build toilet and water resources by cash, but they are able to repay loans received.
She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank to all lenders.

loans.use: to buy and build a toilet at their home to improve access to water and sanitation for their family.

loans.name: Narcisse

texts.en:
Narcisse is a first-year student at Kepler. Due to his dedication and tremendous academic record, he was accepted from over 6,000 applicants this year. Narcisse chose Kepler because he believes it has the best technology curriculum in the country.

Narcisse plans to major in Communications with a Concentration in Business, and will graduate Kepler with a BA from an accredited US university. At Kepler, he hopes to build his public speaking and English language skills, as he still feels a bit shy and underprepared in those areas.

Narcisse is still exploring ideas for business, but hopes to one day run a company and support his siblings.

loans.use: To pay for a laptop required for a US college degree

loans.name: Jose

texts.pt: O José é solteiro ainda, vive com os pais na companhia dos irmãos e ainda não tem filhos. É polícia, com o presente  empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção, cimento e areia para o fabrico de blocos para iniciar a sua obra. Tem sonho de progredir na carreira profissional e se tornar General, casar oficialmente e terminar a sua casa.Tem como maior desafio estudar cada vez mais e terminar o ensino superior.
texts.en:
Jose is single and lives with his parents and siblings. He doesn't have any children. Jose works as a policeman and is taking out a loan to buy construction materials like cement and sand with which to make cement blocks in order to start building a house for himself.

Jose's plans for the future are to continue with his career in law enforcement and to attain a higher rank, to get married, and to finish construction of his house. He would also like to challenge himself to continue studying and to graduate from college.

loans.use: to buy cement and sand in order to make cement blocks.

loans.name: Noorjahan

texts.en:
Noorjahan is a resident of Falakata. She is 42 years old, married, and the mother of six daughters. Despite her many challenges, she provides education to her daughters. Two of her daughters are married, and four daughters are studying in different grades. Her husband is associated with agribusiness; he is the only breadwinner of the family.

Noorjahan's 17-year-old daughter Arjina reads in grade 10 in Moira Danga Goppu Memorial H.S. Vidyalaya, a local school in Falakata. Like many girls in rural India, Arjina dreams to pass her upcoming exams, scoring good marks. Unlike many girls from low-income families, she also struggles hard to give her best in her studies. The family's income is not enough to bear the ongoing education of their daughter. So, Noorjahan needs financial assistance so that Arjina can focus on her studies and carry on an uninterrupted education to reach her goals without any anxiety.

Noorjahan seeks financial help from BJS. The Kiva loan will be used to purchase her daughter's educational articles like books and a school dress, and pay for the educational fees, tuition fees, etc. Noorjahan hopes the loan will enable her daughter to reach her goal of being a nurse after successfully completing her education.

Noorjahan and Arjina (seen in the photo) express their gratitude to their generous lenders.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's education costs for grade 10.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en: Jackline is a married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be patient. She operates a retail business where she sells fish. She has been involved in this business for 7 years. Her business is located in a major market and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of refrigerator to store fish. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of fish. She hopes that in the future, she will expand business. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of fish

loans.name: Maa Laxmi Shg 2-A Group

texts.en:
Anita, 22, is the lady standing to the right. She is the featured borrower of Maa Laxmi Shg 2-A. Anita hails from an interior remote village of Odisha, India. The locality where she lives does not have access to basic civic amenities. She lives with her husband and a one-year-old daughter. Anita is a farmer by profession and helps her husband in the field in cultivating paddy. They both work very hard in the field in order to earn their livelihood.

Unfortunately, due to lack of funds and financial resources, she was unable to build a toilet in her house, and her family has to depend upon an open field for defecation and urination.

Therefore, Anita, along with her group member, is requesting a loan amount of 36,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to build a new toilet and incorporate water pipes, taps, and a shower in it. This will help her in maintaining hygiene and cleanliness and thereby protect her family from unnecessary medical expenditures.

loans.use: to build a new toilet and incorporate water pipes, taps, and a shower in it.

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is a married man with 3 children. He operates a carpentry firm where he makes furniture and also sells timber. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in an area with demand for timber products and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds to expand business.

He will use the Kes 95,000 loan to buy more timber and timber processing tools. His business goal is to own a saw mill firm within 5 years. This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more timber and timber processing tools

loans.name: Adriano

texts.es:
Adriano tiene 57 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rustico, con su conyugue ya no tiene hijos en su poder. tiene 20 años radicando en el distrito de querocotillo, provincia de Cutervo,Region Cajamarca, Sierra norte de Perú.

Adriano tiene muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales en su comunidad, la actividad a la que se dedica es la agricultura, especificamente al cultivo de maiz, cuenta con una experiencia en el rubro de 20 años, el préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizara labores agricolas para el mantenimiento de sus parcelas de cultivo de maiz amarillo duro. Y con ello generar mayores ingresos y asi poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Adriano is 57 years old. He lives in his own house, made of rustic material, with his partner. He no longer has children who depend on him. For 20 years he has lived in the district of Querocotillo, in the province of Cutervo, in the region of Cajamarca, in the northern mountains of Perú.

Adriano has very good references, both personal and work related. He makes his living farming, specifically growing corn. He has 20 years in this endeavor. The loan he seeks will be used for agricultural work for the maintenance of the parcels on which he grows hard, yellow corn. With it he will generate greater income and thereby better his quality of life.

loans.use: with agricultural work for the maintenance of his crop of hard, yellow corn.

loans.name: Archana

texts.en:
Archana hails from Kandi. She is a 40-year-old married woman and the mother of a son. She lives at Nandi Baneswar village in Murshidabad district, West Bengal. Archana has received a secondary level education. She is a hardworking and active woman whose main objective is to get economic security through her small enterprise and develop her family's livelihood. Her husband is associated with a small business and earns a very meager income. Her son is 18 years old and is a student in grade 12.

For the last year, her husband's business has not been going well, so Archana has decided to start a dairy business with the help and support of her husband. She will sell milk and cow dung to her neighbors, and her earnings will give financial support to her family. She decided to raise her family's income through starting this business by taking a loan.

So, she requested a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner). With this loan money, she will purchase a cow for her business. Through this, she hopes that she will definitely generate a handsome amount of extra income. She has a dream of saving enough for the better education of her son.

Archana is very much grateful to her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow to start a milk-selling business.

loans.name: Judy

texts.en: Judy is a single woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells rice, beans, maize and other cereals. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a favourable location and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of cereals

loans.name: Jeniffer

texts.en:
Jeniffer is a married woman with 4 children. She describes herself to be optimistic. She operates a tailoring shop where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be high cost of tailoring materials.

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. She hopes that in the future, she will have improved living standards. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of tailoring materials

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine is a married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself to be humble. She operates a farm where she grows tea and other crops. She has been involved in this business for 7 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. She will use the Kes 25,000 loan to buy farm inputs. Her business goal is to have a large scale business within 5 years. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a 47-year-old woman from San Dionisio, Iloilo. She is married with four children. Two of these four children are still school aged children ages 19 and seven years old. Her husband is a businessman while she helps her husband by buying and selling charcoal. She has been doing these for 14 years. Aside from this buying and selling business, she is also engaged in selling fruit shakes to the community.

Susan is requesting a loan to buy more charcoal to sell and shakes ingredients like fruits and ice cubes. She also plans to buy a side car for additional income and at the same time it can help her to transport her business easily. In the future, she dreams to uplift her business to increase their livelihood.

loans.use: to buy charcoal, fruits, ice cubes and side car

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica is a married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be humble. She operates a beauty salon where she offers beauty services. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are loyal. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low stock of beauty products. She will use the Kes 15,000 loan to buy more stock of beauty products. She hopes that in the future, she will expand business. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of beauty products

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 29-years-old, married and supports three children. She is a hard working small scale farmer earning KES 13,000 per month.

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision fund Kenya in order to buy certified fertilizers, seeds and herbicides to spray her crops to improve yield.

She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children as well as expand her farming activity. She hopes to improve the family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy certified fertilizers, seeds and herbicides to spray her crops in order to improve the yield.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an additional dairy cow to increase milk production in order to raise income to meet family needs.

loans.name: Dilafruz

texts.en: Dilafruz was born in a northern part of Tajikistan in 1997. She is single and lives with parents in a small town. This year she entered a commercial university. She wishes to study only with excellence and be a well specialist in the future. She is an active, responsible, honest, creative and helpful person. She appealed to IMON and Kiva asking a loan to pay her tuition fee of studies. She awaits Kiva lenders kindness and support.

loans.use: to pay the tuition fee for her studies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy certified fertilizers, herbicides and pesticides to spray her crops to increase the harvest.

loans.name: Petronia

texts.en:
She lives in the town of Loon, Bohol. Petronia buys and sells fish and sea cucumber in order to earn a living. She is a 52-year-old married woman with three dependents aged 16, 14 and 11 years old respectively.

Her husband is a fisherman and she has been selling fish and sea cucumber for almost 10 years now. During peak season, Petronia is the one who sells her husband's catch.

She is asking for a loan to buy fishing materials such as fishing net, nylon and fuel (for the motorboat). This will improve her husband's catch. With these, she will be able to sell more volume of fish and sea cucumber to her respective customers. She can then feed her children with good food and provide better shelter.

In the future, she would like to expand her business to support the needs of her growing children.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials such as fishing net, nylon and  fuel (for the motorboat).

loans.name: Auneta

texts.pt:
A  senhora Auneta é comerciante de 22 anos casada mãe de 02 filhos ainda menores de idade sustenta os seus sogros que vivem com eles na casa dos pais .
Com o valor do empréstimo  ira comprar Arroz e açúcar para a sua loja na sua casa.
O seu sonho e crescer no seu negocio respondendo assim as necessidades de clientes e fazer a sua própria casa próximo dos pais uma vez que o esposo e mais novo na família . 
Diz que  ira pagar pontualmente e dependendo das necessidades irão solicitar mais empréstimo ate conseguir realizar os seus sonhos .
texts.en:
Auneta is 22 years old and is married with two young children. She and her husband also help care for his parents, who live with them in her parents' house.

Auneta works running a small store out of her house, and she will use this loan to buy rice and sugar to sell there. In the future she would like to expand her business to respond to the needs of her customers and she would like to build a house for her own family next to her parents' house.

Auneta plans to pay back this loan as promised and if needed she would like to take out more loans in the future in order to make her plans a reality.

loans.use: to buy rice and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy compost, fertilizer, barbed wire, and agricultural agave for the cultivation of vegetables.

loans.name: Madalena

texts.en: Madalena is 31-years-old, she is married and has a high interest in doing  business because she is not dependent on her husband. She has a kiosk, and now she is requesting a loan of $ 800.00 in order to purchase additional items including  sardines, cooking oils, milks, candles, salts, noodles, biscuits, hand and body items, lighters and other things to sell. She opened her kiosk in 2011 with a working capital of $ 500.00. She wants her business to grow bigger in the future, she is always busy with her business every day.

loans.use: to buy sardines, cooking oils, milks, candles, salts, noodles, biscuits, hand and body items, lighters and other things to sell.

loans.name: Luis

texts.pt:
O senhor Luís, militar de 44 anos de idade, casado e pai de 03 filhos dos quais  02 a frequentar o ensino secundário, 01 no ensino  primário, vive na casa própria e não sustenta a mais ninguém .
Com o valor do empréstimo irá comprar cimento,barrotes, chapas de zinco para cobertura e estribos para ampliar a sua casa .
O seu projeto é concluir a sua casa, mobilar, vedar com um muro e comprar mais um espaço para construir dependências para os seus filhos . 
Com o empréstimos anteriores comprou mobília para a sua casa, diz ainda que tem insuficiência de fundos, mas vai pedir mais vezes  ate  concretizar todos seus sonhos .
texts.en:
Luis works in the military and is 44 years old. He is married and has three children, two of whom are in high school and one of whom is in elementary school. He lives with his family in their own home and is not financially responsible for anyone else.

With this loan, Luis will buy cement, wooden beams, zinc plates for roofing, and steps. He plans to use these materials to finish building his house and then plans to furnish it, build an outdoor wall for privacy, and buy another lot on which he can build homes for his children.

With previous loans, Luis bought furniture for his house, but he still needs funds to finish the project and he will continue to take out loans until he has made his plans a reality.

loans.use: to buy cement, wooden beams, zinc plates for roofing, and steps.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in sheets, wood, cement and wire to change the walls and roof of her house.

loans.name: Ana Belinda

texts.es:
Doña Ana tiene 55 años de edad, reside en la ciudad capitalina; es esposa, madre de dos hijos y abuela, actualmente se desempeña bajo el cargo de trabajadora social en una escuela de educación primaria, desde hace 9 años y en compañía de su esposo  han luchado por sacar a su familia adelante de una manera honesta y humildemente ya que como todo hogar siempre han surgido situaciones difíciles que han sido un factor de unidad para la familia. 
Doña Ana tomó la decisión de continuar apoyando a su hijo menor de 20 años, en sus estudios universitarios, ya que su principal sueño es ver a su familia preparada, luchando en el campo laboral haciendo lo que ellos mas aman, su hijo Cesar, anteriormente obtuvo el título de Técnico en computación, graduándose con un indice del 90%, actualmente esta iniciando sus estudios universitarios en el área de alimentos y bebidas culinarias es por eso que su madre le esta brindando el apoyo económico para que el pueda culminar sus estudios sin ningún problema.
Cesar comenta que para él significa mucho cada sacrificio que su madre hace ya que es una persona mayor y toda su vida ha trabajado por dar lo mejor a su familia, es por eso que él ha encontrado un empleo temporal como asistente administrativo en un colegio de la capital, menciona que su ingreso no es suficiente para poder cubrir sus costos de estudio, pero que ayudan totalmente a los ingresos que su madre ha destinado para poder apoyarle en su crédito educativo.
Cesar nos cuenta un poco sobre todas las cualidades que lo hacen ser excepcional, único e irreemplazable y es que siempre ha sido honesto ante cualquier circunstancia, es paciente ante las adversidades, es fiel a sus amigos, a su familia y a Dios principalmente, es simpático, amable, tiene un don de servicio y solidaridad, es puntual y le gusta mucho convivir con otras personas, el trabajo en equipo es su preferencia.
El poder emprender cada día algo nuevo, para Cesar es de gran motivación ya que mediante su carrera podrá ser un chef, profesión y esta seguro le ayudara a mejorar la calidad de vida su familia.
Desea contribuir a su país, mediante la creación de una empresa capaz de poder generar muchas oportunidades de empleo a jóvenes como él y a personas que luchan por alcanzar sus metas.
Cesar recuerda la incertidumbre y la falta de dirección en su vocación para estudiar, pero su decisión fue al momento de poder ver día a día cuantas personas sufren de hambre en la calle, muchos niños que son abandonados por sus padres y no tienen nada que comer, es por eso que su amor por el arte culinario creció y actualmente esta muy feliz con lo que ha decidido estudiar.
Cesar desea graduarse, aprender otros idiomas, trabajar y lograr establecer su propia empresa, primeramente Dios quien será siempre el centro de sus logros, desea convertir y dedicar su profesión culinaria en un apoyo para niños y niñas de bajos recursos.
texts.en:
Doña Ana is 55 years old, and she lives in the capital city. She is a wife, the mother of two children, and a grandmother. She has been working as a social worker in a primary school for nine years. She and her husband have fought to provide for their family in an honest and humble manner, as like in every home, difficult situations have always arisen, and this has been a unifying factor for the family.

Doña Ana decided to continue supporting her youngest son, age 20, in his university studies, as her biggest dream is to see her family prepared and competing in the job market, doing what they love the most. Her son Cesar earned a degree in Computer Technology, graduating with 90% average, and currently, he is beginning his university studies in the culinary/food and beverages field. That is why his mother is giving him economic support so that he may complete his studies without any problems.

Cesar comments that every sacrifice his mother makes means a lot to him, as she is an older person, and she has worked all her life in order to give the best to her family. That is why he has found temporary employment as an administrative assistant in a high school in the capital. He says that his income is not sufficient to cover his tuition, but it absolutely helps, along with the income that his mother has set aside in order to be able to support him with his educational loan.

Cesar tells us a little about all the qualities that make him exceptional, unique, and irreplaceable: he has always been honest in every situation; he is patient in the face of adversity; he is faithful to his friends, to his family, and first and foremost, to God. He is sympathetic and kind, he has a gift for serving and solidarity, and he is punctual. He likes to spend time with other people and he prefers teamwork.

Being able to undertake something new each day is a great motivation for Cesar, as his degree will enable him to be a professional chef. And, he is sure that this will help him to improve his family's quality of life.

He wants to contribute to his country by creating a company capable of generating many employment opportunities for young people like himself, and for people who fight to achieve their goals.

Cesar recalls his uncertainty and lack of direction in choosing a vocation to study, but his decision was made the moment he realized how many people are suffering from hunger in the street every day, and that there are many children who have been abandoned by their parents and have nothing to eat. That is why his love for culinary art grew, and now he is very happy with what he has decided to study.

Cesar wants to graduate, learn other languages, work, and be able to establish his own business. First and foremost, God will always be the center of his achievements, and he wants to dedicate his profession, and convert it into a means of supporting poor boys and girls.

loans.use: to support her son Cesar so that he can to be a food and beverage technician and chef.

loans.name: Majida

texts.en:
Majida is a typical rural housewife of 28 years hailing from Falakata. Her family consists of five members: her husband and three children (two daughters and one son). They all are studying in grade 11, 10 and 7, respectively. Majida lives at Baganbari village in Falakata.

Majida's 16-year-old daughter, Abeda, is a commendable student of Khirerkote High School. She reads in grade 11. She scored good marks in her last Board exam. She is very serious about her studies and always wants to get good marks in the exams.

In the future, Abeda wants to join the police department, so she needs the special guidance of a private tutor and some books for her present academic year. She wants to join in the coaching classes because she knows education is the only base to build a career.

Though her father is engaged in furniture making work, he hardly meets the household expenses, and it seems like a difficult task now to bear the educational costs for her. To support Abeda’s education, Majida is seeking an education loan from Kiva’s field partner BJS. She hopes this financing will allow her daughter to continue her studies without any financial problems.

Majida and Abeda (as shown in the photo) convey their heartiest thanks to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to pay all the educational fees and purchase education articles for her elder daughter.

loans.name: Jossefina

texts.pt:
A senhora Jossefina, operaria agrária, de 43 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 06 filhos, dos quais 01 a frequentar o ensino primário, 01 ainda menor sem idade escolar,04 já são maiores de idade estão nas suas casas, vive na sua própria casa e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Com o valor do empréstimo irá comprar cimento,  01 carrada de areia , chapas de zinco e pagar mão-de-obra do pedreiro.
O seu projeto é ser um criador de gado suíno, galinhas, patos, ter grandes plantações de milho e outros produtos agrícolas . 
Com o empréstimos anteriores comprou mobília para a sua casa, diz ainda que tem insuficiência de fundos, mas vai pedir mais vezes para superar .
texts.en:
Jossefina works in agriculture. She is 43 years old and is married with six children, one of whom is in elementary school, one of whom is not yet in school, and four of whom are already grown. She lives in her own home and is not financially responsible for anyone except her children.

With this loan, Jossefina will buy cement, sand, and zinc plates, and will pay for the services of a bricklayer. Her plans for the future include raising pigs, chickens, and ducks, and raising large fields of corn and other crops. With previous loans she bought furniture for her home but she needs more funds to continue with her construction project and she plans to continue taking out loans until it is finished.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and zinc plates, and to pay for a bricklayer.

loans.name: Juranis Paola

texts.es: Juranis de 32 años de edad, se ha dedicado por muchos años a la venta mediante guías especializadas de productos o catálogos, a través de los cuales promueve los artículos de su oferta; esta emprendedora mujer recibió la propuesta de su hermana quien también está incorporada a una agencia, de este modo logró una vida comercial.  Sus clientes  encuentran a la mano todo tipo de artículos para el cuidado de la piel y el cabello, detalles para toda ocasión, joyería entre otros a excelentes precios y comodidad de pago.  Juranis es madre de dos hijos y desea brindarles una buena educación, son su principal motivación y para conseguir los recursos adicionales a los que su cónyuge proporciona para el sustento de su familia, ella trabaja de lunes a sábado en horarios flexibles. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará artículos del catálogo como lociones corporales, colonias, perfumes y prendas de vestir. Su meta a futuro es abrir su propio almacén y brindar a sus hijos una buena educación.
texts.en:
Juranis, age 32, has worked for many years in sales using specialized product guides or catalogs. Through these means, she promotes the items she offers. This enterprising woman got the suggestion from her sister, who also belongs to an agency. In this way, she achieved a commercial life. Her customers find at their fingertips all types of items for skincare and hair care, small gifts for all occasions, and jewelry, among other things, at excellent prices and convenient payment.

Juranis is the mother of two children, and she wants to provide them a good education. They are her primary motivation. In order to obtain additional resources to those which her spouse contributes to supporting the family, she works from Monday to Saturday on a flexible schedule.

Currently, she is applying for a Kiva loan. This is her first funding from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will buy catalog items such as body lotion, cologne, perfume, and articles of clothing. Her goal for the future is to open her own warehouse and provide her children a good education.

loans.use: to buy catalog items such as body lotion, cologne, perfume, and articles of clothing.

loans.name: Misael

texts.es:
Misael, vive en casa propia y la comparte con su esposa y dos hijos, reside ahí desde hace 20 años, ocasionalmente recibe ayuda económica de familiares, desarrolla la actividad de crianza de ganado y cultiva granos básicos hace más de 20 años, para ir teniendo ingresos con los que costea los gastos de su hogar.
Busca ayuda con un crédito para comprar más cabezas de ganado, tendrá más animales para que su negocio logre cubrir las solicitudes de sus clientes, tiene la ilusión de ir generando más ganancias para ser puntual con sus obligaciones. 
Sueña con pagar sus deudas y seguir ayudado al sostenimiento de su familia.
texts.en:
Misael lives in his own home which he shares with his wife and two children. He has lived there for 20 years. He occasionally receives financial support from family members. He has worked raising cattle and growing basic grains for more than 20 years so that he can have the income to cover his household expenses.

He is seeking help with a loan to buy more cattle. This will allow him to have more animals so that his business can cover his customers' requests. He is hoping to start generating more profits so that he can be punctual with his obligations. He dreams with paying off his debts and continuing to support his family.

loans.use: to buy more cattle.

loans.name: Marta Alicia

texts.es:
Marta, está necesitando de un nuevo financiamiento ya que son de ayuda para reactivar su negocio a la brevedad posible, comprara ropa y calzado para ambos sexos, así conservara la preferencia de sus clientes.
Dice estar mejorando en gran manera con la ayuda de créditos Kiva, sus clientes han aumentado, tiene mejores ingresos y ha cancelado su deuda. Actualmente ya no realiza la venta de manera ambulante, ya que cuenta con un puesto de venta digno en el mercado municipal de la cuidad.
texts.en:
Marta is in need of new financing, as it is helpful to activate her business in as short a time as possible. She will buy clothing and shoes for both men and women, to meet her client’s preferences.

She says she is improving greatly with the help of Kiva loans. Her clients have increased, she has a better income, and has cancelled her debts. Currently, she no longer works as a street vendor, as she has her own respectable sales stand in the municipal market in the city.

loans.use: to buy clothing and shoes for both men and women, to meet her client’s preferences.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is a rural housewife of 45 years. She lives at Falakata, in Alipurduar district of West Bengal. She is blessed with two children (one son and one daughter). Her son is a daily laborer and her daughter is married.

Her husband Chandranath runs a small business of making concrete pillars. Anita also helps him after managing her household work. These concrete pillars are used to construct houses in rural areas. They make these pillars by using sand, cement and stone chips, and sell them to the building masons. If they can make more concrete pillars and sell them out, they can generate more income. But due to inadequate capital, they are unable to do this.

With a family of three, they have no savings for their future. To put this plan into action to earn more, Anita needs capital. So she applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to buy cement, sand, stone chips and other materials in bulk to build more concrete pillars.

Anita could certainly use their extra income and savings for leading a better life and better future. The loan will develop her family’s financial condition and provide a decent lifestyle.

She expresses her gratitude to her lenders.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, stone chips and other necessary raw materials for a concrete pillar making  business.

loans.name: Maribel Del Carmen

texts.es:
Maribel, de 52 años de edad, estudio hasta primer grado, está acompañada y su esposo es empleado en una empresa de vigilancia, juntos tienen cuatro hijos que trabajan, pero solo uno vive con ella.

Maribel, tiene una tienda en su casa, la cual administra por más de seis años, el trabajo lo ha aprendido por iniciativa propia, porque era una de las formas para poder obtener ingresos para la familia, el lugar de ventas de ella es una escuela que está muy cerca de la casa y es ahí en donde vende la mayor cantidad de productos como: frutas, gelatinas, antojitos como (pasteles de carne, enchiladas, turrones, palomitas de maíz, etc.) y obtiene un buen ingreso.

El dinero del préstamo será invertido para comprar más producto para la venta como fruta, harina para los pasteles y enchiladas, polvo para gelatina, etc. porque no da abasto a la demanda que tiene, por lo tanto con la inversión ella tendrá más surtido el negocio de ventas.

Los sueños de Maribel, es algún día poder tener su propio local de ventas en la ciudad, ya que de esta forma tendrá mayor cantidad de cliente.
texts.en:
Maribel, who is 52 years old, studied until the first grade, she is married, and her husband is employed in a security company. Together they have four children who work, but only one of them lives with her.

Maribel has a store in her home, which she has run for more than six years. She learned the work on her own initiative, because it was one of the ways to be able to get an income for the family. Her sales location is a school that is very close to her home, and it is there that she sells the largest amount of products, such as: fruit, gelatin, traditional fried foods (such as meat cakes, enchiladas, nougat, popcorn, etc.), and she obtains a good income. 

The loan money will be invested to buy more products for sale, such as fruit, flour for cakes and enchiladas, powder for gelatin, etc., because she cannot meet her demand. Therefore, with the investment, she will have a larger supply in her business.

Maribel’s dream is to one day have her own store in the city, as in this way she will have a larger amount of clients.

loans.use: to buy more products for sale, such as fruit, flour for cakes and enchiladas, powder for gelatin, etc.

loans.name: Milton Roberto

texts.es:
Milton, de 40 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, está casado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, ellos tienen cuatro hijos y todos están estudiando.  

Milton, se ha dedicado a la agricultura toda la vida, aprendió este trabajo gracias a su padre y decidió dedicarse a esta actividad porque le gusto, pero aparte de este trabajo, también sale a trabajar como jornalero y con esto lleva el sustento de su familia; su horario de trabajo es de 6:00 a.m. a 12:00 del medio día.

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar semilla para sembrar, abono y herbicidas, esto le ayudará para obtener una mejor cosecha.

Milton, sueña con que sus hijos se preparen academicamente y que tengan una mejor condición de vida.
texts.en:
Milton, age 40, studied until the third grade. He is married, and his wife takes care of the household duties. They have four children who are all studying.

Milton has worked in agriculture all his life. He learned this work from his father, and he chose this occupation because he liked it. But in addition to this work, he also goes out to work as a day laborer, and with this, he provides for his family. His work schedule is from 6:00 a.m. until 12:00 p.m.

He needs the loan to purchase seed for planting, compost, and herbicide. This will help him to obtain a better harvest.

Milton dreams that his children may prepare themselves academically, and that they may have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase seed for planting, compost, and herbicide.

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Mère de sept enfants, Abla est une femme mariée âgée de 41 ans vivant à Tokoin. Abla est une commerçante de friperies et de charbon de bois qui s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché et le revend à domicile et dans le marché également. Pour commander  des sacs de charbon de bois et des draps, Abla nécessite ce prêt pour financer son approvisionnement et réaliser une bonne marge bénéficiaire afin de venir en aide à son mari à payer les frais scolaire de leurs enfants dès la rentrée
texts.en:
Abla is a 41-year old married woman with seven children. She lives in Tokoin.

Abla retails second-hand textiles and charcoal. Once a month, she procures her supplies from the market. She retails from her house and also at the market.

Abla needs this loan to order bags of charcoal and bed sheets. The loan is to finance her purchases and to generate a good profit margin, so that she can assist her husband with paying for the children's school fees starting in the new school year.

loans.use: to buy 25 sheets and 26 bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sand, cement, metal sheets and nails to build a room for her sale of pupusas.

loans.name: Sabouynouma Group

texts.fr: Aissata Moussa a le bélier dans la photo devant l’autre membre. Elle est une éleveuse malienne âgée de 35 ans, qui habite avec son mari et 6 enfants,  4 enfants  sont à l’école. L’âge de ses enfants évolue entre 2 ans et 13 ans. Son mari est un agriculteur et  possède un atelier de menuiserie. Elle a une expérience de 4 ans, elle se ravitaille au marché local et y effectue aussi ses ventes. Elle a un gain mensuel de 7500fcfa par tête.  Aissata Moussa sollicite un prêt pour effectuer l’achat des moutons, de l’aliment bétail pour développer son activité d’élevage dans le but d’augmenter ses revenus. Dans le souci d’envoyer tous ses enfants à l’école et de s’occuper de leur santé, elle compte beaucoup sur les profits que  va générer son activité.
texts.en:
Aissata Moussa is holding the ram is the photo. She is a 35-year-old Malian animal farmer who lives with her husband and six children. Four of the children go to school. Her children's ages range between two and thirteen years old. Her husband is a farmer and has a woodworking business.

Aissata Moussa has four years of experience. She buys the animals from the local market, where she also resells them. She makes a monthly profit of 7,500 XOF per animal.

Aissata Moussa is requesting a loan to purchase several sheep and animal feed. She wants to develop her livestock farming business to increase her revenues. To send all her children to school and take care of their health, she is counting on the profits her business will generate.

loans.use: to purchase sheep to resell later.

loans.name: Willy Manuel

texts.es: Willy es un polifacético microempresario de 33 años que por tradición familiar aprendió a elaborar Bollos de maíz, sin embargo encontró en el comercio de artículos en madera una opción bastante rentable para él y funcional para los hogares al comercializar comedores, sillas, mecedoras, closet y adornos en madera como jarrones, esculturas, consolas y demás.  Diariamente distribuye a las tiendas aledañas bollos y a sus amigos, familiares y conocidos les ofrece variedad en artículos de madera traídos de Sampues en el Departamento de Sucre y les brinda facilidad en sus pagos. Cuenta con cinco años en esta labor con la que ha logrado ayudar a su familia y desarrollado su potencial, en la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar materias primas para la elaboración de los bollos y responder a solicitudes de pedidos de artículos en madera.  Así mismo tendría un stock de mercancía para que verifiquen la calidad y los acabados de los productos.  Sumeta a futuro es tener un local bien surtido y realizar adecuaciones a la vivienda.
texts.en:
Willy is a multifaceted businessman and 33 years old. Through family tradition he learned to make "bollos de maíz" [corn dough wrapped in corn husk leaves]. However, he found selling wood items to be quite profitable for him, and functional for the home. He sells dining room furniture, chairs, rocking chairs, cabinets, and wooden decorations like vases, sculptures, consoles, and other items.

Daily he distributes to the bollos to surrounding shops, and to his friends, family, and acquaintances he sells a variety of wood items brought from Sampues in the department of Sucre, and he offers them ease in their payments. He has spent five years doing this work, with which he has managed to help his family and develop his potential.

At the moment he is applying for a Kiva loan, the first financing that he has had with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, in order to buy raw materials to make the bollos and to respond to the requests for orders of wood items. Likewise, he will have a stock of goods in order to verify the quality and the finishes of the products. His future goal is to have a well-stocked place of business and to be able to make renovations to his house.

loans.use: to buy raw materials in order to make corn "bollos" and to respond to requests for orders of wood items.

loans.name: Hernando Humberto

texts.es:
Hernando tiene 35 años de edad, es casada, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en una zona rural del distrito de Cañaris que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Ferreñafe, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Hernando se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como pollos, gallinas, patos, pavos, entre otros, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Cuenta con 5 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que solicita será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales como gallinas, patos, pavos, pollos, entre otros, así como para la compra de alimento balanceado para estos. Con esto Hernando espera ofrecer un mejor producto a sus clientes lo que le va a permitir generar mayores ingresos y por ende incrementará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Hernando is 35 years old and married. He lives with his wife and their 3 children in a rural area in the district of Cañaris. This is located in the Ferreñafe province in the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Perú. The residents of this district mainly work in agriculture, trade and raising cattle.

Hernando works raising and selling small animals like chicks, hens, ducks and turkeys, among others. His business is located in his home. He has 5 years of experience with this business and has very good personal and professional references in the area. He will use the loan he is requesting to buy a large quantity of animals like hens, ducks, turkeys and chicks, among others, as well as the feed for them. With this, Hernando hopes to offer a better product to his customers. This will allow him to generate better income and will therefore increase his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of animals as well as the feed for them.

loans.name: Deisy Antonia

texts.es:
Deysi, es dueña de una pañería y una tienda de productos de la canasta básica, ya se ha acompañado y tiene dos hijos, la familia vive unida, su negocio nació por entusiasmo propio, la tienda está ubicada en su vivienda y sale a vender diferentes clases de pan casa por casa.
Con el financiamiento comprara aceite, veladoras, azúcar, sal, bebidas, golosinas etc., para tener mejor mercadería a disposición de sus clientes, espera mantener sus actividades económicas en el mercado para ayudar a su familia a subsistir, no representa dificultades en continuar trabajando.
Aspira a cancelar la deuda que ha adquirido y a poder ayudar siempre a su familia.
texts.en:
Deisy owns a dry goods and staple goods store. She is in a relationship and has two children; the family lives together. Her business was born out of her own eagerness and it is located in her home. She also sells different types of bread door-to-door.

With the loan she will buy oil, candles, sugar, salt, drinks, candies, and other items so that she can have more merchandise available for her customers. She hopes to keep working so that she can help support her family. She does not have any problems that will keep her from working. Her desire is to pay off the debt she has acquired and to always be able to help her family.

loans.use: to buy oil, candles, sugar, salt, drinks, candies, and other items.

loans.name: Abravi

texts.fr: Abravi est une femme mariée qui vit à Tokoin avec ses deux enfants à charge. Agée de 47 ans, Abravi est une femme dynamique et courageuse  qui vend des friperies en parcourant les quartiers afin disposer d’une bonne capacité financière. Pour bien atteindre ses objectifs, Abravi s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au marché et désire ce prêt pour commander des habits pour enfants et adultes afin de financer son commerce et trouver un bon rendement pour subvenir à ses besoins quotidiens.
texts.en:
Abravi is a married woman living in Tokoin with her two dependent children. She is forty-seven years old.

Abravi is an enterprising and hard-working woman who sells second-hand clothing door-to-door in different neighborhoods to enjoy a good financial situation. To reach her goals, Abravi gets merchandise four times a month from the market.

She wants this loan to order children's and adults' clothing and finance her business. Attaining a good profitability will allow her to provide for her daily needs.

loans.use: purchase one bundle of children's clothing, one bundle of adults' clothing, and one bundle of pants.

loans.name: Susana Isabel

texts.es: Susana es una emprendedora mujer de 27 años que reside en el municipio de palmar y hace un año inició su negocio un almacén misceláneo que funciona desde la comodidad de su vivienda; anhelo tener un negocio que le generara un ingreso para apoyar a sus padres y poder ser una empresaria independiente. Ofrece un variado surtido en artículos de papelería, cosméticos, esmaltes, perfumes, cremas corporales, productos para el aseo personal, desechables entre otros y sus principales clientes son amigos y referidos a quienes les ofrece de sus servicios y productos todos los días, sus ventas son generadas de contado, de este mismo modo sus compras las realizan de contado a distribuidores y comerciantes.  En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en adecuar la fachada de su negocio y en surtir con más productos.  Esta inversión es muy importante para incrementar las ventas. Susana desea continuar trabajando comprometida y continuar creciendo en sus negocios para ello planea a largo plazo ampliar el local.
texts.en:
Susana is an entrepreneurial woman who is 27 years old. She lives in the municipality of Palmar, and one year ago she started her business of miscellaneous groceries which she operates from the comfort of her home. She dreamed of having a business that would generate an income to help her parents and be able to be an independent businesswoman. She offers a varied supply of stationery items, cosmetics, nail polish, body creams, products for personal hygiene, disposables, among others. Her main clients are friends and referrals, to whom she offers her services and products every day. Her sales are done in cash, and in this same way, her purchases are done in cash from supplier and retailers. 
Currently, she is applying for her first credikiva through the Mario Santo Domingo foundation, which she will invest in fixing the façade of her business, and to supply it with more products. This investment is very important to increase her sales. Susana wants to keep working and to continue growing in her business, for this she plans, in the long-term, to expand her store.

loans.use: to invest in fixing the facade of her business, and to supply it with more products.

loans.name: Claudia Patricia

texts.es: Aprendió a coser a temprana edad, cuando apenas era una niña, Claudia recibió de su madre una máquina de coser; regalo que sería su herramienta de progreso y que años más tarde se convertiría en una microempresaria reconocida en el municipio de Cartagena de Indias. Aprendió en el seno materno todas las técnicas para una confección intachable, desde entonces esta profesión se convirtió en el principal sustento para su familia.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para invertir en varios tipos de telas.  Ella considera que con esta inversión tendrá éxito porque es la principal materia prima con el que trabaja. Su meta a futuro dotarse de nuevas máquinas y garantizar que su hijo sea un profesional.
texts.en:
She learned to sew at a young age, when she was just a little girl. Claudia received a sewing machine from her mother, a gift that would be her tool for improvement and years later would turn her into a small business owner known in the city of Cartagena de Indias. From the womb she learned all of the techniques for impeccable tailoring. Since then, this profession has been the main support for her family.

She is currently requesting a Kiva loan, her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to invest in various types of fabrics. She believes that with this investment she will be successful because it is the raw material with which she works. Her future goals are to acquire new machines and to ensure that her son becomes a professional.

loans.use: to buy various types of fabric.

loans.name: Olimpia

texts.pt: A Olimpia é casada, vive com o esposo e ainda não tem filhos. É Docente, com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção, cimento, tintas, azuleijos para dar continuidade a sua obra. Tem sonho de se tornar em uma emprendedora. Tem como maior desafio conquistar parecerias para começar com o projecto poeque não tem valores.
texts.en:
Olimpia is married and lives with her husband. They do not have any children. She works as a teacher and plans to use this loan to buy construction materials like cement, paint, and tiles in order to continue with a home construction project.

Olimpia's future plans include starting her own business, and her main challenge has been to form partnerships to begin with this project, because of her modest financial means.

loans.use: to buy cement, paint, and tiles to continue with a home construction project.

loans.name: Digna Rosibel

texts.es:
Digna, de 26 años de edad, es una joven de escasos recursos económicos, es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos pequeños, los cueles su compañero de vida la abandona y se marcha muy lejos sin importarle sus hijos, pero ella no se rindió y comenzó a trabajar duro, para cuidar de sus hijos.

Digna, tiene una pequeña tienda con la cual está tratando de salir adelante; anteriormente era ama de casa, pero después que su compañero de vida la abandono, ella comenzó a luchar por la superación y la manutención de sus 3 hijos.

Digna, necesita el dinero del crédito para comprar productos para su pequeña tienda, con este dinero espera hacerle mejoras y con esto ganar un poquito más.

Digna, sueña con mejorar su condición de vida y la de sus pequeños hijos.
texts.en:
Digna, who is 26 years old, is a young person of scarce economic resources. She is a single mother and has 3 small children. Her partner abandoned them and moved far away, without caring about his children. But she didn't give up and started working hard to provide for them.

Digna has a small store, which she is tring to get ahead with. She used to be a homemaker, but after her partner left, she started working to get ahead and provide for her 3 children.

Digna needs the money for a loan to buy products for her small store. With this money, she will make some improvements and thereby earn a little more.

Digna dreams of improving her and her childrens' living conditions.

loans.use: to buy products for her small store.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.pt: A senhora Virginia é viúva vive com duas filhas maiores de idade. É comerciante, com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção, cimento, tintas e loiça de casa de banho. Tem sonho de desenvolver no seu negócio e construir mais casas para arrendar.Tem como maior desafio ter mais financiamentos.
texts.en:
Virginia is a widow who lives with two of her grown daughters. She works in trade and plans to use the current loan to buy construction materials like cement, paint, and bathroom tiles.

In the future, Virginia plans to expand her business and to build houses that she can rent. Her main challenge is getting financing for these projects.

loans.use: to buy cement, paint, and bathroom tiles.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in: sheet metal, wood, and nails to repair the roof of her home because it is currently deteriorated and leaks due to the rain.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, brick, and iron, in order to build a wall along one side of her home's outer walkway, and in this way, protect her daughter.

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es: María tiene 40 años de edad, ella vive muy feliz en casa propia y humilde junto a su compañero de vida y sus 4 hijos de 3, 12, 20 y 23 años de edad. María es una madre muy trabajadora que buscar dar lo mejor a sus hijos. Todos los días, Maria se dedica a brindar servicios domésticos cerca de su comunidad; lo cual le permite satisfacer las necesidades básicas de sus hijos. Además, su compañero de vida labora como albañil en una institución; así es como aporta a la economía de su hogar. María solicita un crédito a FUSAI para poder instalar en su hogar la energía eléctrica e instalar puertas balcón para tener mayor seguridad. Ella invertirá: pago de derecho de instalación de energía eléctrica, compra de puertas y balcón para brindar seguridad a su familia.
texts.en:
