Nancy, age 36, is the head of her family. She is a very hard-working and admirable woman. She has three little ones; ages 12, 3, and 2. They are her hope and the driving force in her life. These children mean everything to her. That is why she puts all of her effort into her agricultural activities. Her children's future depends upon it.

Nancy grows bananas. It is her star product, which she distributes in the market plaza. Because she is a woman, certain field activities are very tough for her to do. Sometimes she needs to pay day workers to support her field work.

Nancy needs agricultural supplies for the maintenance of her crops. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides to irrigate all of her crops. Part of the loan will be used to pay for the technical assistance she needs to apply these products. This is one of the activities that she still is not able to do. However, she hopes to gain experience and the physical strength to do so by herself.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides to irrigate all of her crops.  Part of the loan will be to pay for technical assistance she needs to apply these products.

loans.name: Kikaka Group

texts.en:
Miriam, who is holding a passbook in the photo, is 33 years old and a member from Kikaka group. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014 to benefit from training, especially enterprise development and financial management.

Her economic activity is poultry and vegetable farming. She is borrowing Kiva loan to buy fertilizer and manure to increase farming production and hence earn more income to continue supporting her children's education. 

She is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for the financial support.  She promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and manure to increase farming production.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is 38 years old and married with one child in school; she works very hard to provide for them.

Marcelina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, cigarettes, junk food, home care products and other groceries.

Marcelina has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, cigarettes, junk food, home care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Jairo Jose

texts.es:
Jairo es un señor con 55 años de edad, dedicado a la cría y venta de aves, un medio por el cual ha logrado salir adelante y superar varios obstáculos que se le han presentado.
Trabaja todos los días durante 2 horas diarias.

Se encuentra solicitando un préstamo el cual lo invertirá en la compra de cerdos, gallinas y alimento para los mismos.

Su mayor sueño es dejar el negocio en un futuro a sus hijos.
Los diversos factores que lo han llevado al fracaso en ocasiones anteriores, no son impedimento para intentar de nuevo y salir adelante en sus proyectos, anímese, haga un préstamo
texts.en:
Jairo, age 55, raises and sells birds. This is the means through which he has managed to get ahead and overcome various obstacles he has encountered. He works every day for two hours a day.

He is requesting a loan to buy pigs, hens, and feed for them.

His biggest dream is to leave the business to his children in the future.

Diverse factors have caused failure on previous occasions. They are not impediments to trying again and getting ahead with his projects.

Go for it; make a loan.

loans.use: to buy pigs and hens and feed for them.

loans.name: Saima

texts.en:
Saima is a 27-year-old married woman. The man shown in the photo is her husband, who is a van driver by profession. He drives in the main city and makes enough income to cover all the expenses of his family.

He wants to change the van's engine, as it is causing a lot of pollution and is consuming too much oil for its' work.

That is why Saima has availed herself of a Murabaha loan of 40,000 PKR for her husband to buy a new engine for the van to provide better facilities to his customers.

Saima is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for the van  to provide better facilities to his customers

loans.name: Maria Donelia

texts.es:
María es toda una guerrera y batalladora de la vida, Ella a sus 48 años de edad, es viuda y madre de 4 muchachos. 
Ella le ha tocado difícil, reponerse de un golpe anímico como fue la pérdida de su esposo y pasar a ser la jefe de la familia.
María se dedica a la cría de cerdos, negocio que ha do en crecimiento y que sirve de sustento para su hogar.
El propósito central de María es mantener ese negocio que ha sido de apoyo durante tantos años, la perdurabilidad en el tiempo es lo que más le importa y solo pide tener salud para trabajar por muchos años más.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de concentrado (alimento de engorde para cerdos) y realizar adecuaciones a los chiqueros, cambiar tejas y madera que ya esta acabada.
texts.en:
María is a fighter and life-long battler.  She is 48 years old, a widow and a mother to four children.  

Life has hit her hard, it was difficult to recover from the emotional toll that was the loss of her husband and becoming the head of the household.  

María makes a living raising pigs, a business which has grown and serves to maintain her household.  

Maria's main goal is to maintain her business which has helped her over many years.  The durability over time is what is most important and she only asks for health to be able to work for many more years.  

She requests this loan to buy concentrate (nutrients to fatten her pigs) and make improvements to her pigpens, such as change the bricks and wood that is now worn out.

loans.use: to buy concentrate (nutrients to fatten her pigs) and make improvements to her pigpens.

loans.name: Erick Edgardo

texts.es: Erick de 34 años de edad, vive muy feliz junto a su hijo de 10 años de edad en casa propia y humilde. Erick se caracteriza por ser un hombre muy trabajador y que quiere salir adelante. Erick desde hace un tiempo labora en un hotel de playa donde realiza diversas tareas y a la vez tiene un negocio de venta de ropa; es así como cubre las necesidades de su hijo y personales. Anteriormente, Erick solicito un crédito a FUSAI el cual invirtió en un muro de contención lo cual resulto muy positivo para su hogar ya que da seguridad a su terreno, por lo cual su hijo y él están muy agradecidos. Nuevamente, Erick solicita un crédito a FUSAI para poder invertir en su negocio de ropa; de esta forma poder tener más mercadería que ofrecer a sus clientes y a la vez incrementar sus ingresos dando así a su hijo un futuro mejor. Él comprará: blusas, camisas, ropa interior para dama y caballero y ropa de niños entre otros.
texts.en:
Erick, age 34, lives very happily with his ten year old son in his own humble house. Erick is known for being a very hard-working man who wants to get ahead. For some time Erick has worked at a beach hotel doing various jobs. He also has a business selling clothes. That is how his covers his personal needs and those of his son.

Previously, Erick requested a loan from FUSAI, which he invested in a contention wall. The result was very positive for his household because it provides security to his land, for which he and his son are very grateful.

Erick is once again requesting a loan from FUSAI in order to be able to invest in his clothing business. This way he will be able to have more merchandise to offer his customers. This will increase his earnings, which will give his son a better future. He will buy blouses, shirts, men's and women's underwear, and children's clothes, among others.

loans.use: to buy blouses, shirts, men's and women's underwear, and children's clothes, among others.

loans.name: Marianita

texts.en:
Marianita is 37 years old, with five children.

Marianita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like bread, sugar, home product care, and other groceries.

Marianita has borrowed and paid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Marianita aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like bread, sugar, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Gladis Elena

texts.es:
Gladis es una ama de casa de 38 años de edad que emplea su tiempo libre en la venta de mercancía como ropa, útiles escolares, cosméticos, productos de aseo personal entre otros. 
Gladis tiene 3 hijos por cuales velar, ellos es sobreprotectora, quiere lo mejor para ellos, por ello trabaja y se siente muy feliz al saber que su actividad ha mejorado la calidad de vida de su familia y ha sido un gran apoyo para su esposo.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de surtido de ropa y productos como cosméticos, artículos de uso doméstico y útiles escolares.
texts.en:
Gladis is a 38 year old housewife who sells merchandise such as clothing, school supplies, cosméticas and personal hygiene products in her free time.  

Gladis has 3 children to look out for, she is an protector and wants the best best for them, and because of this she works and feels happy knowing her activities have improved the quality of life for her family and have been a great help to her husband.  

She requests a loan to buy a stock of clothing, and other products such as cosmetics, household articles and school supplies.

loans.use: stock clothing and products such as cosmetics, household products, and school supplies.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is the proud owner of an insurance agency in Aransas Pass, Texas. As a new startup, her insurance agency has a mission to educate the residents of Aransas, Nueces and San Patricio counties on their healthcare options and healthcare plan available. Her agency assists its clients in the process of getting enrolled in plans that suit their needs.

“When you think of health insurance it can be a complicated process. My ultimate goal is to get our customers through that process feeling like they know all about their plans,” Teresa said. “I am excited to be a new business owner, and as our tagline says, I am here to 'guard your future.’”

Teresa currently employs two full-time employees, but she would like to spread the word about her business. With her loan, Teresa will not only be able to fund her marketing efforts, she will also be able to provide quality healthcare options to individuals of her community.

loans.use: to pay for marketing and advertising.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Estrella is 49 years old and has four children who are in school.

Estrella has a food vending business in the Philippines. Estrella requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Estrella has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Estrella would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Ah Chan Village Group

texts.en:
Win, the featured borrow (Pictured, second from left) is forty years old and married with four children. All of his children are married, some are working by themselves and whereas others are helping their parents. Win does crop farming and also has raised ducks; to sell duck eggs and pigs for savings. He is well experienced in duck farming and started this business seven years ago.

A loan from Proximity Designs will help Win to purchase duck foods to nourish the ducks to produce good eggs and as well as to store the food. Win aims that, the profits from this loan to invest in his farm. And he hopes to have developments in both of his businesses in the future.

Pictured above are the members from Ah Chan Group, named as Win, Zin, Saw and Myint. This loan will help other members purchase ducks and the vaccines, which will make their ducks be healthy and more productive.

This village is located in Ah Chan Village in Myanmar Ayeyarwaddy River, Delta Region. Besides duck farming, for business, villagers do fishing, tailoring and agricultural productions. But most of every households raise animals as livestock or business.

loans.use: to purchase duck food.

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura has owned her wireless communication business, L&I Trade, for just over six months in Laredo, Texas. In addition to selling cell phones and cell phone accessories, she also is a Boost Mobile provider.

In order to keep up with the demand for technology, Laura plans to continue to get the latest in cell phone gadgets to help strengthen her client base. She not only offers cell phone products, but also helps her customers by providing online training to learn different aspects of the electronic items that she provides.

Over the past few months, her sales have gradually increased, and she is looking to hire a full-time employee. Laura also needs a loan to help with small structural upgrades to her store and inventory. With her loan, she will not only be able to sell her products, she will also be able to continue educating her customers, helping them become more tech savvy.

loans.use: to pay for a full-time employee, upgrades to store, and additional inventory

loans.name: Pek

texts.en:
Pek is from Banteay Chmar, a village in the North-West of Cambodia. She is 29 years old. She lives in a wooden one floor house with her husband and their 2 children. Her family owns 3 hectares of rice fields.

In 2002 she was trained by Soieries du Mékong, a social enterprise which fights against rural exodus and for empowerment of women by training them and offering them sustainable work in the village.Pek makes scarves which are sold in Cambodia and Europe. She uses her weaving income to pay for fertilizer to use in their fields and family expenses Thanks to the loan, she will buy the silk and pay for the dyeing and preparation of the loom.

Please support her so she can keep making beautiful traditional hand woven scarves!

loans.use: To buy silk and pay for loom preparation related fees

loans.name: Kunthea

texts.en:
Kunthea is from Banteay Chmar, a village in the North-West of Cambodia. She is 30 years old. She lives in a wooden pile house with her 8 years old daughter and her husband. Her family owns 4 hectares of rice fields.

In 2003 she was trained by Soieries du Mékong, a social enterprise which fights against rural exodus and for empowerment of women by training them and offering them sustainable work in the village.Kunthea makes scarves which are sold in Cambodia and Europe. She uses her weaving income to pay for her family expenses and to buy diesel and fertilizer for her field. Thanks to the loan, she will buy the silk and pay for the dyeing and preparation of the loom.

Please support her so she can keep making beautiful traditional hand woven scarves!

loans.use: To buy silk and pay for loom preparation related fees

loans.name: Suchean

texts.en:
Suchean is from Banteay Chmar, a village in the North-West of Cambodia. She is 26 years old. She lives in a wooden pile house with her husband and her 2 young children. Her family owns 3 hectares of rice fields, 8 pigs and a half hectare cassava field.

In 2005,she was trained by Soieries du Mékong, a social enterprise which fights against rural exodus and for empowerment of women by training them and offering them sustainable work in the village.Suchean makes scarves which are sold in Cambodia and Europe. She uses her weaving income to pay for her family expenses, to buy diesel and fertilizer for her field, food for the pig and to develop her business; Thanks to the loan, she will buy the silk and pay for the dyeing and preparation of the loom. Please support her so she can keep making beautiful traditional hand woven scarves!

loans.use: to buy silk and pay for loom preparation related fees.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda has been in business for the past nine months. She is originally from Barbados and is the proud owner of Dress With Confidence Boutique, a clothing and jewelry store that offers custom design dresses and alterations in the neighborhood of Hyde Park.

Before opening her business, Yolanda went to school for accounting and worked as an accountant for years after. Designing has always been Yolanda's passion. She has many years of experience in designing Caribbean style garments as a hobby. Although she now works long hours running her business, she is happy to be pursuing her dream.

Yolanda’s greatest success in running her business has been the ability to attract a wide variety of clients. Her largest difficulty, however, has been not being able to get access to the capital required to invest in working capital needs for her business. She is currently seeking a loan to pay for a storefront sign and for additional working capital to improve the storefront of her business.

Her vision for the future is to be able to one day manufacture all products she sells at her store.

loans.use: to pay for a storefront sign and other working capital that will allow her to improve the storefront appearance of her business.

loans.name: Emelinda

texts.en:
Emelinda is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Emelinda is 52 years old and has four children who are in school.

Emelinda has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Emelinda requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more boxes of fish to sell.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Emelinda has been in this business for 16 years. In the future, Emelinda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is 42 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Jessica works very hard to provide for them.

Jessica runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like bread, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries.

Jessica has been in this business for 6 years. 

In the future, Jessica would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like bread, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 56 years old and has three children. She is married, and two of her children are in school.

Marilyn is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF. She will use it to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock. She has been in this business for two years, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Mushegh

texts.en:
Mushegh lives in Geghamavan village of Gegharkunik region. He lives with his wife, two sons and daughter. Having a large family and being the only bread-winner in it, he works very hard in his farm and also takes some orders for different constructional works in his village.

Now ion his farm Mushegh has cows, calves, bulls, sheep and a lot of chickens. He also has a plot of land on which he cultivates potato, radish, greens and tomato. So these vegetables with his farm’s milk, meat and eggs Mushegh sells at the city’s wholesale market to his regular customers.

As he mentions despite of his great efforts, his family income is far from being enough to cover their needs. So with this loan of 700.000 Armenian drams Mushegh wants to spend on the purchase of two more calves and also fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy two more calves and also fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.name: Diana Patricia

texts.es:
Diana es una joven emprendedora y soñadora de 22 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos de 2 y 3 años de edad, su sueño de ser independiente lo logro al irse a vivir con su esposo, ahora ambos trabajan muy fuerte por mantener su hogar y demostrar que a pesar de la juventud puede consolidar un hogar y generar calidad y oportunidades de vida tanto a ellos como a sus hijos.
Por su arte Diana se dedica a las actividades del campo, tiene unos palos de plátano los cuales distribuye en la plaza de mercado.
Diana Trabaja con el propósito de poder pagar la educación de sus bebes, mejorar calidad de vida y convertirse en una proveedora muy importante de plátano en el municipio de valencia.
De momento la falta de capital ha sido el principal impedimento para que esta joven progrese, por suerte existen entidades que están dispuestas a apoyar la juventud y los nuevos emprendedores.
Diana quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas y pagar la asistencia técnica de los cultivos ya que no cuenta con la experiencia ni habilidad para realizar este trabajo.
texts.en:
Diana is a young entrepreneur and a dreamer of 22 years old. She is married and has two children of 2 and 3 years old. She achieved her dream to become independent when she went to live with her husband and now both work hard to maintain their home and to show that even though they are young they can consolidate the home, generate quality and opportunities for their life and for their children’s.

Because of her talent, Diana works on the farm, she has plantain trees and she distributes them in the market. Diana works with the purpose of paying the education of her children, improve the quality of life and to become an important plantain provider in the Valencia municipality.

Currently, the lack of capital has been the main barrier for this young woman to get ahead. Fortunately, there are organizations that are willing to support young and new entrepreneurs. Diana is requesting this loan to purchase agricultural supplies and to pay for technical assistant with the crops since she does not have the experience or knowledge to perform this work.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies and pay technical labor to help with the crops since she does not have the experience or knowledge to perform this work.

loans.name: Maa Laxmi Shg 2-B Group

texts.en:
Bina is a 26-year-old, young, energetic and hardworking lady. She is the one standing to the right-hand side in the photograph, and she hails from a small, remote village of Odisha, India.

Bina's family consists of her husband, who is a grocer, and a 4-year-old daughter. Her husband is the only breadwinner in her house, and the income of her husband is used to meet their basic necessities.

Due to lack of financial resources, Bina could not construct a toilet for her house. Therefore, Bina, along with her fellow group member Sabitri, is requesting a loan amount of 36,000 INR. Bina will use her portion of the loan amount to build a new toilet and install a commode in it, as well as incorporate water pipes to facilitate water supply and increase their convenience.

Bina aspires of a disease-free, healthy and a happy life with her small and contented family.

loans.use: to build a new toilet and install a commode in it, as well as incorporate water pipes to facilitate water supply and increase their convenience.

loans.name: Bello

texts.en: Bello is a Babban Gona farmer from Kaza Village. He joined Babban Gona so that he could realise better crop yields on his farm. Since joining Babban Gona, Bello no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to pay for his children's school fees. Babban Gona’s farm input loan will give him access to top-of-the-range farm inputs, such as fertilisers, herbicides, and improved seeds that will help him earn a yield of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare -- double the national average in Nigeria.  This will increase his income considerably.  Bello has ambitious plans to harvest 16 bags of maize this season. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Bello now has the opportunity to ensure that all his children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his crop yield.

loans.name: Luz Miryam

texts.es:
Mirian es una mujer casada con 42 años de edad, dedicada a la cría y venta de ganado un medio por el cual ha logrado salir adelante con su familia, luego de pasar por una dura situación económica la cual vivieron luego de su esposo quedarse sin empleo durante varios meses.

Su mayor sueño es mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda.

Se encuentra solicitando un préstamo el cual lo invertirá en la compra de cuido y medicamentos para su ganado.

La actividad que realiza esta mujer para sobrevivir con los suyos es digna de aplausos y es aconsejable para prestarle el beneficio de apoyo que solicita.
texts.en:
Mirian is a 42 year old married woman dedicated to raising and selling livestock.  This allowed her to move forward with her family after passing through a difficult economic situation after her husband was without work for several months.  Her dream is to improve the conditions of her house.  

She is requesting a loan to invest in purchasing care and medications for her livestock.  The undertakings of this woman to survive with what she has are worthy of applause and it is advisable to loan to her to support her request.

loans.use: to buy care and medication for her livestock.

loans.name: Maa Laxmi Shg 2-C Group

texts.en:
Lata is 51 years old. She is a widow who lives with her two children, aged 25 years and 19 years. The lady standing to the right-hand side in the photograph is Lata.

She has taken care of and brought up her children with great effort and love. Once they were older, she had more free time so she began to teach herself different crafts such as sewing, decorating terracotta statues and other handicrafts. Little by little she created her products and began to sell them to her neighbors, relatives and friends. She added in clothing, which added to her income. This has generated income which supports her household finances.

Lata, along with her fellow group member, is requesting a loan amount of 36,000 INR from Kiva's partner Peoples Forum. She will use her portion of the loan amount to invest in the purchase of supplies and merchandise at wholesale prices such as Samuka (used for decoration) items, wood, fabric, thread, paint, etc.

This will allow her to continue to work and offer more variety to her customers. It will also help her to fill the orders she already had and increase her sales and income.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of supplies and merchandise at wholesale rates such as decorative items, wood, fabric, thread and paint.

loans.name: Sonat

texts.en:
Sonat is from Banteay Chmar, a village in the North-West of Cambodia. She is 27 years old. She lives in a small wooden house with her parents and her 4 borthers and sisters. Her family owns 2 hectares of rice fields, 2 hectares of cassava fields and 1 pig.

In 2014, she was trained by Soieries du Mékong, a social enterprise which fights against rural exodus and for empowerment of women by training them and offering them sustainable work in the village.Sonat makes scarves which are sold in Cambodia and Europe. She uses her weaving income to pay for her own expenses and to help her mother pay for fertilizer and diesel for the field. Thanks to the loan, she will buy the silk and pay for the dyeing and preparation of the loom.

Please support her so she can keep making beautiful traditional hand woven scarves!

loans.use: to buy silk and pay for loom preparation related fees.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 39 years old and has three children. Josephine is married and has three children who are in school.

Josephine is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Josephine requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Josephine has been in this business for 2 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Josephine would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Tamara

texts.en:
Tamara is 45 years old and she lives in Sevan city of Gegharkunik region. She is married with two sons. She has higher education with the specialty of Pedagogue. Already 18 years she works at the school as a teacher of biology. She is beloved and respected teacher, who is able to make her lessons interesting and she keeps her class attentive during the lesson time. She is often described as strict, helpful and patient teacher who never loses any chance of teaching and giving as more information as she knows.

At her house she also gives paid private courses of biology so that the pupils are getting prepared for their entrance exams. So for these courses she wants to buy a computer, accessories for it and also professional literature and she hopes that Kiva lenders will help her with loan amount. She thinks with the help of this loan that she can make her courses more interesting and more informative for her pupils.

loans.use: to buy a computer, accessories for it and also professional literature, to help with her home tuition courses in biology.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 45 years old and married; she has four children. With two of her children in school, Elizabeth works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines, and she has requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF. She will use this amount to buy items to sell, like eggs, beverages, bread, home care products, and other groceries. Elizabeth has been in this business for two years.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like eggs, beverages, bread, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a thirty one year old married woman with three children living in masindi-Uganda. Because of the increasing demand for second hand clothes, she decided to start a business selling second hand clothes. She also does tailoring as a side source of income and is very hard working. She requests for a loan to buy clothes for selling. Jane is grateful to kiva for the previous loan which she used to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes for selling

loans.name: Haruna

texts.en: Haruna is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Gadanga Village. Haruna joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. In the past, Haruna suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to repair his house or move into a bigger home. Babban Gona’s farm input loan will give Haruna access to the best farm inputs in the market, such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds that will help him earn a yield of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare -- double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Haruna now has the opportunity to increase his crop yields and income, and to use his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his crop yield.

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en:
Sophea is from Banteay Chmar, a village in the North-West of Cambodia. She is 41 years old.

In 2000, she was trained by Soieries du Mékong, a social enterprise which fights against rural exodus and for empowerment of women by training them and offering them sustainable work in the village.Sophea makes scarves which are sold in Cambodia and Europe. She uses her weaving income to pay for the daily expenses. Thanks to the loan, she will buy the silk and pay for the dyeing and preparation of the loom.

Please support her so she can keep making beautiful traditional hand woven scarves!

loans.use: To buy silk and pay for loom preparation related fees

loans.name: Sreymao

texts.en:
Sreymao is from Banteay Chmar, a village in the North-West of Cambodia. She is 33 years old. She lives in a wooden one floor house with her sister, her brother and her parents. Her family owns 5 hectares of rice fields and 1 hectare of cassava field.

In 2006, she was trained by Soieries du Mékong, a social enterprise which fights against rural exodus and for empowerment of women by training them and offering them sustainable work in the village.Sreymao makes scarves which are sold in Cambodia and Europe. She uses her weaving income to pay for her own expenses and to help her mother pay for fertilizer and diesel for the field. Thanks to the loan, she will buy the silk and pay for the dyeing and preparation of the loom.

Please support her so she can keep making beautiful traditional hand woven scarves!

loans.use: To buy silk and pay for loom preparation related fees

loans.name: Jenneth

texts.en:
Jenneth, a businesswoman, has owned a place where she sell snacks and other food  for  three years now. She lives in Talibon, Bohol, Philippines with her two children ages four and nine. 
Her business consists of selling snacks such as spring rolls, pancake, noodles, pork stew  and sautéed vegetables. The business is the source of her daily income. 
Jenneth needs to make further investments but  she lacks the funds to do so. As of this time, Jenneth is requesting a loan to buy  flour, meat and vegetables. With the loan, Jenneth will be able to produce more and attract more customers thus giving her the chance of increasing her sales.
Jenneth hopes to make her business grow and become more sustainable.

loans.use: to buy flour, meat and vegetables

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is 39 years old from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is married with four children. Her eldest is nine and the youngest is only six months. For the last 2 years, she has been operating a small convenience store. She also buys scrap items like empty bottles, steel and plastics. She also sells rice in her neighborhood.

Joan needs a loan to buy a coffee vending machine and house materials for renovation. As a mother, she plans to send her children to school for their bright future.

loans.use: to buy coffee vending machine and house materials for renovation

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 50 years old. She is widowed and has four children. Her business is buying and selling livestock. She has been in this business for three years.

She earns a monthly income of nine thousand shillings. This is her third loan with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy chicken, goats and sheep for sale.

She will use the profits from expanded business to meet house budget and pay school fees for her children. Her hopes and dreams are to become a large scale farmer.

loans.use: to buy chicken, goats and sheep for sale.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn is 34 years old from the town of Talibon, Bohol.  She lives in an island called Calituban. Jocelyn is a hard-working mother of six. Her eldest is 14 and the youngest is 4. She helped her husband in their fishing business. She is asking a loan to buy a new fishing boat  and paint. She work hard so that her children are kept in school. She is determined to send them to school for a better life.

loans.use: to buy a new fishing boat  and paint.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn  is 48 years old from Talibon, Bohol. She is a single woman who rely on making candies and raising hogs to earn a living. This is her business for three years now. The livelihood allowed her to earn PHP2800 per month. She is asking a loan to buy additional piglets and sugar to increase her income. She is confident that the loan will make her life better with a chance for a higher income. In the future, she hopes to be sustainable in her business without relying on loans.

loans.use: to buy piglets and sugar

loans.name: Rani

texts.en: Rani, 52, is a widow with six children. She grows flowers and sells them to the people of her locality and in the local market. She initiated her business to meet her household expenditures. She is working very hard to provide her family with the basic necessities of life. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. In order to purchase a supply of seeds for a variety of plants such as roses, Kangi palm and red palm, Rani  has applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR. This would help her provide different types of plants to her customers, which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase different types of seeds for her flower business.

loans.name: Maa Laxmi Shg 2-E Group

texts.en:
Rita is 28 years old and a widow living with her father and 4-year-old daughter in a small village in Odisha, India. She is the one standing to the right-hand side in the photo.

She has been engaged in selling bangles and ladies' personal care products after the death of her husband. Her husband expired four years back. Rita's father helps her in her business, as he purchases items from the market and gives them to her.

Rita sells her stock in nearby village markets. She earns 3,000 INR per month from this activity.

Rita, along with her fellow group member, is requesting a loan amount of 36,000 INR from Kiva's partner Peoples Forum. She will use her portion of the loan amount to take a room for rent and open a variety store, where she will sell ladies' personal care products. She will also purchase varieties of bangles and other personal care products in bulk. This will result in better cash flow for her. A diverse product line will help her retain old customers and attract new customers.

loans.use: to take a room for rent and open a variety store where she will sell ladies' personal care products

loans.name: Irene Jeanneth

texts.es:
Irene, de 27 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer año de bachillerato opción contador, está casada y tiene 3 hijos, de los cuales 2 asisten a la escuela, su esposo es empleado en el área de ventas de una distribuidora de pan. 

Irene, se dedica a la elaboración de pan dulce en el negocio familiar, porque su padre tiene una panadería desde hace 5 años.- Además, tiene una tienda en la que trabaja después de hornear pan. 

El préstamo será utilizado para invertirlo en la tienda y comprar más productos como arroz, azúcar, frijoles y galletas, ella quiere tener más variedad de productos para tener satisfechos a sus clientes. 

Ella desea que un futuro no muy lejano pueda tener su tienda bastante surtida y mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Irene is 27 years old, she studied accounting in high school attending it up to the third year, she is married and she has 3 children, 2 of whom go to school. Her husband works close to where they live, and he is a sales clerk in a wholesale bakery.

Irene engages in preparing "pan dulce" (sweet bread) in the bakery of her family, an activity her father started 5 years ago. On top of this, she also runs a general store and she works there after having finished baking bread.

The loan she is requesting will be invested in her store to buy more products such as rice, sugar, beans and biscuits. She wants to offer a wider variety of products in order to satisfy her customers.

Her wish that her store will hold a good supply of products in the near future, and she also wishes to improve her children's standard of living.

loans.use: to invest it in her activity and to buy more products such as rice, sugar, beans and biscuits.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is a Babban Gona farmer from Gayya Village. He joined Babban Gona so that he could realise better yields on his farm. Since joining Babban Gona, Daniel no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to feed his children and family. Babban Gona’s farm input loan will give Daniel access to top-of-the-range farm inputs, such as fertilisers, herbicides, and improved seeds that will help him earn a yield of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare -- double the national average in Nigeria.  This will increase his income considerably.  Daniel has ambitious plans to harvest 70 bags of maize this season. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Daniel now has the opportunity to ensure that all of his children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his crop yield.

loans.name: Maa Laxmi Shg 2-D Group

texts.en:
Pinky is 34 years old and a widow who lives with her parents-in-law and two children in a small village of Odisha, India. Her children go to a government school near her house. She is engaged in a tailoring business from which she earns 4,000 INR. The lady standing to the right-hand side in the photograph is Pinky.

After the death of her husband, all the family responsibility automatically came to her shoulders, and 4,000 INR was insufficient for her family's monthly family expenditures. Pinky, along with her fellow group member, is requesting a loan of 36,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to purchase a new sewing machine, threads and cloth so that she could give tailoring training to others and can make some extra money. The loan amount will help her in acquiring a new automated sewing machine, which will increase the efficiency of her work, reducing the time factor.

Pinky dreams of providing her children the best education and seeing them become successful in every front of life.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine, threads and cloth so that she could give tailoring training to others.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima is 33 years old and a married woman. She is involved in business selling stitching materials, such as lace, ribbons, thread, and buttons in different colors. She also offers children's garments and bangles. She has become popular in her street, for providing good materials to her customers. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. Currently, she has applied for a loan of PKR 60,000, which she will use to purchase lace, buttons, and spools of thread in different colors. It will improve her earnings and enable her to better support the needs of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase lace, buttons, and spools of thread in different colors.

loans.name: Joeann

texts.en: Joeann is 34 years old, married with three children ages one, eight and fourteen.  Her husband is a tricycle driver, while Joeann  attends to their chainsaw repair shop. She is asking for a loan to buy cutting wheel, diamond saw, the repair of the motor and pay for franchise.  Her profit will be utilized for family consumption and school fees of her children. Joeann is from Talibon, Bohol.

loans.use: to buy a cutting wheel, diamond saw, pay for motor repair and pay for franchise.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is 29 years old. She is married and has four children. She operates a green grocery stall selling cabbage, kale, tomatoes, potatoes, etc., and she does crop farming and animal rearing. She has had her stall for four years. This is her second loan from VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy a supply of kale, cabbage, tomatoes, potatoes and onions for her green grocery stall. She will use profits from her expanded business to service the loan and also increase her savings account in order to borrow a bigger loan next time. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to be financially stable and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy a supply of vegetables for her green grocery stall.

loans.name: Azatuhi

texts.en:
Azatuhi lives with her big family (husband, son, daughter-in-lws and new born grandchild) in Gyulagarak of Lori region. She is a pedagogue with higher education and already has 32 years of work experience in that field.

Now she works at the village school as a teacher of secondary classes. Azatuhi’s husband is also pedagogue and at the same school he works as a teacher of geography. Azatuhi has a group of pupils whom at her house she helps for preparing their lessons and explains some misunderstood some themes from the lessons. Azaruhi asks this loan of 500.000 Armenian as she wants to buy a computer and professional literature for her courses at home and she is sure that will help her to make her private courses more informative for her pupils.

loans.use: to buy a computer and professional literature for her courses at home

loans.name: Leidis Yojana

texts.es:
Leidis es una mujer emprendedora, luchadora, pujante, una madre cabeza de familia que con su negocio de venta de mercancía y accesorios para celular ha generado los recursos necesarios para mantener a su familia conformada por 3 hijos. 
Leidis toda su vida ha luchado, ha batallado por su familia, pero se cansó de solo sobrevivir, ella no quiere que sus hijos pasen por su misma situación, quiere llevarlos al progreso y se conviertan en los primeros universitarios de su familia. 
Ya que la falta de capital siempre ha sido su principal impedimento para progresar y tener mayor disponibilidad de mercancía, quiere solicitar un apoyo económico con el que busca aumentar su cantidad de inventario y todo el dinero será destinado en la compra de productos de uso personal, accesorios, cosméticos y accesorios para celular.

Apoya a una empresaria madre cabeza de familia que quiere progresar y ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Leidis is an entrepreneurial woman, hard worker, thriving and a mother. She is the head of household and with her business of selling merchandise and accessories for the cellular phones she has generated the necessary resources to support her family of 3 children.

Leidis has struggled all her life and has fought for her family, but she got tired of only surviving. She does not want her children to be in the same situation, she wants them to get ahead and to become the first ones in her family that attend university.

Since the lack of capital has been the main barrier for her to get ahead and to have access to more merchandise she is requesting financial help. With this help she will increase her inventory and all the money will be used to purchase personal products, accessories, cosmetics and accessories for cellular phones.

Support an entrepreneur who is a head of household and who wants to get ahead and help her family.

loans.use: to purchase personal products, accessories, cosmetics and accessories for cellular phones.

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy is 35 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Juvy works very hard to provide for them.

Juvy runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like eggs, bread, home product care, and other groceries.

Juvy has been in this business for 3 years. 

In the future, Juvy would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like eggs, bread, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Sobet Nelel Women Group

texts.en:
Hillary, the man raising his hand in the photo, is a member Sobet Nelel women group. He is 38 years old, married and blessed with 3 children.
He operates a motorcycle transport business to earn a living. After receiving Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training on enterprise management which improved his business through proper recording and prudent finance management.

He recently ventured into bee farming, however he is financially constrained making him borrow money from Kiva to buy bee hives. He hopes his business will thrive thus more profits. He plans to use the anticipated income to meet family basic needs such as food and clothing.

Hillary is happy to Kiva and their lenders for the financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy bee hives that will boost their bee keeping business and thus earn more income.

loans.name: Mayarani

texts.en:
Forty-one-year-old Mayarani lives in a small village named Harinathpur of Falakata. She has three children (one daughter and two sons). Her husband is engaged with agribusiness. His income is too low to bear the educational as well as household costs of his family.

Mayarani’s sons are studying in school, and her daughter studied up to grade 8; now she stays at home. Due to financial problems, Mayarani could not afford her daughter’s educational costs.

One of her sons, Prasanta, is studying in grade 11 in Kirerkote High School. In the next academic year, he will appear for his higher secondary board examination. Thus, from now onward he is paying more time and attention to his studies, so that he can pass with a good result. But now he needs guidance and study materials to reach to his goal. Prasanta is trying hard to score good marks in his upcoming exams.

But Mayarani faces difficulties to bear all educational expenses of her children with this low family income. Mayarani thought to avail herself of an educational loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to bear the educational expenses of her son. She will use the loan money to pay tuition fees and buy necessary study materials and a bicycle for her son Prasanta. The loan will help a bright young boy to continue his education without any obstacles.

Mayarani and Prasanta (in the photo) are happy and grateful to BJS and Kiva for their kind support.

loans.use: to pay for her son's educational expenses for grade 11.

loans.name: Aneek

texts.en: Aneek, 56, is a married woman. In order to meet her household expenses she started her business selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, raises them, and then sells them in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. She needs to improve her business to meet her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 30,000 PKR to purchase more animals to increase her sales. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals for her animal rearing business.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily has finished paying the previous loan. She bought fodder that helped increase her income thus enabling her provide  family needs with ease. She wants to expand her dairy farming further making her borrow some money from Kiva to buy fodder for her cows. She hopes her business will thrive thus more income to cater for family needs such as food, clothing and school fees for her children.
She is grateful to Kiva for the continued support.

loans.use: to buy high quality fodder that will increase milk production and thus create more income.

loans.name: Portia

texts.en:
Portia is a 29-year-old businesswoman from the district of Nyaminyami in Zimbabwe. She rents a shop at the local market where she sells bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, track suits and t-shirts. She has been running her business since 2013, and it has enabled her to support her family.

Portia also volunteers in her community; she teaches leadership skills to young students. With the first Kiva loan she got, Portia purchased more clothing supplies for her business. Her hope is to grow the business and open her own store. This will bring stability to her business, and it will enable her to change her family’s status and finances. Portia is thriving with her clothing business.

Upon receiving her loan, she ordered better quality clothes and restocked her shop. She has used her profits to diversify the business into chicken rearing. Both of Portia’s businesses are now successful and she is an economically independent young lady. She is using the profits earned to buy food, clothing and furniture for the family.

She hopes to get a second loan so that she can further expand her clothing business and purchase a variety of clothes and shoes.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Aparna

texts.en:
Forty-year-old, married woman Aparna lives in the small village Kalabagan in Khagrabari. She is a mother of two children (one son and one daughter). Both are students.

Aparna's husband works for a courier service. His income is insufficient to raise all the household costs of the family, so to supplement his income, Aparna is also engaged in a small, income-generating work. Though their income is scanty, they are striving hard to provide education to their children.

Aparna's son, Kamalesh, is 17 years old and pursuing his graduation level education (Bachelor of Arts) from Cooch Behar College. He cherished a dream since his childhood to become a teacher and will teach the poor village children. To fulfill his dream, he strives hard to complete his graduation with good marks.

Both Aparna and her husband have great expectations for their son. They expect he will achieve high educational qualification to compete with other students, but they can't afford the huge educational expenses of their son.

Hence, Aparna is requesting a loan from BJS (a Kiva partner) to bear the educational expenses of her son. She plans to pay college fees, buy study materials and engage private tutors for her son. The loan will help this bright young boy to continue his education without any obstacles

Aparna and Kamalesh (in the photo) are grateful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To pay for her son's education costs.

loans.name: Bina Rani

texts.en:
Forty-two-year-old Bina lives in a small village named Bara Shoulmari in Falakata. She has three sons. Her husband is associated with a tea leaf business. Bina faces difficulties to bear the educational as well as household costs of her family. Bina tries her best to provide uninterrupted education to her sons. All of her sons go to school.

One of her sons, Ujjal, is studying in grade 8 in Jadabpalli High School. His half yearly exam is knocking at the door. Thus, he needs proper guidance and study materials to score good marks.

But Bina faces difficulties to bear all educational expenses of her three sons with the sole income of her husband. Bina thought she should help her son Ujjal so that he can do better in his upcoming examination and pass grade 8 smoothly.

Hence, Bina is requesting a loan from BJS (a Kiva partner) to bear the educational expenses of her son. She will use the loan money to pay school and tuition fees and buy necessary study materials for her son Ujjal. The loan will help a bright boy to continue his education without any obstacles.

Bina and Ujjal (in the photo) are happy and grateful to BJS and Kiva for their kind support.

loans.use: to pay for her son's educational expenses for grade 8.

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane is 61 years old and she lives in Stepanavan city of Lori region. She graduated Vanadzor State Pedagogical Institute the faculty of physics. She has an unbelievably big experience in this sphere with 40 years of pedagogical experience. She works at the school as a teacher of physics.

Simultaneously with her work at the school she gives paid private courses of her subject and prepares them for the entrance exams. Gayane mentions, that she is happy of the choice of her profession, and the work in which she is engaged since her very young age. Now this loan of 500.000 Armenian drams Ganaye asks for the purchase of computer and professional literature and she is thankful for support beforehand since it will make her courses surely more informative for her pupils.

loans.use: to buy computer and professional literature for her private physics courses

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl is a 40-year-old woman from San Dionisio, Iloilo. She is married with 15 years old daughter. Her husband is a public employee while she is engaged in various businesses like buying and selling gasoline to the community. She also buys and sells rice. She has been doing this for 15 years. Cheryl dreams to improve her business to have her own capital in the future to run her business.

Thus, she is asking a loan to buy gasoline and rice to sell. Other part of the loan she asks is to buy fertilizer for their crop. She is also doing rice farming as another source of their income.

loans.use: to buy gasoline, rice and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks and iron to build a room to expand his house and increase the level of security in his community.

loans.name: Rafael Antonio

texts.es:
Rafael es un hombre de 34 años de edad casado, que se dedica a realizar los trabajos de agricultura.
Este hombre en el momento se encuentra realizando unas modificaciones y adecuaciones para ampliar su cultivo, todo apuntando a su deseo y objetivo de mejorar su calidad de vida y tener una unidad productiva firme y sostenible en el tiempo.
Rafael se encuentra solicitando un apoyo económico para pagar la mano de obra que se encargara de realizar las respectivas adecuaciones y construcción de canales de riegos.
Este préstamo serpa un gran apoyo y aliciente en sus planes de mejoramiento de su actividad productiva y traerá gran progreso y agilidad a su forma de trabajar.
texts.en:
Rafael is 34 years old, he is married and he engages in agriculture. He is currently working on changes and improvements to expand his crop, with the aim and desire to improve his standard of living and to run a solid and sustainable activity.
Rafael is requesting a loan to pay for laborers who are in charge of making the relevant improvements and of building the irrigation canals.
This loan will be of great support and encouragement to the improvement plans he has for his activity, and it will give a big progress and speed to his working routines.

loans.use: to pay laborers who are presently working on relevant improvements and on building irrigation  canals.

loans.name: Akbari

texts.en:
Akbari is a 51-year-old, married woman who has five children. The man shown in the photo is her husband. She and her husband are running a business making crackers. They make delicious crackers at home, and then sell them to the people of their community. They make enough through this business.

Akbari has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. She has requested a loan of 55,000 PKR [Pakistani rupees]. This loan will help her to purchase packs of oil, salt, and flour, which will increase their sales. She hopes to have an increase in her net income and wants to spend part of it on the expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase packs of oil, salt, and flour, which will increase her sales.

loans.name: Ma. Hydee

texts.en:
Ma. Hydee is from Talibon, Bohol. She is 41 years old and is supporting a seven-year-old son.

She has been engaged in a sari-sari store business for 13 years now, in order to help her husband. This kind of store is simply attached to the owner’s home. Ma. Hydee sell items like noodles, canned goods, items in sachet, coffee, shampoo, bath soap, detergent powder, and chips.

Ma. Hydee is asking for a loan to buy boxes of canned food, rice, and snacks. In the future, she aspires to improve her livelihood and expand her business, for better revenue.

loans.use: to buy canned food, rice, and snacks.

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en:
Shahida is 27 years old, and a hardworking woman who has two children. She has been providing the service of stitching clothes in her locality. She is quite popular for her skills in stitching. When she began working, Shahida brought the family out of a financial crisis that they had been facing. Over the years, she has established a good clientele.

Now, Shahida has requested a loan amount of 40,000 PKR. She intends to use this loan to purchase a new stitching machine, with some spools of thread and lace for meeting the demands of her customers consistently. She aspires to save money for their prosperous future.

loans.use: to purchase a new stitching machine, with some spools of thread and lace for meeting the demands of her customers consistently.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua is 48 years old. He is married with three children. He has been in farming business for 14 years. He earns a monthly income of twenty thousand shillings.

This is his first loan from VisionFund Kenya and he plans to use the loan to buy farm inputs like seeds and fertilizer. He will use the profits to meet family expenses and pay school fees for his children.

His hopes and dreams for the future are to have a good business and a happy family.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs like seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Antonio Jose

texts.es:
Antonio es un señor con 47 años de edad, la adversidad que lo ha perseguido no ha sido obstáculo para querer salir adelante y realizar sus sueños.
Lo que se propone lo consigue, trabaja en ventas de pollos y huevos con el propósito de  mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda.

Se encuentra solicitando un préstamo el cual lo invertirá en la compra de polos y alimento para los mismos.

Ayuda a este hombre soñador, trabajador y humilde a salir adelante con sus proyectos, anímese, haga un préstamo.
texts.en:
Antonio is a 47 year old man who faces many adversities, but those have not become an obstacle for him to continue to get ahead and achieve his dreams. What he sets to do, he gets it done, he sells chickens and eggs with the purpose of improving his living conditions. He is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of chickens and food to feed them.

Help this dreamer, hard working and humble man to get ahead with his projects. Come on, make a loan.

loans.use: to buy chickens and food to feed them.

loans.name: Titus

texts.en:
Titus is 31 years old. He is married and has two children. His business is operating a cafe. He has been in this business for 10 years. He earns a monthly income of thirty thousand shillings.

This is his fifth loan with VisionFund Kenya. He plans to use the loan to buy stock for the cafe, including milk, firewood, maize, flour, beans, sugar, cooking oil, etcetera.

He will use the profits to expand the business. His hopes and dreams for the future are to have a good business and a happy family.

loans.use: to buy stock for the cafe, including milk, firewood, maize, flour, beans, sugar, cooking oil, etcetera.

loans.name: Augustine

texts.en: Augustine wants to finish paying for his house with the money advanced to him. He has various sources of income that can enable him to pay back the loan. For example, he owns a retail shop, and he supplements the income from the shop with crop growing and working as a mechanic. He has been doing this work since 2008. With the proceeds, he is able to look after his family and has great hopes to complete paying for his house. The major setbacks in his business are inadequate capital and bad debtors.

loans.use: to finish paying for his house.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to start renting a hardware shop.

loans.name: Essodina

texts.fr: Essodina est un homme divorcé avec un enfant à charge qui vit à Tokoin. Agée de 46 ans, Essodina est un marchand de foyers qui s’approvisionne une fois dans le mois chez les soudeurs et les revendent au marché avec l’intention d’en tirer un maximum de profit. Essodina nécessite ce prêt pour commander des foyers en vue de disposer d’un grand nombre de stock afin de répondre aux attentes de ses clients et subvenir à ses besoins quotidiens.
texts.en: Essodina is a divorced man, has a child to support, and lives in Tokoin. He is 46 years old and a seller of stoves, with which he resupplies himself from welders. He resells the stoves at the market with the aim of making a maximum profit. Essodina needs this loan to order stoves in order to have a large number in stock for responding to the expectations of his customers and for day-to-day income.

loans.use: to purchase 17 stoves

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce(48) is a single mother of 3. She has not had a stable job for a long time and depends on child support grants to sustain her family. Despite these hurdles, Joyce is optimistic and hardworking. Through the local council she has managed to secure a small piece of land where she now wants to rear grade chicken eventually selling meat and eggs.

She is requesting for a Kiva loan to build a chicken coop as well as install feeding troughs. This loan will help her start the business and give her an opportunity to earn a living and educate her children.

loans.use: to build a chicken coop and install troughs

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora sells fresh fish to earn a living. She is married woman with five children. Three of her children are still attending school. To augment her income, she runs a sari-sari(variety) store. She sells items like sugar, spices, matches, cooking oil, soap, coffee, biscuits and assorted groceries. Together with her family, she lives in Loon, Bohol.

She is asking for a loan to purchase fish and assorted grocery items. With these, her store will be filled with stock again. She also sells fresh to the locals where she lives. Thus, she could afford to buy nutritious foods and continue send her children to school.

She hopes to continue handle her livelihood and able to support the needs of her growing children.

loans.use: to purchase fish and assorted grocery items

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 30 years old. She is married and has two children.She operates a beauty salon and has been in business for four years. This is her fifth loan from VisionFund Kenya. 

She will use the loan to buy hair oils, shampoos, weaves and nail polish. She will use profits from the business to do increase her savings and service the loan.Her hopes and dreams for the future are to be financially stable and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy hair oils, shampoos, weaves and nail polish.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita has been running a sari-sari store for two years. She is from Getafe, Bohol. She is a 38-year-old, married woman, and she has three children, ages 11, 14 and 17 years. Her husband is a farmer and works in the government.

Lolita is requesting a loan, for additional capital with which to buy canned goods and soft drinks. In the future, she plans to reinvest her profits and continue to expand her business, so she can send her children to school

loans.use: to buy canned goods and soft drinks.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 52 years old. She is married and has four children. Her business is poultry keeping. She has been in this business for seven years. She earns a monthly income of eight thousand shillings.

This is her second loan with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy chicks and poultry feeds. She will use the profits from expanded business to expand her business and pay school fees for her children. Her hopes and dreams are to have a better future.

loans.use: to buy chicks and poultry feeds.

loans.name: Federico

texts.en:
Federico is encouraged that he previously received and faithfully paid his loan on time. The proceeds of his loan really helped render safe and efficient tricycle service thus he was able to provide for his family. Aside from his tricycle he also has a small farm. Life may be hard but he is thankful that he was able to raise his children well.

To help Federico maintain his service, he is again humbly seeking a Php 19000 to replace tires and for the regular maintenance of his tricycle and partly to pay for fertilizers for a productive harvest on his farm. He values his farm and transportation business for they are his main source of income. He is thanking God and you in advance for supporting his livelihood. 

Federico dreams to be more successful and be able to complete construction of his house. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God he studies.

 * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay Micro finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the repair and maintenance of his tricycle unit and fertilizers as well for his farm.

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en:
Jacob is 37 years old. He is married and has one child. His businesses are running a cafeteria and farming. He has been in business for two years and earns a monthly income of twelve thousand shillings.

This is his second loan with VisionFund Kenya. He plans to use the loan to buy stock for the cafe, including maize, flour, beans, sugar, cooking oil, etcetera.

He will use the profits to service the loan, and to increase his savings in order to qualify for bigger loans later. His hopes and dreams for the future are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy stock for the cafe, including maize, flour, beans, sugar, cooking oil, etcetera.

loans.name: Schadrack

texts.en:
Schadrack is a first-year student at Kepler. At 37, he is the oldest student the program has ever admitted. But due to his impressive academic credentials and dedication, he was accepted to Kepler from over 6,000 applicants this year. Schadrack chose to attend Kepler because it provides a chance for students to gain skills that make them competitive in the labor market.
 
Schadrack plans to major in Communications with a Concentration in Business, and will graduate Kepler with a BA from an accredited US university. With his degree, he hopes to transition from his career as a primary school teacher to running his own business. Already quite advanced in his English language and technology skills, his experience will be a major asset for his peers.

loans.use: to pay for a laptop required for a US college degree.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to open a second cook ware shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy gasoline, fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.name: Belta

texts.en:
Belta is 34 years old. She is married and has three children. Her business is greengrocery. She has been in this business for 16 years.

She earns a monthly income of ten thousand shillings. This is her second loan with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy stock of tomatoes, potatoes, cabbages and kale.

She will use the profits from expanded business to expand her business and pay school fees for her children. Her hopes and dreams are to have a big business.

loans.use: to buy stock of tomatoes, potatoes, cabbages and kales.

loans.name: Solidaria Mujer Mujeres Del Futuro Group

texts.es:
Yesenia es la presidenta del grupo Solidaria Mujer Mujeres del Futuro, un pequeño grupo conformado por 3 socias que se dedican a actividades agropecuarias y una de ellas a preparación y venta de tamales.  
Esta líder es una mujer muy trabajadora que busca contribuir con los gastos de su hogar, realizando esta actividad productiva para ayudar a su familia compuesta por sus 3 hijas, 2 de ellas cursan la primaria y secundaria, además de su esposo quien trabaja de forma ocasional como soldador. Este es el cuarto crédito que solicita, los anteriores se han pagado de forma muy puntual y se han invertido en su emprendimiento de cría y desarrollo de cerdos, al igual que esta nueva inversión será destinada para la compra de animales y los insumos necesarios para su desarrollo. El impacto de del crédito para Yesenia y su familia es desde la posibilidad de contar con un capital para iniciar, hasta consolidar y reforzar la producción mediante los financiamientos. Las metas y proyecciones que tiene esta clienta son seguir apoyando económicamente a su esposo, contribuir con el pago de los estudios de sus hijas y más adelante tener la posibilidad de tener su casa propia ya que ente momento alquila.
texts.en:
Yesenia is the president of the credit group Solidaria Mujer Mujeres del Futuro.  It is a small group made up of three women who work in agriculture, one of whom makes and sells tamales.

This leader is a very hardworking woman who is looking to help with the household expenses.  She does her job to help her family, which consists of three daughters.  Two of her daughters are elementary and secondary school students.  Her husband works as a temporary employee, working as a welder.  

This is the fourth loan she has taken out.  They have repaid the prior loans very punctually, investing in their business of raising pigs.  Likewise, this current loan is earmarked for the purchase of animals and supplies needed to raise them.  

For Yesenia and her family, the impact of this loan includes the possibility of having capital for starting, establishing, and strengthening their production by means of these loans.  This client’s goals and projections are to keep supporting her husband financially, contributing to the school payments for her daughters, and in the future having the possibility of owning her own home, since at this point in time she rents.

loans.use: to buy pigs and the supplies needed for their care

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 73 years old. She is married and has five children. Her business is farming. She has been in this business for 10 years. She earns a monthly income of twelve thousand shillings.

This is her third loan with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. She will use the profits from expanded business to service the loan and increase her savings. Her hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Tsitsi

texts.en:
Tsitsi is a 33-year-old businesswoman who is married with two children. She rents a table at the local market where she sells products such as bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, track suits and T-shirts. Tsitsi is a role model for her community.

When Tsitsi received her first Kiva loan, she purchased more stock for her retail business. With the remainder of the money, Tsisti started buying and selling broiler chickens and matemba (dried sardines) because the clothing market had low financial returns. Tsitsi repaid her loan very well and would like to borrow a second loan now, for her to expand her poultry business that she started with the profits she got from her first loan.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks, chick feed, and medications.

loans.name: Adjorman Group

texts.en:
The Adjorman loan group will begin its tenth loan cycle with ID-Ghana, Teshie branch. It is made up of six members and is represented by Janet. The businesses that the members of the loan group carry out are varied and among them are drinks, body and hair creams, grocery, fruits, second hand clothing, fresh fish, eggs, bags and onions.

The loan that they will get will benefit the small business owners of whom Janet is one. She joined ID-Ghana at the invitation of a neighbor who is a client of the institution. Currently, she has a business selling drinks, body and hair creams and grocery. She explains that she has been doing this job for 11 years now.

The loan that she is getting out now will be to increase her capital (to purchase drinks, body and hair creams, grocery in bulk) which she will get from the wholesale market in the city of Accra and will sell them from her retail store. This type of work allows her to generate resources to support herself economically since she is single. This is Janet's second loan from Kiva.

When asked what she likes about ID-Ghana, she replies that she likes the loan and health training that the institution offers.

loans.use: to purchase drinks, body and hair creams and grocery items in bulk.

loans.name: Jinan Group

texts.en:
Nadia is the featured borrower of Jinan group. She got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, because they have always been best neighbors and they work hard to develop their families' livings, in addition to their businesses.

Nadia is the woman in the center of the picture. She is a hard-working farmer who specializes in planting and selling Mulukhiyah. Nadia also works in a Mouneh business, which she runs from her house, upon customers' previously set requests.

Nadia is acquiring her current loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to increase her Mouneh production and sales by increasing her raw materials and special season fruits and vegetables, for processing.

She is a 53-year-old, married mother of four children, who puts so much effort into supporting her husband in developing their family's living through increasing their income.

As for the other group members, Hanan is the woman at the far right, with black dress, and Habiba is the woman at the far left.

loans.use: to increase her Mouneh production and sales by increasing her raw materials and special season fruits and vegetables, for processing.

loans.name: Wilmar Andres

texts.es:
Hace un año empezó el sueño como Independiente el señor Wilmar un hombre bondadoso y trabajador que montó un cultivo de flores apoyándose de la experiencia que adquirió trabajando en una empresa de cultivo de flores.
Wilmar es padre de dos pequeños de 9 y 3 años de edad, es casado y actualmente genera 3 empleos.
Como hace poco Inicio su negocio y todavía están en etapa de consolidación y adaptación al mercado y no cuenta con muchos recursos para abonar y proteger sus cultivos.
Wilmar quiere solicitar un apoyo económico para la compra de semillas, colinas, riegos y comprar químicos.
Estos insumos le ayudaran a mantener sus flores, su propósito es mantener su negocio en el tiempo, exportar y en un futuro comprar una vivienda propia, rodeada de amplios terrenos todos ellos cubiertos de flores.
texts.en:
A year ago, he started to live his dream of working independently. Wilmar is a kind and hard working man who started growing flowers with the experience he got while working in a flower production company.

Wilmar is the father of 2 young children, 9 and 3 years old. He is married and currently has 3 jobs. Since he recently started his business and is still in the stage of consolidation and adapting to the market, he does not count with many resources to fertilize and protect his crop.

Wilmar is requesting financial help to purchase seeds, hills, irrigation and to purchase chemicals. These supplies will help him maintain his flowers. His purpose is to maintain his business and with time, export. In the future, he would like to purchase his own house surrounded by spacious land all covered with flowers.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, hills, irrigation and chemicals.

loans.name: Shoindjon

texts.ru: Шоинджону 26 лет.  Он из района Руми. Шоинджон на разводе с женой. У него есть маленький сын.  Шоинджон живет с родителями и сыном. Он самостоятельный, трудолюбивый, заботливый человек. Шоинджон помогает родителям в работе и ведет свой бизнес. Он выращивает барашек. У же год он занят животноводством. Шоинджон считает, что набрал себе много опыта и хочет продвигать бизнес на новый уровень, он уверен в себе, что станет успешным человеком. Ему нужно финансовая поддержка. По этой причине Шоинджон обратился за кредитом. Вы можете помочь ему с финансовыми проблемами. За счет кредита он купить пару барашек и расширить деятельность.
texts.en:
