Shoindjon is 26 and from the Rumi region. He and his wife are divorced and he has a small son. He lives with his parents and his son. He is an independent, hardworking, caring person who helps his parents in their work and runs his own business, too. For about a year he has been working in animal husbandry, raising rams. He believes he has gained a lot of experience and wants to bring his business to a new level. He is sure he will become a successful person.

Shoindjon needs financial support and for this reason is looking for a loan. You can help him with his financial problems. He will use the loan amount to buy a pair of rams and expand his business.

loans.use: to buy a pair of rams and expand his business

loans.name: Carmen Lisseth

texts.es: Carmen de 31 años de edad, vive muy feliz en casa propia y humilde junto con su madre y padre. Ella es una mujer admirable y trabajadora que quiere salir adelante y que ayuda a sus padres económicamente. Carmen ha establecido en su casa una tienda, en la cual ofrece artículos de primera necesidad y es así de esta forma que ella cubre las necesidades básicas de sus padres como personalmente. Además, Carmen  junto a su madre hacen pupusas tres veces por semana, esto le permite tener ingresos extras. Anteriormente Carmen solicito un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en su negocio, lo cual tuvo resultados positivos pues pudo abastecer más su tienda y generar mayores ingresos económicos. Nuevamente, Carmen solicita un crédito a FUSAI para poder comprar: artículos de primera necesidad y harinas de maíz, chicharrón, queso entre otros. Así poco a poco para que su negocio vaya creciendo.
texts.en:
Carmen is 31 years old and lives happily in her own humble house together with her mother and father. She is an admirable and hard-working woman who wants to get ahead and help her parents economically. Carmen has established a store in her house where she offers basic food items. In this way she covers the basic needs of her parents and her own. Also Carmen together with her mother make pupusas three times a week, which allows her to have extra income.

Carmen previously requested a loan from FUSAI to invest in her business which had positive results as she was able to stock her store more and generate greater economic income. Once again Carmen is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy basic food items, corn flour, pork cracklings and cheese amongst others. In this way her business can grow little by little.

loans.use: to buy basic food items, corn flour, pork cracklings and cheese amongst others for her store and pupusas sales.

loans.name: Diosdado

texts.en:
Diosdao is a merchant from Talibon, Bohol. He runs a sari-sari (variety) store selling various goods to the people in his community.  
Diosdao works hard to earn a living so that he can support his four children ages 5 to 19. Diosdado  is asking for a loan to buy additional merchandise to sell in his store, such as canned sardines, noodles, soap, shampoo, rice , gasoline and bottled water.
Through this, he will be able to attract more buyers to his store, thus augmenting his income.  Diosdao dreams of making his business a success.

loans.use: to buy canned sardines, noodles, soap, shampoo, rice , gasoline and bottled water

loans.name: Felesciano

texts.en: Felesciano is a 62-year-old married man from Talibon, Bohol. He has seven grown children. He engages in fishing and farming seaweeds.  This has been his business for 31 years now. He is asking a loan of PHP10000 to buy seaweed seedlings and fishing nets.  In the future, Felesciano would like to expand his fishing business to improve their livelihood.

loans.use: to buy seaweed seedlings and fishing nets

loans.name: Thinnakonnam Jlg - 005 Group

texts.en:
Malar is the leader of the Thinnakonnam JLG-005 group and the group has 4 other members – Amsavalli, Boomathi, Bhuvaneswari and Sumathi. . Malar is 29 and a mother of two. She earns her daily wages by doing manual labour on agricultural fields. She wants to supplement her income and ensure there is a more steady source of income to support her family.

To this end, she underwent training from Gramalaya Microfin Foundation in making foot mats. Now, she, along with the other members in the group are seeking a loan to start a business from home. Malar wants to start her business of making foot mats. The others also need funding to start foot mat making businesses of their own. The income from the business will help them boost their income, and save more in the long run, for their children's education, and for any emergencies that may arise.

loans.use: To start her foot mat making business

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
Jamila is 45 years old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of three daughters and one son. She is a house wife and looks after her family at home. Her husband provides services in shuttering work for building making. In this regard her husband needs raw material such as soldering rods, welding rods, iron rods and sheets for manufacturing Iron's accessories to improve his shuttering work. So that he can generate more income for financially support of his family. Jamila is applying for loan from kiva field partner for her husband work.
She is thankful to brac Pakistan and kiva.

loans.use: to buy raw material for her husband's shuttering work

loans.name: Blanca Araceli

texts.es:
Blanca, de 52 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está soltera, pero tiene 3 hijos, todos viven con ellos y dos estudian bachillerato y el otro estudia en la universidad.

Blanca, se ha dedicado a la venta de ropa desde hace más de 8 años y aprendió por iniciativa, la venta la realiza en las comunidades más cercanas y en su casa, ella sale desde muy temprano y viaja en bus y regresa a casa a las 3 de la tarde. 

El crédito lo necesita para comprar ropa de niños y de mujer como faldas, camisas y ropa interior, pero también comprará lociones y cremas para surtir más las ventas.- Anteriormente se le otorgó un crédito el cual fue de mucha satisfacción, porque no dejó de trabajar y pago el crédito sin problema. 

El sueño de Blanca, es ver a su hijo graduado de la universidad y que su otro hijo se prepare académicamente.
texts.en:
Blanca, age 52, studied through the ninth grade.  She is single, but has three children, all of whom live with them.  Two of them are in high school and the other is in college.

Blanca has worked selling clothing for more than eight years.  She learned this through her own initiative.  She makes her sales in the communities closest to her home.  She heads out very early and travels by bus, returning home around 3 p.m.

She needs this loan to buy children’s clothing and women’s clothing such as skirts, tops, and underwear, but she will also buy lotions and creams to bolster her sales.  Previously, she was granted a loan which was very satisfactory; she didn’t stop working and she repaid the loan without a problem.

Blanca’s dream is to see her son graduate from the university, and that her other son is well-prepared academically.

loans.use: to buy children's clothing and women's clothing, such as skirts, tops, and underwear.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy mail-order lotions to sell.

loans.name: Amsterdam Group

texts.en:
Obadia, who is in his late 30s is married with two children who are still at school. He has been running a transportation (a tricycle) business for six years now. He works from 08am to 08pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be his 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He will use this loan to service his tricycle and be rest assured of making more trips without any problem. He dreams of becoming an international business man.

Obadia will share this loan with his loan group AMSTERDAM which consists of five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to service his tricycle and be rest assured of making more trips without any problem.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 46 years old and is a mother of the children.She runs a boutique at Mariakani,Kenya of selling African design clothing.


This is her second loan from vision Fund Kenya which she will use to purchase African design clothing material for sale  .She will use the anticipated profits to expand her boutique in future and improve her families standards of living.

loans.use: to purchase African design clothing materials

loans.name: Jorge Eliecer

texts.es:
Jorge es un hombre soltero con 36 años de edad, su deseo es montar su propio negocio, dedicarse a la venta de comida, un medio que lo ayude a salir adelante y superar  una crisis económica la cual vivió  luego de quedarse sin empleo varios meses.

Su propósito es formalizar su negocio, continuar trabajando hasta cumplir el sueño de tener su vivienda propia y dejar en un futuro el negocio a sus hijos.

Se encuentra solicitando un préstamo el cual lo invertirá en la compra de sillas, mesas, surtido de helados y bebidas.

Con su apoyo y ayuda este hombre podrá lograr sus metas, haga un préstamo.
texts.en:
Jorge is a single 36-year-old man. His desire is to set up his own business and earn his living selling food, a way to help him support himself and overcome a financial crisis that he experienced after being unemployed for several months.

His objective is to legally establish his business and continue working until he fulfills his dream of having his own house and leaving the business to his children in the future.

He is currently requesting a loan that he will invest in the purchase of chairs, tables, and an assortment of ice creams and drinks.

With your support and help, this man will be able to achieve his goals; make a loan.

loans.use: to buy chairs, tables, and an assortment of ice cream and drinks

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy stock of books, pens, pencils and papers to sell ahead of third term.

loans.name: San Pablo Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SAN PABLO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Huayopata, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convencion y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Aurelia ella es conviviente y tiene 49 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de cultivo de frutas, la socia tiene un terreno donde cultiva plátanos, café, mandarinas y naranjas, la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar su terreno de cultivo. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de agricultura, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de frutas.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The communal bank "San Pablo" is located in the Huayopata district of La Convencion province which is in the department of Cusco.

The member is called Aurelia. she is 49 years old and lives with her partner and has three children. She owns some land where she grows fruit including bananas, coffee, mandarins and oranges. She works from 6:00am until 5:00pm. She has been doing this for several years and it is going very well. Her dream is to expand the area of her cropland. She is asking for a loan to buy seeds and fertiliser.

The other members of the group sell animals, work in agriculture, own a business selling fruit and run a grocery store.

Aurelia is thankful for all those people that formed part of her dreams through this means and she promises to make her instalment payments on time.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertiliser.

location.town: Sector san pablo/distrito de la convencion

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina runs a sari-sari (variety) store, selling various commodities in her place in Talibon, Bohol. She sells items such as eggs, flour, sugar, condiments, powdered milk, and toiletries. She is 45 years old, married, and has five children ages four to seventeen.

She is asking for a loan to buy soft drinks, canned food, seasoning and toiletries. With these, her store will be filled with a variety of stock and will attract more customers. This will help her to improve her income and be able to manage her finances.

Gina is hoping that she will be able to expand her sari-sari store inventory and to become more sustainable.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, canned food, seasoning and toiletries.

loans.name: Amelyn

texts.en:
Amelyn is 39 years old and married with three children.

Amelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 7,500 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, snack foods and other personal care products.

Amelyn has borrowed and repaid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from farming rice and e-loading (selling pre-paid cellular telephone credits).

Amelyn aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, snack foods and other personal care products.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a 45-year-old woman from Talibon, Bohol. She is a mother to three children, ages 9, 13, and 17. She has been in the hog-raising business for 11 years now. She also owns a tricycle for extra income. Her husband is a a rice mill operator and barely earns enough to cover their needs for food.

Gina is applying for a loan from CEVI to buy feed, fuel, a spare tire, and supplements, as well as to change the oil on her tricycle. With the loan, she can maximize her businesses and the opportunity for higher income.

She wants to develop and improve her businesses to augment her income and provide a better life for her children.

loans.use: to buy feed, fuel, a spare tire, and supplements, as well to change the oil on her tricycle.

loans.name: Abadasigana Fcb Ii Group

texts.en:
Claire is a group leader and is 32 years old. She is married and has three children between the ages of 8 and 14. They all go to school. Claire's group is called ABADASIGANA, which means “TOGETHER” in English. They sell different products, and they wish to expand their businesses to build a better future.

Claire sells foodstuffs. She has been running a business for 13 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more bananas, cassava, and beans for resale. The profits from the business will be used to pay for medical insurance and to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more bananas, cassava, and beans for resale.

loans.name: Akouwa

texts.fr: Akouwa  est âgée de 34 ans et est une femme mariée. Akouwa  vit avec ses quatre enfants et son mari à Tokoin où elle prépare de la bouillie faite à base du maïs accompagner des beignets  pour ses consommateurs qui trouvent satisfaction dans son activité. Akouwa  s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et désire commander de la farine de blé et des bols de sucre afin de gagner une bonne marge bénéficiaire pour ainsi promouvoir l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Akouwa is a 34-year-old, married woman. Akouwa lives with her four children and her husband in Tokoin. She makes corn porridge accompanied by doughnuts for her customers, who enjoy her business. 

Akouwa buys supplies twice a month at the market and wants to order flour and bowls of sugar. She would like to make a good profit margin in order to support her children's education.

loans.use: to buy 1 bag of flour and 10 bowls of sugar.

loans.name: Sandra Iris

texts.es:
Sandra, de 39 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, se dedica desde hace varios años a la agricultura y al comercio de frutas junto a su esposo, él le ayuda en los trabajos de siembra de maíz y a buscar la fruta para vender.

Sandra, se dedica a trabajar en la parcela que alquila junto a su esposo durante la mañana y en el transcurso del día se dedica a buscar frutas en los alrededores, para ir a vender después al mercado.

Sandra, necesita el préstamo para comprar una vaca, para producir leche y salir a venderla en los alrededores y obtener ingresos adicionales.

Sandra, desea construir una vivienda digna para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Sandra is 39 years old and studied up to Grade 9. She has worked in agriculture for several years and selling fruit along with her husband. He helps her with the work growing corn and finding the fruit to sell.

Sandra works in the plot of land that she rents together with her husband in the mornings and during the course of the day she works looking for fruit in the surrounding area to sell later at the market.

Sandra needs a loan to buy a cow to produce milk which she will sell in the area and obtain additional income.

Sandra wants to construct a dignified house for her and her family.

loans.use: to buy a cow to produce milk and sell it.

loans.name: Andres Del Carmen

texts.es:
Andrés es un productor de café que vive en una comunidad rural al norte de Nicaragua. Vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos en una finca de 5 hectáreas, de las cuales 4 ha destinado para el cultivo del café, el cual maneja bajo los criterios de certificación Comercio Justo. 

Para este año, este productor está solicitando un crédito que le permita comprar los insumos que requiere su cafetal, a fin de lograr una buena cosecha en este ciclo, siendo su meta para los próximos años, mejorar las condiciones de su finca y con ello los ingresos para dar un nivel de vida más digno a su familia. Está seguro que con las inversiones que haga en su cafetal irá mejorando sus condiciones económicas.
texts.en:
Andrés is a coffee producer that lives in a rural area to the north of Nicaragua. He lives with his wife and two children on a plot of land measuring 5 hectares, four of which are used to grow coffee which he manages under the fair trade certification criteria.

This year he is asking for a loan so that he can buy the supplies that his coffee plantation requires. This will give him a good harvest which will act as a benchmark for years to come. It will also allow him to improve the conditions of his plot and, as a result, increase his income in order to provide his family with a better life. He is sure that through investing into his coffee plantation he will be able to improve his financial situation.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies to use on his coffee plantation.

loans.name: Anila

texts.en:
Anila is a 31-year-old vigorous, married woman. She has had a business doing machine embroidery for many years. She knows the art of making beautiful embroidery patterns with beads and pearls. She is zealous about her work, and client demand is strong. Anila’s embroidery patterns are very popular on her street, and she is the best earning resource in her household. She is a mother of three children.

She wants to grow her business, so she availed a Murabaha loan of 25,000 PKR to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins, and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand time after time. She is shown in the photo with her brother.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins, and pearls in large quantities

loans.name: San Martin De Porres Group

texts.es:
Brenda Emelin, tiene 22 años de edad, ella forma parte del grupo San Martin de Porres que está integrado por cinco personas, de las cuales todos son pequeños comerciantes y cuyo propósito es salir adelante y hacer crecer sus negocios.
Brenda Emelin, se dedica desde hace mas de cinco años a la venta de ropa, su forma de trabajo es mediante pedidos fijos, por lo que la compra de su mercadería está asegurada la venta.
Ella ofrece sus prendas a vestir a sus familiares, amigos cercanos y vecinos quienes cada temporada le hacen pedidos para sus familiares.
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá para cubrir pedidos de ropa para el invierno para damas, caballeros y niños.
texts.en:
Brenda Emelin, 22, is one of five members of the San Martin de Porres community bank.  The members formed their group to raise funds for managing and growing their small commercial businesses.  
Brenda Emelin has operated a clothing sales business for five years.  She only buys merchandise to order so that she can always be sure of her sales and she only sells to relatives, close friends and neighbors.  
Brenda Emelin is applying for a loan that she will use to fill orders for winter clothing that she has already received from her customers.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her clothing sales business.

loans.name: Bargugul

texts.ru: Баргигул 41 летняя уроженка города Душанбе. Баргигул занимается шитьем женской одежды. Она замужем за простого водителя. В браке у нее трое детей. Старшему сыну 21 год. Он предпочел уехать в Российскую Федерацию, чтобы стать самостоятельным человеком. Дочке 18 лет, младшему сыну 16 лет. Они учатся, и Баргигул старается, чтобы ее дети успевали в учебе, и создает им условия. Скоро начнется учебный год Баргигулу необходимо купить учебники и школьную форму, чтобы подготовить детей к школе. По этой причине она обращается за кредитом. Ее средства не позволяют ей совершить покупку, и она видит выход из этой ситуации в получения кредита.
texts.en: Bargugul is a 41-year-old native of the city of Dushanbe. She sews women’s clothing. She is married and her husband is a driver. Her oldest son is 21, and he chose to leave home and go to Russia to become an independent person. Her daughter is 18, and her youngest son is 16. They are both in school, and Bargugul works hard to make sure her children succeed in school by providing them with everything they need. The academic year will be starting soon and Bargugul needs to buy textbooks and school uniforms so that her children will be prepared for school. This is why she applied for a loan. She does not have the money to make the purchase and sees a loan as a way out of this situation.

loans.use: to buy books and uniforms for her children

loans.name: San Isidro De Compone Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SAN ISIDRO DE COMPONE”; Este banco se ubica en la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.
 La socia Jovita tiene 51 años de edad tiene 01 hijo  y es soltera, la socia alterna su actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de cereales a todo sus clientes que le solicitan, la  socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta manera seguir apoyando a su familia. 
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de maíz entre otros.
 Los socios en general  se sienten agradecidos  por el crédito otorgado y se comprometen a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas. 
La socia que sale en la foto adjunta pidió permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
The members belong to San Isidro de Compone Communal Bank, located in the province of Anta in the department of Cusco.

Jovita, 51, is single and has one child. She alternates her daily activities with her business selling cereals to all her customers who request them. She has had her business for some time and it's going well for her thanks to the effort she puts into it every day. She wants to be able to continue working and supporting her family.

Jovita's requesting the loan to buy corn and other items.

The members in general are grateful for the loan granted and promise to make their payments punctually.

The member in the attached photo asked permission to arrive late to the meeting because of work.

loans.use: to buy corn and other items

loans.name: Afi Ewoenam

texts.fr: Mère de cinq enfants, Afi est une femme mariée âgée de 28 ans vivant à Tokoin. Afi est une revendeuse des habits pour bébé et des produits de beauté qu’elle achète une fois par mois au marché et le revend dans les quartiers environnant. Afi sollicite ce crédit pour commander des habits et des caleçons afin de gagner des bénéfices et venir en aide à l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants.
texts.en:
The mother of five children, Afi is a 28-year old married woman living in Tokoin. Afi sells baby clothes and beauty products that she buys once per month at the market and sells in surrounding neighbourhoods.
Afi is requesting this loan so that she can purchase clothes and underpants in order to earn revenue and help in her children's schooling.

loans.use: to purchase ten dozen underpants and twenty-five units of clothes.

loans.name: Nisreen

texts.en:
Nisreen is married and mother of three children. She sells clothes to help the family and makes her life  better .
she is a member of  Specific Union for Farmer Women in Jordan and has participated in a training session about how to manage one’s business. She has applied for a 2,000 JD loan to buy more clothes at wholesale to sell. She hopes by doing so she will further develop her trade in clothing and increase her profits. 
she wants to offer her children a good education and better life and meet all of their needs.

loans.use: to buy more clothes at wholesale to sell,

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Mère de trois enfants, Afi est une femme mariée âgée de 31 ans qui vit à Tokoin. Afi est une revendeuse de produits alimentaires qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et les revendent  à la devanture de son domicile pour gagner un revenu. Afi sollicite ce prêt pour commander des paniers de tomates fraîches en vue de répondre aux attentes de ses clients et de maximiser son profit afin d’aider son mari dans l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
The mother of three children, Afi is a 31-year old married woman who lives in Tokoin. Afi sells food products and makes her purchases twice per month at the market. She sells in front of her house in order to make a living.
Afi is requesting this loan to order baskets of fresh tomatoes so as to respond to her clients' demands, and maximise her profit to help her husband with their children's education.

loans.use: to buy twelve baskets of fresh tomatoes.

loans.name: Ma. Glenda

texts.en:
Ma. Glenda is a 43-year-old, married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has two dependents, aged eight years old.

Ma. Glenda and her husband have been in a fishing business for 23 years. She also farms seaweed.

She is asking for a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy an engine and seaweed seedlings. Once a new engine is available, she can continue her business as usual to provide for her family.

In the future, Ma. Glenda plans to buy an additional boat to create a better income.

loans.use: to buy an engine and seaweed seedlings.

loans.name: Raheelah

texts.en:
Raheelah earns an income by selling milk, cheese, butter, and other dairy goods. Presently, she rents the cow from which she obtains the milk for these goods, but she would like to own the cow. "That will save me the money that I pay for renting the cow and the cow will be mine," she says. 

Raheelah and her husband have 10 children. Her husband has poor eyesight and is jobless, so it is up to Raheelah to generate an income for the family.

Raheelah applied to Specific Union for Farmer Women in Jordan in order to request a loan. She will use her loan funds to purchase the cow.

This loan investment will allow Raheelah to meet her children's needs and to ensure their education.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Khuzama

texts.en:
Khuzama earned her Bachelor's degree almost a year ago. Because of limited employment opportunities, she has been unable to find work in her field, so she has decided to return to school to complete her studies and earn her Master's degree. This will afford her better career opportunities.

Khuzama's family cannot afford to pay her study costs because their income is limited and because the number of family members is high (eight individuals). Khuzama would like to contribute to the family income. Completing her studies will allow her to find gainful employment and help with the family expenses.

She is highly ambitious and believes that finishing her studies will allow her to be an effective human being in her community. She prays that this loan  will be facilitated.

loans.use: to pay for study costs toward earning her Master's degree

loans.name: Huda

texts.en:
Huda has a small supermarket where she sells some products to help her family. She  has three sisters and four brothers. She wants to take the loan to expand her project and to buy more products. She  wants to get some more profit because her sister Fatimah is studying in the university and she helps with her study costs because her father can't pay for her studies. 

Because she has a big family, her father's salary is not enough so she must work to help. she opened a small shop to sell different things but the profit is not much so she wants to buy more goods to sell.

loans.use: to buy goods to sell in a supermarket.

loans.name: Malak

texts.en: Malak finished her high school almost six months ago and she got a mark 74% and she did not get any support from any side to complete her studies at the university. And also her family can not pay the costs of her study because the number of her family consisting of nine members and their income is very limited.  And her education will make it difficult for them to offer her brothers and sisters their needs. She wants to take a loan in order that she can complete her studies and help her father and contribute in household expenses.

loans.use: to pay for higher education costs and transport

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.en:
Wilfredo is a 55-year old single man and raises and sells hogs.  He lives in the town of Loon, Bohol.  He has been raising and selling hogs for 5 years now.  
Aside from hog raising, he also sells rtw (ready-to-wear) items like  t-shirts, pants and foot wear apparel.

He is asking for a loan to buy pig feed and supplies like shoes and slippers. Wilfredo wants to improve his earnings and slowly handle his finances. He wants to raise quality hogs in the few months to come and sell more rtw items.

He hopes that he can improve his livelihood in the years to come.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and supplies like shoes and slippers

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rowena is 45 years old and her two children are in school.

Rowena has a food vending business in the Philippines. Rowena requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Rowena has been in this business for one year. In the future, Rowena would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 51 years old and has three children, one of whom is in school. She is single.

Cristina is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Cristina has been in this business for two years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Cristina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Esiteri

texts.en:
Esiteri is a mother of four children and lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda.

Esiteri is in the business of buying and selling cocoa, and she earns additional income from rentals. She started the business 15 years back to earn income; she works hard and has plans of expanding the cocoa business, but she faces high competition, price changes and long distances to markets.

Esiteri hopes to buy land and own large cocoa plantations in the future so as to expand the business. Esiteri wants a loan to buy cocoa to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy cocoa to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is single woman who runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, snack foods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

Angelita has been in this business for two years. 

In the future, Angelita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, snack foods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Ana Margarita

texts.es:
Ana, de 50 años de edad, se dedica desde hace varios años a la agricultura y a la crianza de ganado, este oficio lo aprendió de sus padres, porque se dedicaron a estas actividades desde siempre, ella solo estudio hasta sexto grado y su esposo es quien le ayuda con las actividades diarias.

Ana, trabaja durante la mañana en las parcelas donde siembra junto a su esposo y en el resto del día, su esposo va a trabajar en otras parcelas y ella ordeña las vacas para vender la leche y elaborar queso. 

Ana, necesita el crédito para comprar una yunta de bueyes, que le ayudaran a poder transportar la cosecha hasta su vivienda y además para que su esposo pueda obtener ingresos adicionales por trabajar en otras parcelas con los bueyes.

Ana, sueña con construir una galera en donde pueda tener sus animales para cuidarlos.
texts.en:
Ana, 50, has operated a farming and livestock-rearing business for many years.  Her parents were farmers and she learned farming from them.  Ana left school after the sixth grade.  

Ana and her husband operate the business together.  They work their small plot in the morning and go their own way in the afternoon, he to work as a laborer on other farms and she to milk their cows and make cheese for sale.  

Ana is applying for a loan that she will use to buy a team of oxen.  Her husband can use the oxen to increase the income he earns from doing farm work for others and he and Ana can use them to carry the crops they harvest from their own land.  

For the future, Ana wants to build a covered space for keeping her animals.

loans.use: to buy a team of oxen for her farming business.

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
Francisco es un pequeño caficultor de 23 años de edad. Posee una finca con 2.16 hectáreas de café. Además de producir café, también se ha dedicado a la producción de granos básicos, cítricos y musáceos; con las que ha logrado mantener una finca con diversidad en su oferta agrícola. 

En los últimos tres años ha contado con una producción promedio de 27 quintales de café pergamino, los cuales cosecha bajos los criterios de comercio justo. En este ciclo, está solicitando un crédito que le permita comprar los insumos para el mantenimiento de su café, y garantizar una nutrición saludable de sus cafetos. Su meta, es tener una mejor cosecha este año, para tener mayores ingresos que le permitan dar a su esposa mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Francisco, 23, is a small coffee producer. He has a farm with 2.16 hectares of coffee. He also grows basic grains, citrus, and bananas in addition to coffee. He has been able to support his farm with this diversity in agricultural sales.

In the last three years he has produced an average of 27 quintals of parchment coffee, which he harvests using fair-trade criteria.

This season he's requesting a loan to buy inputs to maintain his coffee so he can guarantee healthy nutrition for his coffee trees.

Francisco's goal is to get a better harvest this year so he earns more income to provide better conditions for his wife.

loans.use: to buy inputs he needs for his coffee farm

loans.name: Shakeela

texts.en: Shakeela is 38 years old, married and a mother of seven children. She has done tailoring for many years to support her husband (also shown in the photo). She accepted the fact that if her husband alone works for their family, they will not be able to cover household expenses or provide for the educational needs of their children. That is why she started tailoring at home to support her family well. She, together with her husband, manage their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.She has taken out a Murabaha loan of 25000 PKR to purchase more reels of threads, packs of buttons, ribbons and laces for meeting orders on time. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Shakeela hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing her family with a better standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase more reels of threads, packs of buttons, ribbons and laces for meeting orders on time

loans.name: Asia

texts.en: Asia is 50 years old, married and the mother of two children. For many years, she has been in the business of buying and selling livestock with the help of her husband (also shown in the photo). Asia's business has provided her family with a decent life. She is working very hard to provide her family with the basic necessities of life. Asia has taken out a Murabaha loan of 40,000 PKR. She intends to use this loan to purchase more baby goats and calves to serve more customers. She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves to serve more customers

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal MANOS JUNTAS.
La socia Elizabeth sigue dedicándose al turismo, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia  sigue vendiendo paquetes turísticos a los turistas que le solicitan como city tours, valle sagrado  entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones personales entre otros, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuota establecidas.
 La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de boletos  entre otros.
texts.en:
Elizabeth belongs to the MANOS JUNTAS communal bank.

Elizabeth continues to make a living through tourism, she is a responsible and diligent person, she continues to sell tourist packages to tourists who request them, some examples are city tours, Sacred Valley, she has made a living with this business for a long time and it brings her personal satisfaction among other things.  She is grateful for the loan awarded to her and promises to comply with the repayment conditions.

She is requesting the loan to buy tickets among other things.

loans.use: to buy tickets, among other things.

loans.name: Denis

texts.en: Denis used the previous loan to buy seed and modern farming equipment. He is still growing tea, eucalyptus and bananas while also earning a salary that adds to his income. He is faced with the hardship of long periods of drought spells that destroy his tea plantation. Another hardship is price fluctuations in the tea market which reduce his profits. He dreams of becoming a self-reliant person having a stable income. Denis needs a loan to buy more tea seedlings and other inputs for the tea plantation.

loans.use: to buy more tea seedlings and other inputs for the tea plantation.

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es:
María, de 70 años de edad, se dedica desde hace varios años a la agricultura y al comercio de granos básicos, todo lo aprendió de su madre, ella estudio hasta sexto grado y actualmente solo vive con su esposo.

María, comercializa los granos básicos que produce y compra en los alrededores de su vivienda en el mercado de la ciudad.

María, necesita el préstamo para comprar más granos para comercializar, porque su clientela ha crecido y la demanda también, con esto espere generar los fondos necesarios para su manutención y la de su esposo.

María, sueña con comprar un puesto en el mercado para vender sus productos.
texts.en:
María, 70, makes a living selling grain crops, some of which she grows herself.  She has operated the business for many years, a business that she learned from her mother.  María left school after the sixth grade.  She and her husband are on their own now.

María buys supplies of grain from nearby farms and sells the grain, along with grain that she harvests herself, at a market in the city.  She is applying for a loan that she will use to buy more supplies of grain because she has more customers now and needs the extra supplies to meet demand.  The investment will provide her and her husband with the income they need to live.

María would like to have her own market stall one day.

loans.use: to buy grain crops that she will resell.

loans.name: Flor Alba

texts.es:
Flor es una mujer con 38 años de edad, luego de pasar por una dura situación económica, la cual vivió después de separarse de su esposo quien era el sostén del hogar, con esfuerzo y dedicación logro montar su propio negocio, un restaurante el cual situó en un pequeño local arrendado por un vecino.
Su mayor sueño es comprar una vivienda propia pero principalmente pagar la educación de su hijo.

Se encuentra solicitando un préstamo el cual lo invertirá en la compra de un congelador, insumos para la producción de comidas y ajustara para el pago a proveedores.

Usted puede ser parte del sueño de esta mujer, anímese, haga un préstamo.
texts.en:
Flor is a 38 year-old woman. She has managed to get herself out of a difficult financial situation after she separated from her husband who was the breadwinner in the house. However, through effort and dedication she managed to start up her own business, a restaurant located in a small property leased by a neighbour.

Her dream is to buy her own home but mainly she wants to pay for her son's education.

She is asking for a loan which she will use to buy a freezer, food production supplies and to pay suppliers.

You could be a part of this woman's dream. Go for it, make a loan!.

loans.use: to buy a freezer, food production supplies and to pay suppliers.

loans.name: Magda Yadira

texts.es:
Magda es una mujer con 33 años de edad, dedicada a la cría y venta de ganado, un negocio del cual obtiene muy buenos ingresos, los suficientes para cubrir sus necesidades.
Trabaja todos los días durante 6 horas diarias.

Su meta es continuar trabajando hasta cumplir el sueño de mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda.

Se encuentra solicitando un préstamo el cual lo invertirá en la compra de pollos y alimento al por mayor.

Ayuda a esta mujer con deseos de salir adelante, haga un préstamo.
texts.en:
Magda, 33, raises and sells livestock, a business from which she earns a good living, enough to cover her needs. She works six hours every day.

She's requesting a loan to invest in buying chickens and feed wholesale.

Magda's goal is to continue to work until she achieves her dream of improving the condition of her home.

Help this woman who wants to get ahead; give her a loan.

loans.use: to buy chickens and feed wholesale

loans.name: Abida

texts.en: Abida is 50 years old and married with five children. The man shown in the photo is her husband who is successfully running a small general store. He makes a good amount of income to contribute to the family. Abida is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health care. For her husband's business, she has taken out a Murabaha loan of 40,000 PKR  to buy packs of salt, biscuits, rice, spices and juices to handle increasing customer demand.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits, rice, spices and juices to handle increasing customer demand.

loans.name: Galsoom

texts.en:
Galsoom is 44 years old, married and a mother of seven children.

Galsoom is a hardworking mother who has been helping her family by providing services of tailoring in her community. She has been doing it for many years. She very well knows the techniques of stitching. Her regular customers are her neighbours and the local community. She earns enough to lead a decent life.

To help Galsoom continue operations of her business, she availed a Murabaha loan of 30,000 PKR to buy stitching materials to sew more dresses, such as spools of threads in different colours and packs of zippers and buttons etc.

In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses. She is shown in the photo with her husband.

loans.use: to buy stitching materials to sew more dresses, such as spools of threads in different colours and packs of zippers and buttons etc.

loans.name: Nura

texts.en: Nura is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Kaza Village. Nura joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. In the past, Nura suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to pay for his children's school fees. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Nura will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizer, herbicide and improved seed that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Nura now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
El socio Alberto pertenece al banco comunal MANOS JUNTAS.
El socio continua  dedicándose al negocio de venta pollos, el socio lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, el socio sigue criando a sus animalitos para luego venderlos  a sus clientes que le solicitan, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio Alberto agradece a  KIVA por permitirle seguir trabajando y desarrollándose en su actividad económica.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de pollos y alimentos.
texts.en:
Alberto belongs to the MANOS JUNTAS communal bank.  He continues to make a living selling chickens, he has owned this business for a long time and it is going well, thanks to the efforts he puts into it every day.  He continues to raise his animals to then sell them to the customers who request them.  He would like to continue with this work so he can continue to support his family.


Alberto is grateful to KIVA for allowing him to continue to work and develop his economic activities.  He is requesting this loan to buy chickens and feed.

loans.use: to buy chickens and feed.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en: Editha is from San Dionisio, Iloilo. She is 59 years old, married and has eight adult children. Her 18-year-old child is still attending school. To earn a living, Editha is engaged in various businesses like raising pigs. She also sells snack food to the community. She also has a rice farming business that helps her to sustain her daily living. Editha is asking for a loan to buy feed for her pigs and ingredients for her food business like flour, sugar, cooking oil and fruit. She also needs money to buy fertilizer for her crop. Editha dreams of having a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy feed, flour, cooking oil, sugar, fruits and fertilizer

loans.name: Jackeline

texts.es: Jackeline es una joven muy esforzada que se dedica a la confección de ropa deportiva. Ella solicita un préstamo de un millón de colones (₡ 1 000 000), para la compra de material necesario para elaborar dichas prendas, por medio de este dinero podrá aumentar su volumen de ventas y aumentar los ingresos de su hogar.
texts.en: Jackeline operates a business making and selling sports clothing.  She is applying for a one million-colones (₡1,000,000) loan to buy the fabric she needs to carry on her business.  The investment will allow her to increase her output and, in turn, the family income.

loans.use: to buy fabric for making sports clothing.

loans.name: Conception

texts.en: Conception is 50 years old, married and the mother of three children, one of whom is in school. She works very hard to provide for her family by running a general store in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 13,000 loan from NWTF to buy items to sell like candies, school supplies, snacks, and other groceries. She has been in this business for ten years, and would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en: Annie is 31 years old, married and has three children. The man shown in the photo is her husband who is a van driver by profession. He drives in the main city and makes enough income to cover all the expenses of his family. He wants to change the van's engine, as it is causing a lot of pollution and is consuming too much oil. That is why Annie  has taken out a Murabaha loan of 35,000 PKR for her husband to buy a new engine for the van to provide better customer service. Annie  is hopeful that this loan will be productive for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for the van to provide better customer service.

loans.name: Sunday

texts.en: Sunday is a Babban Gona farmer from Shukau Vilage. Sunday joined Babban Gona to become a better farmer. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Sunday will have access to top-of-the-range farm inputs such as fertilizes, herbicide, and improved seed. This loan will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the 14 bags per hectare earned by the average Nigerian small-holder maize farmer. With the opportunity to earn high yields and increase his net income, Sunday would like to use his extra earnings to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en: Sonia is a hard-working woman. She has been successfully running a business selling bed sheets and bedspreads for many years. She always has a good collection to offer and has attained a regular list of customers.  Sonia wants to grow her business, so she took out a Murabaha loan of 40,000 PKR  to buy bundles of bed sheets and bedspreads in different colors and designs. It will help her to boost her sales. Sonia wishes to spend part of her revenue on covering her family expenses. She also wants to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy bundles of bed sheets and bedspreads in different colors and designs

loans.name: Maria Eva

texts.es:
María, de 39 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, se dedica desde hace varios años a la agricultura, este oficio se lo enseñaron sus padres, está casada y junto a su esposo siembran maíz.

María, se dedica a trabajar en la parcela que alquila junto a su esposo durante la mañana y en el transcurso de la tarde se dedica a los oficios domésticos.

María, necesita el préstamo para comprar una novilla, para producir leche y salir a venderla en los alrededores de su comunidad.

María, desea en un futuro comprar más animales, para iniciar a producir lácteos.
texts.en:
María, 39, left school after the ninth grade.  She learned farming from her parents and has operated her own farming business for many years.  She is married and she and her husband operate the business together.  

María works the farm with her husband in the morning and takes care of household duties in the afternoon.

María is applying for a loan that she will use to buy a cow for her milk business.  

For the future, María hopes to buy more cows and increase her milk sales.

loans.use: to buy a cow for her milk business.

loans.name: Joselito

texts.en:
Joselito is from Talibon, Bohol. He is 35 years old with three dependents aged five, six and eight.

Joselito has been engaged in a sari-sari store business and a tricycle service business. These have been his sources of income for 11 years.

He is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to pay for motor maintenance and repair as well as materials for house renovations.

Joselito hopes to continue to expand his business so that he can buy what his children need. In the future, he plans to continue making improvements to his livelihood to increase profitability.

loans.use: to pay for motor maintenance and repair as well as materials for house renovations.

loans.name: Deivis Andres

texts.en:
Deivis is 24 years old and has a son who is 6 years old. He loves and cares very much for his son. He lives in the municipality of El Bagre, Antioquia, a place where he’s decided to start building his dreams. For many years, this young man has had the idea of starting his own business; he wants to become independent and to have a job that allows him to support his family.

He decided to create his store, where he hopes he can sell many products. He envisions that the place can turn into a meeting point, where people get together to hang out and to enjoy themselves. Right now he doesn’t have the money to start his business, which is why he is asking for a loan. He will use the loan to buy all kinds of products like meat, milk, dairy, grain, home products, and also a refrigerator and some stands.

Deivis has many dreams; some of them regard his business and the other ones, his family. For his business he wishes it can last for a long time and become really successful. For his family, he hopes someday he can buy a house where they can live safely and comfortably. You can help him to achieve all his goals; a loan can make a big difference in his life.

loans.use: to buy products like meat, milk, dairy, grain, home products, and also a refrigerator and some stands.

loans.name: Diego Fernando

texts.en:
Diego is 22 years old, single and lives in La Unión, where he owns a fruit-growing business. Recently he inherited a business from his family, and has been working hard to improve it because he is really committed to his work. His father taught him everything that he needs to know, so he is doing his job really well.

Diego wants to improve his customer base and increase his sales so that he can increase his profits, and to accomplish that he has to invest in his business, especially because there is a lot of competition in his area. He lacks the money to do this, and has requested a loan to buy baskets, a scythe, fertilizer and some chemicals. Diego’s family does not own a house, and he dreams that one day he will be able to buy one.

loans.use: buy baskets, a scythe, fertilizer and some chemicals.

loans.name: Djiguisseme Group

texts.fr: Malien et  âgé de 32 ans, Habibou est celui qui tient le bélier dans la photo du  groupe. Il est marié et père de 7 enfants dont 3 filles (âgés de 1 an à 12 ans). 5 de ses enfants fréquentent l’école dont 3 filles. Sa femme fait  le ménage et le petit commerce au marché pour l’aider dans les dépenses familiales. Habibou  achète les béliers les élève et les revend avec profit. Il fait cette activité depuis 5 ans. Habibou cherche un prêt  au RMCR pour acheter des béliers en plus et l’aliment bétail en quantité afin de pouvoir bien les nourrir et les revendre pour gagner plus d’argent et  payer  les frais scolaires, soins de santé et habillements pour ses enfants. Il rêve d’exporter un jour ses animaux dans les pays voisins et d’avoir les conditions de vie honorable
texts.en:
Habibou is 32 years old and from Mali. He’s the one holding the ram in the photo. He is married and the father of seven children, three of whom are girls (1 and 12 years old). Five of his children (including all three girls) go to school.

His wife is a housekeeper and sells at the market to help with the family expenses. For the past five years, Habibou has been buying rams, raising them, and then reselling them for profit.

Habibou would like a loan from RMCR in order to buy rams and ram feed. He will do this to feed and resell his rams in order to earn more money and to pay for schooling fees, healthcare, and clothing for his children.

He dreams of being able to sell his animals in neighboring countries and to have good life conditions.

loans.use: buy rams to raise and resell.

loans.name: Themba

texts.en:
Themba, who is 33, is the father of a five-year-old child.

Themba sells chickens, moving door-to-door along his area. The business is not stable, and he is not assured of making a sale every day. This uncertainty provides a lot of difficulty in raising his young family.

Themba has decided to expand his business by investing in a farmyard owned by his self-help group. Themba is requesting a loan from Kiva to build a chicken coop on this farmyard. The coop will provide constant stock for Themba to sell, thus improving his earning potential. He will also be able to control the type of food the chickens eat and thus improve the quality of his chickens.

loans.use: to build a chicken coop.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia is a 42-year-old married woman and the mother of two children who are nine years and four-months old.  They live in Getafe, Bohol, where she runs a retail business selling various goods and household items to people in her area. Lydia is asking for a loan to buy more items to sell, such as kitchenware, pots, woks, thermoses, plastic basins, laundry baskets and pails. This loan will allow her to sell to more people in her area, and thus increase her family's income.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell.

loans.name: Amor Mia

texts.en:
Amor Mia is 26 years old and has two children. She is married and has two children who are still in school. Amor Mia is in the agricultural business, farming corn in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy sacks of fertilizer, corn seed and other farm supplies.

Amor Mia has been in this business for six years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer, corn seed and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Yaqueline Ester

texts.es: Yaqueline reside en compañía de su cónyuge e hijos en un barrio del municipio de Soledad, tiene 32 años de edad y es una empresaria independiente que cuenta con una amplia experiencia en el comercio; sus padres le dejaron este legado y producto de esta actividad sustentaron su hogar.  Ella ofrece prendas de vestir, calzado, bisutería, relojes, bolsos, fragancias a sus amigos y referidos a quienes les brinda facilidad de pago; su éxito ha sido su buen servicio y productos de excelente calidad, razones que han logrado mantener sus clientes fidelizados.  En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en la compra de prendas de vestir, calzado, bisutería, relojes, bolsos, fragancias, para entregar a sus clientes, esta inversión está enfocada hacia la captación de nuevos mercados para lograr aumentar su cobertura y con ello aumentar su flujo de caja encaminado a mejorar su calidad de vida. Au meta familiar es continuar apoyando a sus hijos, en el negocio su meta es crecer comercialmente y con este crédito empezar su escala ascendente.
texts.en:
Yaqueline, 32, lives with her husband and children in a neighborhood in the town of Soledad. She's an independent merchant who has a lot of experience in sales, a legacy from her parents, who supported their household in that line of work.

She sells clothing, footwear, costume jewelry, watches, and perfume to her friends and referrals, and she offers a payment plan. She has been successful because of her good service and products of excellent quality, and this has kept her customers loyal.

Currently she's applying for her first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She's going to buy clothing, footwear, costume jewelry, watches, bags, and perfume for her customers. This investment is focused on attracting new markets so she can increase her coverage and, as a result, increase the cash flow aimed at improving her quality of life.

Yaqueline's goal for her family is to continue to support her children. Her business goal is to grow commercially and start moving up with this loan.

loans.use: to buy clothing, footwear, costume jewelry, watches, bags, and perfume

loans.name: Amos

texts.en:
Amos is married with one child, aged 17 years. He is hardworking and sells produce, especially cereals like maize and rice in Kamwenge, Uganda. He also does crop farming to supplement his business. He confesses that the business has helped him to educate his children and intends to expand it into a wholesale store. With all his plans, he has been challenged by the ever fluctuating prices of agricultural produce.

Amos requests a loan to buy more maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy more maize to sell.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is 54 years old, a married woman; shown in the photo with her husband. She has been involved in the business of cloth trading. She purchases a variety of cloth at low prices from the city market and sells them in her own town. She has a strong customer base.

Parveen has availed Murabaha loan of 20,000 PKR. She wants to buy a greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business, to get boost in her earnings from her loan.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business to get a boost in her earnings from her loan.

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en:
Irshad has successfully established her business selling cloth with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. Over time, she attained a good number of customers and makes a good amount of income to contribute in the family income. Previously, with the help of Kiva loan, she was able to expand her business.

Now she has applied a loan of 60,000 PKR to purchase bundles of cloth in different colors to increase her sales and profits, too.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of cloth in different colors to increase her sales and profits.

loans.name: Ma. Melona

texts.en:
Ma. Melona is 36 years old and a married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has five school-aged children, ages 6-16.

Talibon is a place known for an abundance of seafood. She has been into fishing for 15 years now, with her husband.

She requested a loan of PHP16,000 to buy a new fishing boat.

In the future, Ma. Melona hopes that she will improve her business and provide her children with good food and a quality education.

loans.use: to buy a new fishing boat

loans.name: Macreña

texts.en:
Macreña is a 44-year-old woman from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is married with four children. The oldest child is 20 while the youngest is 11.

She engages in fishing and the selling of fish with her husband. Together with her husband, they work hand-in-hand to support their family's daily needs.

She is asking for a loan to buy bamboo and adhesive.

In the future, she hopes to expand her fishing business and increase the business profitability for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 21 years old; she is a married woman. She deals in the business of selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up, and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute in the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income.

She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and availed a Murabaha loan of PKR 30,000 to purchase more animals to increase her sales.

She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

She is shown in the photo with her cousin.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to increase her sales.

loans.name: Bashiran

texts.en: Bashiran is 46 years old, a widow, and a mother of five children.  She is hardworking and supports her family by providing tailoring services in her community. She has been doing this for many years and knows her business very well. Her regular customers are her neighbors and people who live in her local community. She earns enough to lead a decent life, but to continue the operations of her business she requested for a loan of 40,000 PKR  to buy spools of thread in different colors, packs of zippers and buttons, and other items so that she can sew more dresses. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the money she earns to pay for personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Bibian

texts.en:
Bibian is a 31-year-old businesswoman who is married, with three children. She has been successfully operating a shop where she sells sugar, salt, soap, flour, cooking oil and rice.

Bibian lives in the Nyaminyami district of Zimbabwe. She has been assisted by her family members in this business venture, as it is their main source of income. She used her first Kiva loan to purchase sugar, salt, soap, flour, cooking oil, rice and other groceries in order to make more profits. With the improved profits, she hopes to expand her business and improve her standard of living.

To give back to her community, she volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide in schools, teaching students life skills education.

Bibian’s business is doing well. Using her profits from her business, she boosted her business of selling baby clothes.

She desires to get a second loan so that she can further expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more baby clothes to sell.

loans.name: Saodat

texts.ru: Каждый человек проходит через некоторые тяжелые испытания, и только сильный человек сможет сохранить себя и пройти через все беды. Одна из них Саодат. Для Саодат самой большой потерей в жизни стало смерть мужа. Она очень сильно любила своего мужа и для нее это самое большое испытание в жизни. Саодат после смерти мужа продолжила заниматься земледелием и ее дети, чтобы поддержать маму тоже вместе с ней начали заниматься растениеводством. Саодат вернулась в прежнюю жизнь. Она каждый год сажает овощи. В этом году она посадила и теперь нужно обработать землю, чтобы получить богатый и качественный урожай. Для приобретения минеральных удобрений ей не хватает дене,г и она обратилась за финансовой поддержкой к KIVA.
texts.en:
Every person goes through difficult experiences, and only strong people manage to get through the trouble and save themselves. One of these strong people is Saodat. For her, the largest loss in her life was the death of her husband. She loved him very much and for her this has been the biggest test in her life.

After the death of her husband, Saodat continued to work with field crop cultivation, and her children also started to work with this to help their mother. Saodat returned to her previous life. Every year she sows vegetables.

This year Saodat has also sown vegetables, and now she needs to process the land in order to get a rich and high quality harvest. She does not have enough money to purchase mineral fertilizers and applied for a loan from Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Solidaria Mujer Mujeres Del Futuro Group

texts.es:
Maureen es integrante del Grupo Solidaria Mujer Mujeres del Futuro, ella Junto a Cecilia integran este dúo de socias que solicitan su tercer crédito, las actividades que desarrollan son comercio y servicios; Los créditos anteriores se han pagado de forma muy puntual, así como la inversión de los fondos se han destinado de forma correcta en la actividad productiva, reflejando un crecimiento significativo. 
La señora Maureen es una mujer emprendedora, con carácter empresarial, que busca independencia económica y superación personal, sumado a la posibilidad de generar ingresos adicionales a su hogar. Ella vive con su esposo y sus hijas, ambas estudiantes. El negocio de ella es una pequeña soda, donde prepara comida rápida, además también vende ropa y cosméticos. Esta nueva inyección de capital de trabajo le va a permitir comprar más insumos como abarrotes y comestibles para la soda, así como más mercadería para continuar con ambos negocios. Los financiamientos han sido de gran ayuda para ella ya que le han permitido ser una mujer independiente, superarse y fortalcer su autoestima. Su objetivo a mediano plazo es pagarse sus propios estudios, así como seguir apoyando a sus hijas para que continúen estudiando y lleguen a ser unas mujeres profesionales.
texts.en:
Maureen is a member of the 'Women of the Future' Women's Solidarity Group. She and Cecilia are a duo of members who are requesting their 3rd loan. The activities they pursue pertain to commerce and services.

Their previous loans were repaid very punctually, and their investment of funds were correctly aimed at productive activities, resulting in significant growth.

Maureen is an enterprising woman with an entrepreneurial character who is seeking economic independence and personal advancement, plus the possibility of generating additional income for her household. Maureen lives with her husband and daughters, both students. Her business is a small soda shop where she prepares fast foods and she also sells clothing and cosmetics.

This new injection of working capital will permit her to buy more inventory, including groceries and foodstuff for her soda shop, plus more merchandise to continue with both her businesses. Such financing has been a great help to Maureen, permitting her to become an independent woman, and to advance and fortify her self-esteem.

Maureen's objective in the medium term is to pay for her own studies, and to continue helping her daughters so that they can continue their studies and become professional women.

loans.use: purchase more inventory, such as groceries and foodstuff, to sell at their general merchandise and soda shops.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy corn and other items

loans.name: Maria Aylin

texts.en:
Maria Ailyn is a 38-year-old married woman and the mother of four young children aged from 4 to 11. She is from Talibon, Bohol. She is engaged in a fishing business together with her husband. She helps him sell his catch in the market.

Maria Ailyn is requesting a loan to buy plywood, paint and adhesive to be used for their boat. This will help her husband to improve his catch. Maria Ailyn hopes to make their fishing business a success in the future. She also aims to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy plywood, paint and adhesive

loans.name: Babaqul

texts.ru: Бабакулу аз района Носиру Хусрав 45 лет. Он женат и имеет троих детей. Бабакул как и многие односельчане занимается сельскохозяйственной деятельностью. Уже 5 лет Бабакуль продвигает животноводческую деятельность. Он хочет отличиться и добиться признаний в этой области. Бабакуль планирует расширить деятельность и купить больше телят и бычков. Для совершения покупки он просит кредит. Животноводческий бизнес не только важный источник дохода в семью, но и любимое дело. Бабакуль надеется, что его поддержа,т и благодарит за помощь.
texts.en:
Babaqul is from the Nosiri Khursav region and is 45 years old. He is married and has three children. Babaqul, like many fellow villagers, works with agriculture. He has had a livestock breeding business for five years already. He wants to excel and be recognized in this area.

Babaqul plans to expand his business and purchase more calves and bull-calves. For the current purchase he requests a loan. The livestock breeding business is not only an important source of income for the family, but also Babaqul's favorite activity. Babaqul hopes that you will support him and thanks you for the help.

loans.use: to purchase bull-calves and calves and expand his business

loans.name: Annabel

texts.en:
Annabel is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Annabel is 40 years old and five of her children are currently in school.

Annabel has a manicure and pedicure business in the Philippines. She has requested a 9,500 PHP loan through NWTF to buy materials for her business like nail polish and cuticle nippers.

Annabel has been in this business for five years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials for her business like nail polish and cuticle nippers

loans.name: Sougrnooma 4 Hommes Group

texts.fr:
Mr IDRISSA est le représentant du groupe  SOUGRNOOMA 4 HOMMES. Il est marié et père de 09 enfants. Le plus âgé a 28 ans et le moins âgé a 02 ans. 02  enfants vont à l’école et il a 09 personnes en charge.
Mr fait de l’agriculture et pratique aussi l’élevage depuis plus de 15 ans. Il s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants.
Avec l’argent octroyé, il compte acheter 04 sacs d’engrais et 04 moutons.
Il veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour renforcer son activité et s’occuper de sa famille. Il ambitionne acheter une parcelle.
texts.en:
Mr. Idrissa is the representative of the group called Sougrnooma 4 Hommes (Four Men). He is married and the father of nine children. The oldest of them is 28 and the youngest two years old. Two children attend school and Mr. Idrissa is responsible for nine persons in all.

Mr. Idrissa has worked in agriculture and also raised livestock for more than 15 years. He buys his supplies in neighboring markets. With the loan, he intends to buy four sacks of fertilizer and four sheep. He wants to use the profits from the loan to expand his business and take care of his family. His dream is to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy four sacks of fertilizer and four sheep

loans.name: Bawa

texts.en:
Bawa is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Liman Village. Bawa joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children.

In the past, Bawa suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to purchase better inputs to improve his yields. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Bawa will have access to the best farm inputs on the market, such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds, that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably.

Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Bawa now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his farm's yields.

loans.name: Rizqinisso

texts.ru:
Ризкиниссо трудолюбива и активная женщина. Она год назад начала новый бизнес. Ризкиниссо чейчас занимается швеей. Она шьет "курпа" и "курпача". 
"Курпа" и "курпача"- это ватные матрасы. "Курпа" шьют стандартно квадратном размере, ее используют в качестве одеяла. Курпача длинные матрасы используется как диваны. Ризкиниссо около 5 лет занимается изготовлением "курпа" и "курпача". На сегодняшний день для нее основной деятельностью.  Ризкиниссо просит кредит, чтобы купить больше тканей и швейных принадлежностей для продолжения маленького бизнеса.
texts.en:
Rizqinisso is a hard working and active woman. A year ago she started a new business. Currently she works with sewing. She sews "Kurpa" and "Kurpacha". These are quilted mattresses. Kurpas are sewn in a standard square size and are used as blankets. Kurpachas are long mattresses used as sofas.

Rizqinisso has worked with preparing kurpas and kurpachas for around five years. Currently it is her main work. Rizqinisso requests a loan in order to purchase more fabric and sewing accessories, to continue her small business.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and sewing accessories

loans.name: Maria Sally

texts.en:
Maria Sally is 25 years old and from Talibon, Bohol. She is married with two children ages 2 and 3. She supports them by making clay stoves. This has been her business for five years now.

She is asking for a loan to improve her house. She will use it to buy cement, hollow blocks and hardwood. In the future, she would like to make her place more comfortable and spacious. She will continue to save from her income so she can send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy cement, hollow blocks and hardwood.

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.ru: Гулбахору 42 лет, и он из района Хуросон. В этом районе она поселилась очень давно. Гулбахор живет с детьми. Ее муж находится на заработках загранице, и каждый месяц отправляет им деньги. Гулбахор с молодостью занималась животноводством, и до сегодняшнего дня продвигает свою любимую работу. Она 7 лет занята этой деятельностью. Гулбахор много мечтала о расширении своего бизнеса. Единственным ограничением для нее стала отсутствие денег, чтобы реализовать задуманное. За счет запрашиваемого кредита она хочет приобрести скота. В данный момент вести хозяйство ей помогают дети. Гулбахор не останавливается на достигнутом и продолжает дальше расти и реализовываться.
texts.en:
Gulbahor is 42 years old and from the Khuroson region. She has lived in this region for a long time. Gulbahor lives with her children. Her husband is abroad as a migrant worker. He sends them money every month.

Since her childhood, Gulbahor has worked with livestock breeding. She has continued doing this work, which she loves, to this day. She has had a business of livestock breeding for 7 years. Gulbahor has dreamed of expanding her business. The only limitation for her has been a lack of money to implement her plan.

With the loan she has requested she will purchase livestock. Her children are currently helping her with the farm. Gulbahor will not stop, but will continue to further grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase cattle and expand her business

loans.name: Maa Laxmi Shg 2-F Group

texts.en:
Subasini is a 55-year-old widow who lives in a small village of Odisha, India. She is the one standing to the right in the photograph. She has a son aged 17 years who goes to school. Subasini is engaged in wheat-flour-making and selling. She has a machine called a flour-making machine. With this, she makes wheat flour and sells it in the market. She earns 4,000 INR per month which is not sufficient for her monthly family expenses as her son is studying, and she also needs to cover her son's college fees.

Along with her group member, Subasini is requesting a loan of 36,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to purchase another flour-making machine and wheat in bulk for her business. After getting the second machine, there will be a significant rise in the scale of her business as well as in the margin of profit. She will be able to give quantitative output by consuming less time, resulting in a rise in her popularity in her locality.

Subasini will invest her additional income in renting a new shop where she will hire one more helper and start a food stall business, where she will sell various snack items like samosa, vada, vegetable cutlets, bread, pakoda, and tea.

loans.use: to purchase another flour-making machine and wheat in bulk for her business.

loans.name: Mohsafar

texts.ru: Мохсафар 42 года. Она замужем и мать троих детей. У нее 2 дочери и 1 сын. Мохсафар вместе семьей живет в районе Хуросон. Муж занимается перевозом товаров. У него есть грузовик марки «ЗИЛ».  Мохсафар в районе занимается животноводством. Она у себя во дворе выращивает крупнорогатого скота. Муж тоже свободное время проводит время во дворе. Мохсафар 11 лет назад начала продвигать деятельность отца. Ее отец тоже занимался этой сфере деятельности. Ей в работе помогает муж. Животноводческая деятельность является основной, потому что доход от этого бизнеса обеспечить ее детей и семью. Мохсафар хочет взять кредит для свадьбы старшей дочери. Она просит кредит, по причине, что она не смогла, копит достаточную сумму денег для свадьбы дочери.  Мохсафар будет очень рада за Вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
