Mohsafar is 42 years old. She is married and the mother of three children. She has two daughters and one son. Mohsafar lives in the Khuroson region together with her family. Her husband works with transporting goods. He has a truck of the Zil brand.

Mohsafar works with livestock breeding. She breeds cattle in her yard. Her husband also spends his spare time in the yard. Mohsafar started this business, which was her father's business, 11 years ago. Her father also worked in this area. Her husband helps her with the work.

The livestock breeding business is important because the income from the business provides for Mohsafar's children and the family. Mohsafar would like to take a loan for her eldest daughter's wedding. She requests a loan because she has not been able to save up enough money for the wedding. Mohsafar will be very happy for your support.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's wedding

loans.name: Umoja Ni Nguvu/kawizi Group

texts.fr: C'est vers 2012 que Etienne a commencé à cultiver la tomate grâce à l'apprentissage qu'il l'a reçu de ses parents. Il trouve que cette activité est rentable car il a pu réaliser lors de la dernière expérience une récolte dont la valeur est équivalente à deux cents dollars après déduction de toutes les charges d'exploitation. Ce qui peut constituer pour lui un obstacle dans son travail est la manque d'eau d'irrigation, l'insuffisance de moyens financiers,...Il a le souhait d'élargir son étendue culturale, de scolariser tous ses enfants, améliorer ses conditions alimentaires et son habitat. Président du groupe UMOJA NI NGUVU, il tient sur photo un carnet dans sa main.
texts.en:
Etienne began to grow tomatoes around 2012, thanks to having learned farming from his parents. He has found that this activity is profitable since during his last experience, he was able to harvest a crop worth the equivalent of $200 after deducting all his farming expenses. Difficulties he might face in this work are the lack of water for irrigation and insufficient funds. He would like to expand the area he has under cultivation, put all his children in school, and feed and house them better.

Etienne is the president of the group called Umoja Ni Nguvu. In the photo, he is holding a notebook in his hand.

loans.use: to pay for transplanting, weeding, buying fertilizer and phytosanitary products, and to pay laborers at harvest-time

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a sari-sari (convenience) store owner. She is from Ajuy, Iloilo. She is married with two school-aged children ages 10 and eight years old.

Evelyn has been doing this business for three years. She works hard to earn a living and provide the needs of her children. Thus, she is asking for a loan to buy grocery items such as canned goods, noodles, eggs, spices, toiletries, sugar, coffee, powdered milk and juice, chocolate drink, laundry soap, soft drinks and drinking liquor.

In the future she wishes to have a better means of living, and maybe she is planning for an additional source of income

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, eggs, spices, toiletries, sugar, coffee, powdered milk and juice, chocolate drink, laundry soap, soft drinks and drinking liquor.

loans.name: Maria Lucia

texts.es: María tiene 50 años de edad es madre soltera habita en vivienda propia junto a sus padres y su hijo de 17 años de edad ella es una mujer muy trabajadora que siempre busca la manera de sacar adelante a su familia y se siente muy feliz. María presta sus servicios en una empresa cercana a su localidad desde hace 20 años gracias a su experiencia es como ella mantiene la economía del hogar. María solicito un crédito en el cual invirtió en la construcción de un muro de retención, por lo que no logro construir el techo de su vivienda y gracias a su buena experiencia ha solicitado un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cuartones, lámina galvanizada, clavo de acero y lámina para construir el techo de su vivienda y proteger a su familia.
texts.en:
María is a 50 years old single mother. She lives in her own home with her parents and her 17 years old son. She is a hardworking woman and is always looking for ways to help her family. She is very happy. María works in a company close to where she lives. She has been working for 20 years and thanks to the experience she has, is how she is able to maintain the household expenses.

María requested a loan which she invested in the construction of a retaining wall to be able to build a roof for their house. Because of this positive experience she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in wood beams, metal sheets, nails and corrugated sheets to construct the roof of her house and protect her family.

loans.use: to invest in: wood beams, metal sheeting, nails and corrugated sheets to build the roof of her house and protect her family.

loans.name: Nilda Araceli

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal MANOS JUNTAS.
La socia Nilda continua dedicándose al negocio de crianza y venta de animales menores, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio,  la socia sigue criando a sus animalitos para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia se siente agradecida con el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de cuyes, alimentos entre otros.
texts.en:
Nilda is a member of the communal bank Manos Juntas ["Hands Joined Together"]. She continues to make her living by raising and selling small animals. She has owned this business for a long time, and it is going well thanks to the effort she puts into it every day. Nilda raises and then sells her animals to her clients who request them. She wants to be able to continue working in this way so that she can also continue to support her family.

Nilda is grateful for the loan and promises to make all of her scheduled payments. She is requesting the loan so that she can buy guinea pigs, their food, and other things.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs, their food, and other things.

loans.name: Denis Beatriz

texts.es: Denis es una microempresaria de 56 años de edad que laboró por años en un restaurante de comidas rápidas, experiencia en la que pudo adquirir el conocimiento y la habilidad necesaria para iniciar su propio negocio.  En la actualidad cuenta con nueve años en el campo de las comidas rápidas y una clientela fidelizada que llega hasta su punto de comidas a degustar de sus deliciosos platillos; mazorcas, perros calientes, hamburguesas, picadas, sándwich entre otros. Denis es muy comprometida con su negocio, ella abre todos los días a partir de las 4 p.m. hasta la 1 p.m. y sus días más fuertes en ventas son los fines de semana. En la actualidad Denis está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para invertir en una campana extractora y materia primas, así sus clientes no sentirán molestias por las emanaciones de vapores de la cocina y estarán más a gusto en su local. Su meta a futuro es adquirir su local propio y continuar ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
Denis Beatriz is a micro-entrepreneur, 56 years of age, who worked for years in a fast-food restaurant, an experience in which she acquired the necessary knowledge and ability to initiate her own business.

At present, Denis Beatriz can count on nine years in the fast-food field plus a loyal customer base. She has brought to a peek her ability to prepare delicious dishes such as roasted ears of corn, hot dogs, hamburgers, and sandwiches, among other items. 

Denis Beatriz is very committed to her business. She is open everyday from 4:00 pm until 1:00 am, and her most active business days are weekends.

At present, Denis Beatriz is applying for her first Kiva loan through La Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo. She wishes to invest in a stove hood, so that her customers won't be bothered by the [smoky] smell from the kitchen and will be more comfortable in her fast-food stall. She will also buy additional primary food supplies.

Denis Beatriz's goal in the future is to acquire her own shop and  to continue helping her family.

loans.use: invest in the purchase of a new stove hood and primary materials for her business.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 50 years old, married and has one child who is in school. 

Emily is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Emily requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Emily has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Emily would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Kan

texts.en: Kan is a 54-year-old married rice farmer with four children living in the Takeo Province in Cambodia. She has been a farmer since 1993. Three of her children are garment-factory workers. Her husband is 54 years old and he is a wedding-song musician. Together, they can earn approximately $27 daily. Now Kan would like to request a loan to buy a motorcycle for her children for commuting to work. With this loan, she will have enough finances to buy a motorcycle and have better traveling conditions. In the future, she wants to save money to build a proper house, and support her youngest child to go through high school.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for her children for commuting to work

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is a farmer residing in the town of Talibon, Bohol. She grows and sells rice. She is a 39-year-old, married woman with seven children. Her oldest child is 16 while the youngest is 2. Aside from rice farming, she also produces and sells charcoal as an additional source of income. She has been engaged in farming for more than 10 years.

 She is asking for a loan to pay for the rice farm being pawn ( used a collateral to lend money)  and pay tuition fee for her children. With these, she could own back her rice field and continue to operate her daily livelihood activity. She could grow other type of crops that could help augment her earnings. Thus, she could able to manage her finances and start to expand her business. 

She is determined to handle her both sources of income successfully to become sustainable in the coming future.

loans.use: to pay for the rice farm being pawn ( used as collateral to lend money) and  pay for tuition fee for her children

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha, supports the family through her buy and sell ready-to-wear clothing business in the Philippines.
The accompanying photo shows Editha with her daughter Floramie who is 21 years old and is the fourth of seven children in the family.
Editha is borrowing 11,000 PHP to pay the tuition fees of Floramie who is studying Bachelor of Science in Criminology. Floramie is currently on her second year of this four-year course. When she graduates, Floramie plans to be a police investigator and help her mother send her younger siblings to finish college as well.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Derlina

texts.en:
Derlina is 29 years old and has five children. She is single and has three children who are presently in school.

Derlina is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Derlina requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other supplies.

Derlina has been in this business for two years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other supplies

loans.name: Alianca

texts.en: Alianca has built her house, but the money is not enough to buy more materials for her house to be completed, and she has a plan to plaster her house. So she is requesting a loan of $800 from Tuba Rai Metin to complete her house. She is taking this loan because she wants to buy more material such as sand, cement, rope, paying car for unloading sand, pay builders and other materials to use. She is very happy with the loan that was offered by Tuba Rai Metin to her, because with this loan she can be complete her house.

loans.use: To buy sand, cement, rope, paying car for unloading sand, pay builders and other materials to use.

loans.name: Noeng's Group

texts.en: A resident living in Kampong Thom province, Noeng is 30 years old and married. She has a child who is dependent on her and still in school. She has been working hard on cassava growing for years to earn the very main source of her family’s income. Noeng wants her child and her husband to live healthily, yet she has insufficient finances to build a decent latrine. Noeng is not new to VisionFund (Kiva’s partner); this is her third time loan. She is leading a two-member group to take out a new loan. The past loans were repaid completely and it enabled her to provide her child with sufficient protein foods. This new loan will be used to build a decent latrine for her family. She hopes that her family can live healthily and be protected from infectious diseases.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine for her family.

loans.name: Aniano

texts.es:
Aniano tiene 41 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y sus hijos en casa propia de material rústico en el distrito de San Felipe que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. La vida en este distrito es tranquila, los pobladores se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Aniano se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de lima, cuenta con una experiencia en el rubro de 10 años y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en la compra de abono y fertilizantes para realizar un adecuado mantenimiento de su cultivo de lima así como para la contratación de mano de obra para la época de cosecha. Con esto Aniano espera ofrecer lima de mejor calidad a sus clientes lo que tendrá un impacto positivo en su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Aniano is 41 years old, lives with his partner and children in their own home build of rustic materials in the San Felipe district located in the province of Jaén, Cajamarca region, in the northern mountains of Perú. Life in the district is quiet and the residents work mainly in agriculture, trade and cattle.

Aniano works in agriculture, specifically growing limes. He has 10 years of experience and has good personal and business references in the area. He will use the loan he will receive to purchase organic and chemical fertilizers to properly maintain his lime crop. He will also use it to hire labor to help with the harvest season. With this Aniano hopes to offer better quality limes to his customers, which will have a positive impact in his level of income and therefore, improve the quality of life for him and his family.

loans.use: to purchase organic and chemical fertilizers to properly maintain his lime crop.

loans.name: Eliazar

texts.es:
Eliazar tiene 37 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y sus hijos en casa propia de material rústico en el distrito de Pomahuaca que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. La vida en este distrito es tranquila, los pobladores se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Eliazar se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café, cuenta con una experiencia en el rubro de 15 años y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en la compra de abono y fertilizantes para realizar un adecuado mantenimiento de su cultivo de café así como para la contratación de mano de obra para la época de cosecha. Con esto Eliazar espera ofrecer un café de mejor calidad a sus clientes lo que tendrá un impacto positivo en su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Eliazar is 37 years old, lives with his spouse and children in his own home,made of rustic materials, in the Pomahuaca district that is located in the province of Jaén, Cajamarca region, in the northern highlands of Peru. 

Life is quiet in this district, villagers are mainly engaged in agriculture, commerce and cattle raising.

Eliazar works in agriculture, specifically the cultivation of coffee.  He has 15 years of experience in this business, and comes with very good personal and work references in the area. 

The granted loan will be used in the purchase of compost and fertilizers for proper maintenance of coffee cultivation as well as for the recruitment of labor for the harvesting season. 

With this Eliazar expects to offer better quality coffee to his customers which will have a positive impact on his income and thus improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to purchase compost and fertilizers for proper maintenance of coffee cultivation

loans.name: Yudis Esther

texts.es: Yudis es una confeccionista que aprendió de la mano de su madre las técnicas básicas de costura y diseño; siempre le apasionó la modistería y que desde joven a sus 20 años de edad empezó a ejercer en su microempresa, labora ocho horas diarias y su  propósito a largo plazo es mejorar las condiciones su vivienda. Ella confecciona todo tipo de prenda de vestir, camisas, pantalones, vestidos, uniformes de colegios, entre otros y realiza todas las operaciones de la confección, diseño, corte, preparación, ensamble y acabado de piezas; sus clientes se han mantenido fieles con el pasar del tiempo, pues brinda un excelente servicio y elabora sus prendas sobre medida y a la vanguardia.  Con esta amplia gama de productos y demanda de pedidos, decidió que su negocio debía crecer mucho más,  por lo que invertir en materias primas como telas, hilos, botones, le permitiría ofrecer el servicio a todo costo;  para ello está aplicando a su primer crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo el cual invertirá en ésta propuesta.  A fututo su meta es contratar empleadas y tener mudarse a un local.
texts.en:
Yudis is a seamstress who learned the basic techniques of sewing and design from her mother's own hand. She was always excited about dressmaking from her youth until she was 20 years old, when she began her micro-enterprise, laboring eight hours a day.

Yudis' long-range plan is to improve her conditions of life. She makes all types of clothing; shirts, pants, dresses, and school uniforms, among other things. She does all her own operations, design, cutting, preparation, assembly and finishing the pieces.

Yudis' customers have been loyal over time, since she offers excellent services and makes her clothes to measure and in the latest style. With this ample range of products and the orders she receives, Yudis decided that her business was ready to grow much more, and that she should invest in more primary materials such as cloth, thread, and buttons, permitting her to afford to offer more services.

Hence, she is applying for her first loan through the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo to invest in her proposal.

Yudis' goal in the future is to hire employees and to move to her own shop.

loans.use: invest in primary materials such as cloth, thread, and buttons.

loans.name: Musa

texts.en: Musa is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Sakadadi Village. He joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. In the past, Musa suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to pay for his children's school fees. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, he will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Musa now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farm yields.

loans.name: Emprendedores De Vitarte Group

texts.es: 6 mujeres  responsables de distintas actividades comerciales  todas ellas las integrantes del grupo comunal “EMPRENDEDORES DE VITARTE”, una de ellas es la Sra. Pilar  de 47 años de edad divorciada  y con 2 hijos , la Sra. Pilar se dedica  hace 5  años al negocio de PRODUCCION Y VENTA DE YOGURT , a pedido todos los días.  La Sra. Pilar  nos cuenta que ha llegado a fidelizar a sus clientes lo cual le generando ingresos  para cubrir los gastos de su casa,  En el futuro le gustaría tener un local propio donde poder vender sus productos  y obtener mayores ganancias económicas. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá  en comprar más insumos para la elaboración de yogurt y poder tener más ingresos. La Sra. Pilar es la única que se encuentra sentada. A la vez se despide con un abraso a Kiva y  Edaprospo  diciéndoles que cumplirá todas su metas propuestas.
texts.en: These six women, in different lines of work, are all members of the community group “Emprendedores de Vitarte” ["Entrepreneurs of Vitarte"]. One of them is Pilar who is 47 years old, divorced and has two kids. For 5 years she has worked in the business of making and selling yogurt to order every day. Pilar tells us that she has made loyal customers which allows her to earn enough to cover living expenses. In the future, she would like to have her own shop where she can sell her products and earn more income. She will invest the loan granted in buying more supplies to make yogurt and to have more income. Pilar is the only person seated in the picture. She sends a hug to Kiva and Edaprospo, telling them she will achieve all of the goals she has set forth.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
From Talibon, Bohol, Mercedita is 46 years old, married, and the mother of five children ranging in age from five to 17, two of whom are still dependents. She has been selling root crops and fruits for eight years and also owns a tricycle used in a transportation business. 

Mercedita is requesting a loan to buy more fruits to sell and to pay for tricycle maintenance and repair. She hopes to improve her business and continue to offer more service in the future for a better profit.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to sell and pay for tricycle maintenance

loans.name: Brayan Ivan

texts.es:
Brayan es un joven hombre de 24 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos, y su negocio es la cerrajería.
Él es emprendedor, decidido, constante, responsable y muy trabajador. Su trabajo lo realiza en la zona Sur de la ciudad, caracterizada por su exuberante vegetación con enormes extensiones de selva y praderas. De clima cálido subtropical, con una temperatura que ronda entre los 21-35 grados centígrados.
Brayan es de tez morena, ojos negros punzantes, cabello negro corto, físico delgado, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español para el comercio. Su vida la realiza en compañía de su madre que descansa porque se encuentra delicada de salud, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de tierra que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica, gas domiciliario y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la cerrajería; él se encarga de fabricar puertas, ventanas, rejas, portones, mallas y todo tipo de muebles en metal y a medida, “mi oficio es un arte que me lo trasmitió mi papá, cada trabajo que realizado lleva mi marca…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que su trabajo es unico, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de planchas de metal y acero. Su sueño es estabilizar su negocio, el desea realizar la compra de metales. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 7 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Brayan solicita un préstamo para la compra de acero para fabricar puertas y estabilizare su negocio.
texts.en:
Brayan is a 24 year old single youth with no children. His business is metal work.

He is enterprising, determined, consistent, responsible and very hard-working. He does his work in the South of the city which is characterized by it's exuberant vegetation with large areas of jungle and fields. It has a hot semi-tropical climate with a temperature which ranges from 21 to 35 degrees Celsius.

Brayan is dark-skinned, has penetrating black eyes, short black hair and he is thin. His native language is Guaraní which he speaks in his family and he speaks Spanish for his business. He lives in the company of his mother who is resting as she is in poor health. They live in their own house made of brick and cement with a metal roof, a dirt floor and has running water, gas, electricity and sewage.

His business is metal work. He works fabricating doors, windows, grills, gates, wire mesh, and all types of metal furniture made to order. "My trade is an art which my father transmitted to me. Every piece I do has my mark" he commented. The advantage of his business is that his work is unique and his disadvantage is the lack of capital to buy metal and steel bars. His dream is to stabilize his business. He wants to purchase metals. This is his first loan with the institution in the 7 years he has been in this business.

For these reasons Brayan is requesting a loan to buy steel to fabricate doors and stabilize his business.

loans.use: for the purchase of steel to make doors and stabilize his business.

loans.name: Reyna Guadalupe

texts.es: Reyna tiene 47 años de edad, vive muy feliz junto a su compañero de vida, su hija de 8 años y un hijo de 18 años de edad, en casa propia y humilde. Ella es una madre de familia muy trabajadora y que quiere dar un futuro mejor a sus hijos. Reyna se dedica a la venta de platos típicos,  ella se levanta muy temprano a comprar los productos que necesita, los prepara y ya por las tardes sale a vender los diferentes platillos, actividad que realiza de forma ambulante en su comunidad, es así como ella cubre las necesidades básicas de su familia. Además, su compañero de vida se dedica a brindar servicios de jornalero cerca de su hogar y así aporta a la economía de su familia. Anteriormente, Reyna solicito un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en diversos ingredientes para la preparación de platos típicos, esto le permitió generar más ingresos económicos por lo cual su familia y ella están muy agradecidos. Nuevamente, Reyna solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: papas, tomates, yuca, repollo, aceite, entre otros productos necesarios para su negocio.
texts.en:
Reyna is 47 years old. She lives happily with her life companion an 8 year old daughter and an 18 year old son in their own clean, humble house. She is a very hard-working mother of a family who wants to provide a better future for her children.

Reyna works selling traditional foods. She gets up very early to buy the products that she needs, prepares them and in the afternoon she goes out to sell the various dishes. She does this business itinerantly in her community and this is how she covers the basic needs of her family. Her life companion also works offering his services as day labor close to their home and in this way contributes to the family economy.

Reyna previously requested a loan from FUSAI to invest in a variety of ingredients to prepare her traditional dishes. This allowed her to generate more economic income for which she and her family are very grateful. Once again Reyna is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in potatoes, tomatoes, yucca, cabbage and oil amongst other products for her business.

loans.use: to invest in potatoes, tomatoes, yucca, cabbage and oil amongst other products for her business.

loans.name: Isiyaku

texts.en:
Isiyaku is a Babban Gona farmer from Dan Auta Village. He joined Babban Gona so that he could realise better yields on his farm. Since joining, Isiyaku no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to purchase better inputs to improve his yield. 

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, he will have access to top-of-the-range farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the national average in Nigeria. This will see him increase his income considerably.  

This season Isiyaku has ambitious plans to harvest 45 bags of maize. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Isiyaku now has the opportunity to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase yields

loans.name: Roberto Antonio

texts.es: Roberto de 41 años de edad vive muy feliz junto a su hija de 15 años y su hijo de 18 años de edad. Roberto es un padre muy trabajador, que quiere dar lo mejor a sus hijos. Roberto desde hace 6 años se ha dedicado a ser peluquero; en su vivienda ha instalado una barbería, brinda servicios de peluquería todos los días; es así como Roberto solventa las necesidades básicas de sus hijos. Anteriormente, Roberto solicito un crédito a FUSAI con el cual pudo comprar máquina de afeitar, máquina de cortar cabello, cuchillas, tijeras entre otros; esto le permitió dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes y también que más clientes visitaran su barbería; lo cual genero mayores ingresos, por ello su familia y él están muy agradecidos. Por lo que Roberto solicita un nuevo crédito a FUSAI para cambiar las láminas de techo y paredes ya están deterioradas, esto le permitirá dar mejores condiciones de vida a sus hijos, él comprará: laminas, madera y clavos para cambiar las láminas de paredes y techo.
texts.en: Roberto, who is 41 years old, lives happily with his wife, 15-year old daughter, and 18-year-old son. Roberto is a very hard-working father and wants to provide the best for his children. Roberto has been a barber for the past 6 years and has set up a barbershop in his home where he provides hairdressing services every day. That is how Robert takes care of his children's basic needs. Roberto previously requested a loan from FUSAI with which he was able to buy safety razors, hair clippers, razor blades, and scissors among other things. This allowed him to offer better service to his clients and also attracted more customers to his barbershop which earned him more income for which he and his family are very happy. So, Robert is requesting another loan from FUSAI to change the metal sheeting on the roof and walls because they are worn out. This will enable him to provide better living conditions to his children. He will buy: sheeting, wood and nails to change to sheeting on the walls and roof.

loans.use: to invest in metal sheeting, wood and nails to change the sheeting on the walls and roof.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in oil, cassava, flour, eggs, and dairy products among others, to stock her store and to sell bread.

loans.name: Qurbon

texts.en:
Qurbon is a hardworking man. He was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1970. He is living in big district with his family. He is married and has two children. He is a master at constructing houses.

He had a dream to educate his children at higher education institutes and get knowledge. He tried his best to educate them in secondary school to get an elementary education. This year his daughter graduated from high school and entered the university. She studies at road specialty. She is an active, bright and communicable student among other students and friends. She wants to work in her country for social change and the prosperity of her nation.

Qurbon wishes his daughter’s dream can come true. He appealed to get a loan from IMON and KIVA lenders to pay for his daughter’s education costs.

He hopes to be supported and awaits KIVA lenders compassion.

loans.use: to pay for his daughter’s education costs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to obtain dental work.

loans.name: The Lamp Solidarity Group

texts.en:
This is The Lamp Solidarity Group of Fatmata. She is the leader of The Lamp Solidarity Group, which is made up of four members. All four members, including Fatmata, are engaged in small trading, but each is selling different products.

Fatmata, who is 45 years old, was unanimously appointed to lead the group because of her wealth of experience in managing people. She sells dry fire wood. Fatmata has been selling fire wood for the past ten years. She uses the proceeds of her business to pay fees for her children’s education and to provide a livelihood for her family.

Fatmata and other group members of The Lamp Solidarity Group are requesting for a total of 4,000,000 SLL. Of this amount, Fatmata will personally receive 1,000,000 SLL, which she will use to purchase 10 piles of fire wood for her business.

Fatmata stands on the left in the picture. Fatmata is married and has a cheerful family of six children, whose ages are 30, 28, 26, 20, 18 and 15 years.

Fatmata hopes that her business continues to exist so that she can save enough money to build a dwelling house and also prepare for her old age. Fatmata hopes that this loan will earn her more profit for her to support her family Fatmata and her group members thank you for financing their businesses.

loans.use: to purchase 10 piles of fire wood for her business.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim is a Babban Gona farmer from Dauro Village. He joined Babban Gona so that he could create better yields on his farm. Since joining Babban Gona, Ibrahim no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to feed his family and children. Through Babban Gona’s input loan he will have access to top of the range farm inputs such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the national average in Nigeria. This will see him increase his income considerably. This season Ibrahim has ambitious plans to yield 80 bags of maize. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Ibrahim now has the opportunity to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farmer’s yields

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim is a Babban Gona maize farmer from  Maimai Village. He joined Babban Gona to expand his farm and grow his agricultural business. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Ibrahim will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Ibrahim now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings to move into a better home with his family.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farm yields.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a married woman. She has two children. She operates a retail business where she sells cows. She has been involved in this business for five years.

Her business is located in a strategic place, and her primary customers are butcheries. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital.

She will use the KES 21,000 loan to buy a water tank to store water for domestic use. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a water tank to store water

loans.name: Cesar Antonio

texts.es:
Cesar tiene 42 años de edad, vive con su conyuge y sus dos hijos en una zona rural del distrito de Cayaltí que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Cesar se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como pollos, gallinas, patos, pavos, entre otros, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio.Ademas de este negocio se dedica al transporte de pasajeros (mototaxi) en los alrededores de Cayalti. Cuenta con 10 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que solicita será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales como gallinas, patos, pavos, pollos, entre otros, así como para la compra de alimento balanceado para estos. Con esto Cesar espera ofrecer un mejor producto a sus clientes lo que le va a permitir generar mayores ingresos y por ende incrementará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Cesar is 42 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a rural area in the district of Cayaltí which is located in the province of Chiclayo, in the region of Lambayeque, on the north coast of Peru. The inhabitants of this district work primarily in agriculture, livestock, and sales.

Cesar raises and sells young animals like chickens, hens, ducks, turkeys, etc. His business is located in his own home. He also transports passengers by mototaxi in the outskirts of Cayalti. He has 10 years of experience in the business and very good personal and professional references in the area.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy more animals such as hens, ducks, turkeys, chickens, etc., as well as a balanced diet for them. With this, Cesar hopes to offer better products to his customers which will allow him to earn more income and thereby raise his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more animals, as well as a balanced diet for them.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda lives in Talibon, Bohol. She is married with five children. Three of them are still dependents. She provides for them by selling bags, clothes and shoes. Her business provides her the income that she needs.

Merlinda wants to expand her business to generate more income, but she needs funds to do it. She is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy clothes, shoes and bags. With the loan, Merlinda will be able to make her business sustainable and productive.

Merlinda wants to earn more so that she will have the financial capacity to send her children to school for learning. She believes that education is important for a bright future.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes and bags

loans.name: Exilda

texts.es:
Exilda tiene 43 años de edad, es casada, vive con su esposo y su hija en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotun que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Exilda se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como pollos, gallinas, patos, pavos, entre otros, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Cuenta con 10 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que solicita será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales como gallinas, patos, pavos, pollos, entre otros, así como para la compra de alimento balanceado para estos. Con esto Exilda espera ofrecer un mejor producto a sus clientes lo que le va a permitir generar mayores ingresos y por ende incrementará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Exilda is 43 years old and married. She lives with her husband and daughter in a rural area of the district of Oyotun, which is located in the province of Chiclayo in the Lambayeque region of Peru's northern coast. The residents of this district earn their livings mainly in farming, ranching, and commerce.

Exilda earns her living raising and selling young animals like fryer chickens, hens, ducks, turkeys, and more. Her business is located in her own residence. She has 10 years of experience in the business and very good personal and work-related references in the area. The loan she is requesting will be used to purchase a larger quantity of animals, like hens, ducks, turkeys, fryer chickens, and more, as well pelleted feed for them. With this, Exilda expects to offer a better product to her customers, which will allow her to generate greater income and thereby increase her quality of life, as well as that of her family.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of animals to fatten and sell

loans.name: Abahuje Group

texts.en: Eugenie is a group leader and she is 45 years old. She is married with 2 children, aged 9 and 12 years who go to school. The group is called ABAHUJE, which means “SAME MISSION” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their business to achieve a better future. She sells foodstuffs and has been running in a business for 10 years. With the loan, she would like to buy bananas and sorghum to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of her children and renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy bananas and sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Las Ochenteras Group

texts.es:
María, tiene 32 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposo con quien tiene un hijo y reside en una aldea del municipio de Jutiapa, Atlantida.  Ella lleva 5 años de dedicarse al comercio vendiendo ropa como jeans, camisas, short, camisetas, vestidos  etc. Además vende productos plásticos como vasos, platos, bandejas y otros que le genera otros ingresos. Los productos son vendidos de forma ambulante y entrega a domicilio. Ha decidido solicitar un prestamo en forma grupal junto con dos personas más para utilizarlo en la compra de mercadería como es jeans, camisetas, camisas, blusas, productos plásticos y con una pequeña parte piensa saldar una deuda personal que tiene y consolidar una sola deuda con ODEF. Considera que su negocio va estar mejor surtido y aumentará las ventas y los ingresos. Su meta sigue siendo la de trabajar mucho para ayudar al hogar y a mejorar la condición de vida con su familia.  
El grupo al que pertenece se llama Las Ochenteras, formado por 3 integrantes vecinas, que se dedican al comercio con la venta de mercadería y han decidido solicitar un prestamo por 85,000 Lempiras. En la foto esta María Dominga  a la izquierda, Estela y María Olimpia a la derecha.
texts.en:
María is 32 years old and lives in a village in the municipality of Jutiapa, Atlantida, with her husband to whom she has a son.

She has worked for five years in commercial sales selling clothes such as jeans, shirts, shorts, t-shirts and dresses. She also sells plastic goods such as cups, plates, trays and other products that generate other income. The products are sold via street markets and door to door.

She has decided to apply for a group loan together with two other people in order to purchase goods such as jeans, t-shirts, shirts, blouses and plastic products. With a small part of the loan she plans to settle a personal debt and consolidate it into a single debt with ODEF.

She believes her business will be better stocked and that this will increase sales and revenue. Her goal continues being to work hard, support the household and improve her family's quality of life.

She belongs to a group called Las Ochenteras, which consists of 3 neighbouring members, who earn a living through the sale of commercial merchandise. They have decided to apply for a loan of 85,000 lempiras.

The photo shows María Dominga on the left, Estela and María Olimpia on the right.

loans.use: to buy goods such as jeans, t-shirts, shirts, blouses and plastic products with a small part of the loan going towards settling a personal debt.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria, 34, from the Nyaminyami District of Zimbabwe, is married with three children and is a strong businesswoman. She has gone through several ups and downs trying to raise funds for her family. She started a poultry business in 2010 as there were very few suppliers of chickens in her area. She is now a reliable supplier of chickens to her entire community. She used some of the profits to complete their shop since they were renting a shop. Right now they have moved to their own building and they are also still renting the shop that they were renting before they completed their own shop. Using the profits from her business she has also diversified into a grocery shop and she hopes to get a second loan so that she can purchase more groceries for resale.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries for resale.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a 47-year-old married mother of five children who has been working at mouneh production (pickles and preserves) and selling since 2005. She is a good supporter of her family, who makes sure to stay alonside her husband in covering their family's increasing living needs.

Mariam is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua in order to support her son by paying for his travel expenses. He plans to seek a better future and education abroad.
It is hard for her to send her children abroad and live without them, but she looks at the bright side knowing they are going to find a better future and education.

She is working hard on developing her business to open her own mouneh selling shop in the future.

loans.use: to support her son by paying for his travel expenses to seek a better future and education abroad.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is 45 years old. She is married and a mother of four children. Her business is a retail shop. She has been in this business for five years, and earns a monthly income of thirty-five thousand shillings.

This is her fifth loan with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy sugar, salt, sodas, cooking oil, soap, etc. for sale in the shop.

She will use the profits from expanded business to service the loan and increase her savings so as to borrow a bigger loan next round. Her hopes and dreams are to have a stable business and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, sodas, cooking oil, soap, etc. for sale in the shop.

loans.name: Marichu

texts.en:
Marichu is a married woman aged 41 years old and a resident of the town of Talibon, Bohol. She owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells basic commodities including biscuits, chips, seasonings, canned goods, noodles, soap and other goods. She has been running a sari-sari store for the last 10 years.

She has requested a loan in the amount of PHP 10,000 to buy school supplies, canned food and candies. This way, her earnings will improve and enable her to set aside some amount for savings.

She hopes that her current livelihood will expand and become more sustainable in the near future.

loans.use: to buy school supplies, canned food and candies

loans.name: Uamusho Kawizi Group

texts.fr: Après avoir constaté que la culture du tomate est rentable grâce à l'expérience de nos parents, nous avons jugé bon de continuer cette activité, nous dit Migani. Il a pu réaliser au cours de la saison précédente un gain de cent quatre-vingt dollars après déduction de coût d'exploitation. Souvent limité par l'insuffisance de moyens financiers et les maladies de plantes, il souhaite élargir son espace cultural afin de capitaliser par une bonne production dont les revenus lui permettront de scolariser ses enfants et d'améliorer son niveau de vie. Président du groupe UWAMUSHO KAWIZI, sur photo MIGANI est l'homme un peu en retrait en deuxième position de gauche à droite.
texts.en:
Migani told us, "After realizing that growing tomatoes is profitable based on our parents' experience, we thought it would be a good idea to continue this work."

After taking into account farming costs, he was able to make a profit of $180 during the last growing season. Often limited by financial constraints and sick plants, he hopes to expand his farming land in order to be able to capitalize on good production. His profits will allow him to pay for his children's schooling and improve his standards of living. 

Migani is the president of the Uwamusho Kawizi Group. He is man second from the left, standing slightly in the back of the photo.

loans.use: to transplant, maintain, buy crop protection products and fertilizer
